summary: This role focuses on improving PHC's health services business processes and systems by identifying, analyzing, and recommending improvements. The position involves collaborating with finance, IT, and data warehouse teams to develop and support organization-wide reporting. Responsibilities include gathering and documenting report requirements, designing, building, and administering reporting solutions, and developing ad-hoc reports.  This role also participates in the design and development of the reporting infrastructure using SQL Server technologies and BI reporting tools.

title: Perioperative Informatics & Business Analysis Coordinator
description: Description Under general supervision from the Perioperative Systems Business Manager, Director of Perioperative Services, and Executive Director of Perioperative Services, this position is responsible for ensuring the accuracy of daily charges for time, room, supplies and implants, and confirms all interfaces are working successfully so that patient billing is completed. This person coordinates the development and update of the electronic medical record (EMR) and related clinical and business systems. This position is responsible for managing the perioperative procedure dictionary and supports the development and update of all preference cards. This person works collaboratively with Supply Chain, Chargemaster Coordinator and Finance to ensure data integrity of the perioperative documentation. On a monthly basis this position will provide statistical data to finance and will provide ad-hoc reports to various departments as requested. They will work collaboratively with Perioperative Leadership, Perioperative Staff, the Clinical Informatics team, and personnel from other departments to complete coordinated projects. This position is responsible for the planning, testing, training, adoption, use, and ongoing evolution of the EMR and business systems at Torrance Memorial Medical Center. The Perioperative Clinical Informatics Coordinator serves as a liaison between practicing clinicians and Information Technology (IT) staff to improve the EMR and related clinical and business systems. The Perioperative Clinical Informatics Coordinator strives to further their understanding of both clinical and technical operational processes and incorporates this knowledge to execute best practices in both the clinical and IT disciplines. Core Competencies Provides comprehensive perioperative support of the perioperative EMR and other clinical information systems to ensure integrity of all associated databases, required updates and follow up to ensure ongoing functionality. Provides end-user support to clinicians to ensure appropriate use and functionality of clinical information systems including, but not limited to Cerner and Lawson applications. Participates in the development and integration of clinical systems in relationship to perioperative documentation processes and tools Develops, evaluates and revises, in conjunction with hospital administration, clinical experts, IT and clinical Informatics workgroups, clinical documentation processes and tools/reports to support operational improvement processes, accuracy of perioperative documentation for compliance with regulatory bodies, and timely, appropriate billing processes to support revenue cycle. Partners with organizational leadership to monitor and audit clinical documentation for compliance with regulatory standards and to support revenue cycle initiatives. Works with appropriate perioperative leadership to identify and develop countermeasures to support clinician compliance. Reconciles system functionality daily to ensure all revenue cycle processes were executed, triages and identifies system interface issues, escalates and involves appropriate leadership and department personnel on problem resolution in a timely manner. Ensures that clinical documentation system updates or changes that affect nursing workflow and essential business functions is communicated with appropriate leadership and staff in a timely manner. Initiates follow up to ensure all changes are compliant and sustained. Provides support to all departments within perioperative services to evaluate and identify problem areas in regard to clinical documentation and business processes. Routinely works with the clinical informatics team to ensure coordinated efforts are accomplished. Maintains a working knowledge of applicable federal, state, local, and private laws and regulation in relationship to protected health information of clinical documentation and electronic medical records. Utilizes appropriate and effective communication and problem solving skills in all interpersonal interactions. Provides monthly statistical reports to support organizational business operations to multiple end users including but not limited to Finance, Supply Chain, Infection Prevention and Perioperative Leadership. Provides ad-hoc reports to support unit level or other organizational process decisions relative to staffing, supply costs and documentation audits. Analyzes results and supports problem resolution and countermeasures to support organizational goals. Maintains the integrity of the Perioperative Procedure dictionary and supports the development, standardization and maintenance of Preference Cards. Works closely and collaboratively with Supply Chain, Revenue Cycle and the Chargemaster Coordinator to ensure all additions and updates to Lawson, the Organization Charge Master and Cerner are completed in a timely manner to support Revenue Cycle billing requirements. Demonstrates knowledge of clinical norms for the following age groups as applicable to job functions: Infancy: Birth -1-year Toddler: 1 year -3 years-school: 3 years -6 years School Age: 6 years -12 years Adolescent: 12 years -18 years Adulthood: 19 years -64 years Older Adult: 65 years >Demonstrates competency in interpersonal relationships with the following age groups as applicable to job function. Education Degree Program BachelorsHealthcare Admin, Business, Finance Supply Chain Compensation Range $39.26 - $63.22 / Hour
summary: The Perioperative Clinical Informatics Coordinator is responsible for ensuring the accuracy of daily charges for perioperative services, managing the electronic medical record (EMR) and related clinical and business systems, and supporting the development and update of preference cards. They work collaboratively with various departments to ensure data integrity and provide statistical reports and ad-hoc reports as needed. They also serve as a liaison between clinicians and IT staff to improve the EMR.

title: Salesforce Business Systems Analyst (Marketing BSA)
description: Title: Salesforce Business Systems Analyst (Marketing BSA) Location: Remote 6 months Contract What You Will Do * Manage Sales technology projects and related impacts on GTM systems: developing requirements, designing functional solutions and prototypes, & testing. Ensure projects are completed with agreed upon scope, on time, within budget. * Collaborate with business partners to establish and document user stories, current and desired business processes, and functional requirements. * Deep experience in Solution design of Campaign to Opportunity processes, Lead Generation and Management, Campaign attribution tracking. * Advance understanding of Salesforce Flow automations and its capabilities, and related setup configuration with clear vision on how to design solutions for complex business use cases. * Effectively convey business requirements to technical teams to facilitate custom development and testing. * Contribute to cross-functional projects involving technical development, including Salesforce integration with native or 3rd party applications. * Foster collaboration with internal Business Systems Analysts to review and identify overlaps in requirements internally with other BSA’s, and propose relevant technical solutions. * Be a trusted advisor and consultant to the Marketing department and make recommendations for improvements to systems and processes to make processes and workflows more efficient and automated. * Create, maintain, and prioritize the product backlog according to business value through the life of the projects. * Assisting with the elaboration of epics, themes, and features into user stories that are small enough, or granular enough, to be achieved in a single sprint. * Participating in Daily scrum, sprint planning meetings, reveals, and retrospectives – inspecting the product progress at the end of every sprint to accept or reject the work that has been done by the team * Demonstrate leadership and technical expertise by presenting tailored solutions to solve complex business requirements on the Salesforce platform and ecosystem * Create and maintain detailed technical documentation based on design specifications. * Take ownership of functional tasks and deliverables for the Salesforce Sales Cloud application, encompassing areas such as testing, training, reporting, support, and ongoing enhancements. * Use and recommend best practices while delivering scalable high quality solutions. * Providing support for production issues, including fixes across platforms and on-call responsibilities working with the production support team to ensure 24x7 availability of production systems. Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience * Bachelor's degree (technical degree preferred) * 5+ years of experience implementing, configuring and administering SaaS business systems for a software company, with at least 3 years of Salesforce Sales and/or Marketing Cloud experience. * Proficient in the use of Salesforce Data Loader, Workbench and Excel to support data analysis & quality initiatives. * Detail-oriented, organized, self-motivated, hard working, and a great team player with excellent interpersonal skills * Excellent written and verbal communication skills required, including experience meeting with and presenting information to senior leadership * Salesforce.com certifications (Administrator, Advanced Administrator, Sales Cloud Consultant) * Passion for creating a frictionless end-user experience * Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving scenario * Strong knowledge and understanding of the Salesforce.com platform, ecosystem and best-practices
summary: This is a remote 6-month contract position for a Salesforce Business Systems Analyst (Marketing BSA). The role involves managing Sales technology projects, collaborating with business partners on requirements and solutions, and designing Salesforce solutions for complex use cases. The ideal candidate will have 5+ years of experience implementing, configuring, and administering SaaS business systems, with at least 3 years of Salesforce Sales and/or Marketing Cloud experience.

title: Business System Analyst -- Remote --
description: About Us At the company, we are dedicated to fostering a community that champions equity, inclusivity, and opportunity. We strive to ensure that everyone, regardless of background, feels valued, respected, and empowered. Our commitment to openness, innovation, and belonging creates a unique environment for students, faculty, and staff alike. The company is a renowned institution of higher education, globally recognized for its academic and research excellence, diverse student body, and unwavering dedication to equity and social justice. Grounded in the California ethos, we embody values of innovation, environmental stewardship, and challenging the status quo. Since our inception in 1868, The company has continuously generated immense intellectual, economic, and social value, both locally and globally. We welcome applicants who reflect the rich diversity of California and who understand and appreciate the multifaceted nature of our community. Joining the company means becoming part of an inclusive, forward-thinking, and equity-driven community that views higher education as a catalyst for social change, requiring collaboration among faculty, staff, students, and community partners. We encourage prospective candidates to align their values with our Guiding Values and Principles, our Principles of Community, and our Strategic Plan. At the company, we believe that learning is integral to professional growth. To support this belief, we provide all staff with a minimum of 80 hours (10 days) of paid time annually for professional development activities. Department Overview The Controller's Office oversees various financial services at the company, including financial accounting, accounts receivable, accounts payable, reimbursement, contracts and grants accounting, and payroll. Additionally, the Controller's Office provides business systems analyst support for the PeopleSoft Financials system, encompassing modules such as General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Expenses, Purchasing, Commitment Control, Accounts Receivable, Billing, Contracts, Grants, and Project Costing. Working closely with IT development partners, our Business Systems Analyst team aims to continuously enhance and improve the PeopleSoft Financials system and associated applications. This involves gathering requirements, conducting gap analysis, designing, testing, and implementing new features to ensure optimal functionality throughout the fiscal cycle. Position Summary This position primarily supports the implementation of PeopleSoft Expense and will transition to a Production Support role after system implementation. Application Review Date The initial review date for this position is Wednesday, May 29, 2024. Responsibilities Scoping: Utilize PeopleSoft Financials and Supply Chain Management expertise to identify, evaluate, and define complex system scope and objectives, aligning with end-user needs. Design and Testing: Develop complex system solutions and procedures, create specifications, and execute system and integration acceptance testing. Stakeholder Engagement: Gather and analyze requirements, prepare recommendations, and negotiate with stakeholders on specifications. Requirements Gathering and Fit Gap Analysis: Document business and user needs, conduct fit gap analysis, and provide support and training on new functionality. Change Management: Develop system training documentation and change plans for new feature adoption. Required Qualifications Thorough knowledge of PeopleSoft Expenses and at least one other PeopleSoft module. Strong understanding of PeopleSoft Query tool and Financials table structure. Familiarity with industry standards and best practices for business analysts. Proficiency in process and systems requirement documentation. Effective communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in diverse teams. Problem-solving skills and ability to meet deadlines. Knowledge of accounting business processes and procedures. Testing and test planning skills. Education/Training Bachelor's degree in accounting, management information systems, or related field; or equivalent experience/training. Preferred Qualifications Experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies. Familiarity with JIRA. Salary & Benefits This position offers a competitive salary range of $90,000.00 - $120,000.00 annually, commensurate with experience and qualifications. This is a full-time, exempt position eligible for UC benefits, including remote work flexibility. Employment Type: Full-Time
summary: This position supports the implementation of PeopleSoft Expenses and will transition to a Production Support role after system implementation. Responsibilities include defining complex system scope, developing system solutions, gathering and analyzing requirements, conducting fit gap analysis, and developing training documentation.  The ideal candidate has thorough knowledge of PeopleSoft Expenses, strong understanding of PeopleSoft Query tool, familiarity with industry standards and best practices for business analysts, and proficiency in process and systems requirement documentation.

title: Staff Business Systems Analyst
description: Title: Staff Business Systems Analyst Location: San Diego or Bay Area, CA Duration: Fulltime/Contract Job Description: Education: Bachelors degree in Accounting with minimum of 7-10 years of functional finance/business systems experience or equivalent experience. Experience: At least five to seven years of Billing, Quote to Cash, Revenue, Accounting, Financial system implementation experience, with experience on requirements documentation, solution review and testing validation as a functional lead Experience on Oracle BRM, RevStream, Partner Revshare systems and Oracle R12 or similar systems (such as Zuora, Billing Platform, Oracle Revenue Cloud etc.) preferred Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Skills particularly important to success are- Accounting and financial domain knowledge. Deep understanding of AR, Revenue and Deferred revenue accounting and associated transactional flow Strong “systems and process orientation” with demonstrated analytical thinking, organizational skills and problem solving skills Project management skills with a proven track record of delivering projects Excellent written and verbal communications, presentation and influencing skills, including the ability to raise issues appropriately to the right level internally and externally to resolve Able to speak “accounting” and “technical” languages for the right audiences Ability to influence people and indirectly manage a team of people to ensure the effective execution of complex initiatives Ability to navigate complexity well and demonstrated experience managing across functions to accomplish large scale goals Must be comfortable working in cross-functional teams and willing to voice their opinion Must be savvy to understand both business/accounting needs and the technologies to implement them Have experience identifying systemic and process risks and how to mitigate those discoveries How you will lead
summary: This job posting seeks a Staff Business Systems Analyst with a strong accounting background and extensive experience in billing, quote-to-cash, revenue, and financial systems implementation.  The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of AR, Revenue, and Deferred Revenue accounting and have experience working with Oracle BRM, RevStream, Partner Revshare systems, and Oracle R12 or similar platforms.

title: Senior Business Systems Analyst
description: The Sr Business Systems Analyst will assure that validated computerized systems are implemented, maintained, and obsoleted in a state of compliance. Assess the performance of regulated systems. Lead, drive and own projects and ensure effective communications and cross collaborations with the business on various Computerized Systems Validation initiatives and projects. Any communications or cross collaborations with the business are to be done by Level III and above. The Sr level will also work closely with the Manager to assist with training and mentoring more junior level CSVS and Business Analyst. What You'll Work On Work closely with management to support other quality engineering initiatives to drive them down throughout the team. Work on multiple projects and meet timelines, requiring expert multitasking skills and ability to prioritize work effectively. Create documentation to support the design and development of solutions, such as, but not limited to, user stories, business/product requirements documents (BRD/PRD), functional and non-functional specifications and documentation (FRD), acceptance criteria, product roadmaps, and to-be process flows and traceability matrices, meeting notes, gap analysis, etc. Adhere to the Company’s Quality Management System (QMS) as well as domestic and global quality system regulations, standards, and procedures. Manage and execute the deviation process during execution of testing. Author deviation form content. Work with the customer to resolve deviations recorded during test execution or system modifications. Apply knowledge of quality engineering principles to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and impart that knowledge to junior level CSVS. Work closely with the SWQ Manager to collaborate with cross functional team to identify, prioritize and execute business critical quality initiatives. Ensure other members of the department follow the QMS, regulations, standards, and procedures. Manage conflict resolutions both transparently and proactively by continually informing manager, team, and client of progress, issues, and concerns. Work with end-users across the organization, to gather, understand, prioritize, and define business requirements, leveraging Medical Device, Pharmaceutical experience and best-practice methods and collaborating and seeking guidance from stakeholders. Provide quality support to development, engineering and manufacturing functions for design control and transfer activities. Facilitate and participate in internal development team’s quality reviews of requirements to ensure they are complete, consistent, comprehensible, feasible, and conform to standards and align with client business objectives. Drive/assist the development of business strategies, as appropriate, to guide clients and inform requirements. What You'll Bring Bachelor’s degree required, in engineering, computer science, or related discipline with 12+ years related experience, preferably in the medical device, pharmaceutical, or similar FDA-regulated industry, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Required to have advanced knowledge of Quality Engineering Principals and Regulatory Environment such as: 21CFR11, 21CFR820, Annex 11, ISO 13485, 21CFR210, 21CFR212, HIPAA/PHI, SOX, GDPR Experience with the installation, configuration, validation, and maintenance of regulated software such as Quality Management Systems, Learning Management Systems, and Clinical Trial Management Systems Expert knowledge of GAMP guidelines, 21 CFR Part 11, and FDA requirements and expectations for validated systems preferred. Strong oral, written and interpersonal communication skills. Strong leadership skills with ability to work effectively within a cross-functional team. Excellent organizational skills with ability to prioritize assignments while handling various projects simultaneously. Working Conditions General office environment. Business travel from 0% - 10%. Potential exposure to blood-borne pathogens. Requires some lifting and moving of up to 25 pounds. The employee is frequently required to stand, walk, sit, and reach with hands and arms, and to use a computer, sitting for extended periods. Specific vision abilities required by this job include the ability to read, close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, and depth perception. Alameda, CA Starting Base Salary is $132,430/year - $188,053/year. Individual compensation will vary over time-based on factors such as performance, skill level, competencies, work location and shift. What We Offer A collaborative teamwork environment where learning is constant, and performance is rewarded. The opportunity to be part of the team that is revolutionizing the treatment of some of the world's most devastating diseases. A generous benefits package for eligible employees that includes medical, dental, vision, life, AD&D, short and long-term disability insurance, 401(k) with employer match, an employee stock purchase plan, paid parental leave, eleven paid company holidays per year, a minimum of fifteen days of accrued vacation per year, which increases with tenure, and paid sick time in compliance with applicable law(s). Penumbra, Inc., headquartered in Alameda, California, is a global healthcare company focused on innovative therapies. Penumbra designs, develops, manufactures, and markets novel products and has a broad portfolio that addresses challenging medical conditions in markets with significant unmet need. Penumbra sells its products to hospitals and healthcare providers primarily through its direct sales organization in the United States, most of Europe, Canada, and Australia, and through distributors in select international markets. The Penumbra logo is a trademark of Penumbra, Inc. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. If you reside in the State of California, please also refer to Penumbra's Privacy Notice for California Residents. For additional information on Penumbra’s commitment to being an equal opportunity employer, please Penumbra's AAP Policy Statement.
summary: A Sr Business Systems Analyst is needed to ensure that computerized systems are implemented, maintained, and obsoleted in a state of compliance, assess the performance of regulated systems, lead and drive projects, and work closely with management to support other quality engineering initiatives. This position requires advanced knowledge of Quality Engineering Principals and Regulatory Environment, experience with validated software, and strong communication and leadership skills. Responsibilities include creating documentation, managing the deviation process, applying knowledge of quality engineering principles, collaborating with cross-functional teams, gathering and understanding business requirements, facilitating quality reviews, and driving the development of business strategies.

title: Sr Salesforce Business Analyst
description: Job Description Providing for loved ones, planning rewarding retirements, saving enough for whatever lies ahead – our policyholders count on us to be there when it matters most. It’s a big ask, but it’s one that we have the power to deliver when we work together. We collaborate and innovate – pushing one another to transform not just Pacific Life, but the entire industry for the better. Why? Because it’s the right thing to do. Pacific Life is more than a job, it’s a career with purpose. It’s a career where you have the support, balance, and resources to make a positive impact on the future – including your own. We’re actively seeking a talented Sr Salesforce Business Analyst to join our team in Newport Beach, CA or Omaha, NE. This role is hybrid. We believe in empowering our employees to get work done both in and out of the office. As part of our team, you’ll be responsible for the Salesforce application and user experience for the Institutional Retirement Solution Group (IRSG). You’ll also train internal IRSG team members and key stakeholders in utilizing Salesforce CRM. Additionally, your role involves creating and maintaining reports and dashboards for the IRSG organization, as well as collaborating with Marketing to utilize Salesforce for creating marketing campaigns. How You’ll Help Move Us Forward Salesforce Systems Analysis (60%) Gather and understand business stakeholder needs. Work with key internal and external stakeholders to refine and build the IRSG experience for Salesforce. Show your proficiency with the Salesforce platform, including ability to perform basic Salesforce configuration, lead development of Proof of Concept (POC) solutions, and demo software features and capabilities to stakeholders. Support workflow management for all of the IRSG products in Salesforce. Perform QA testing for iterative development cycles across various Salesforce projects. Provide excellent operational support, including managing and supporting migration of data from spreadsheets and old databases into Salesforce, research and troubleshooting issues, and supporting new user onboarding and training. Develop and document training guides, and obtain feedback from the IRSG team for pre and post-sale functions. Continually look for opportunities to implement process efficiencies and streamline the Salesforce experience. Work closely with Marketing for Salesforce marketing campaigns. Business Intelligence within Salesforce (30%) Build dashboards and reporting within Salesforce for the IRSG team to make data-driven business decisions. Provide product and department level reports for internal reporting: Monthly Sales Reports Quarterly Business Review Early trends, insights and pipeline reporting Coordinate and provide reports to external requestors: LIMRA Consultant quarterly sales requests Ad Hoc Projects (10%) Assist and contribute to ad hoc projects as assigned by Manager, Director, Sr. Director or VP. (10%) The Experience You Bring 5+ years of experience in translating business needs into effective software solutions, in the role of a Business Analyst or Systems Analyst. 2+ years of hands-on experience building reports and dashboards. 2+ years of hands-on experience with Salesforce Sales or Service Clouds. Strong analytical, organizational and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work independently and multi task. What Makes You Stand Out Strong data and project management experience, and proficiency with related tools. Insurance Industry experience, including knowledge of defined benefit and defined contribution plans. Achieved or in the process of earning Salesforce certifications. Excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills. Bachelor’s degree in business administration, marketing, finance or related field. Base Pay Range The base pay range noted represents the company’s good faith minimum and maximum range for this role at the time of posting. The actual compensation offered to a candidate will be dependent upon several factors, including but not limited to experience, qualifications and geographic location. Also, most employees are eligible for additional incentive pay. $118,800.00 - $145,200.00 Your Benefits Start Day 1 Your wellbeing is important to Pacific Life, and we’re committed to providing you with flexible benefits that you can tailor to meet your needs. Whether you are focusing on your physical, financial, emotional, or social wellbeing, we’ve got you covered. Prioritization of your health and well-being including Medical, Dental, Vision, and Wellbeing Reimbursement Account that can be used on yourself or your eligible dependents Generous paid time off options including: Paid Time Off, Holiday Schedules, and Financial Planning Time Off Paid Parental Leave as well as an Adoption Assistance Program Competitive 401k savings plan with company match and an additional contribution regardless of participation EEO Statement Pacific Life Insurance Company is an Equal Opportunity /Affirmative Action Employer, M/F/D/V. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request an accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access our career center as a result of your disability. To request an accommodation, contact a Human Resources Representative at Pacific Life Insurance Company.
summary: Pacific Life is seeking a Sr Salesforce Business Analyst to join their team in Newport Beach, CA or Omaha, NE. The role is hybrid and involves gathering business needs, refining the Salesforce experience, configuring the platform, creating POC solutions, and supporting workflow management for IRSG products. The candidate will also build dashboards and reports within Salesforce for data-driven decisions, create reports for internal and external stakeholders, and contribute to ad hoc projects as assigned.

Our goal is to assist emerging Bio-Pharma companies to bring their products on the market faster. We provide a clinical and commercial data management platform on the cloud that gives our clients a head start, saving them time and money. title: Healthcare Group Benefits - New Business Analyst
description: Amwins Connect is a dynamic sales, marketing, and service organization dedicated to the success of health insurance brokers, carriers, and partners throughout the United States. Our mission is to seamlessly connect every point of the benefits journey for brokers, carriers, and their clients with continuous innovation and extraordinary service from passionate people. At Amwins our people are our greatest asset. We hire the best talent in the industry and provide our employees with the tools to deliver innovative insurance solutions. Here, talent is valued, success is celebrated, and great teamwork defines our culture. Our collaborative environment is the perfect place for you to contribute meaningful national strategies in a rapidly growing organization. Join our Amwins Connect team as a New Business Analyst in Southern California! This position is hybrid. Qualified candidates must reside in Southern California ( Orange County, Los Angeles, or San Diego area) Position Summary This position is accountable for underwriting all new Small Group ACA business for the entire group of Carrier Partners that we represent. This role effectively collaborates across all areas to ensure a positive customer experience that leads to sales results. The central purpose of this position is to provide a customer-centric focus, model purposeful leadership, and drive sales results for RSM, Brokers, Carrier Partners, and Amwins Connect. This role models Purposeful Leadership, defined as: Every action taken delivers the BEST customer experience for our brokers, customers, and co-workers. Responsibilities Provides brokers with timely, solution-orientated responses to their business needs. Salesforce knowledge and understanding of process flow+ Comprehensive review of new business paperwork to qualify the group, employee eligibility and participation and collaboration to find solutions-based results including: Review Master Application Review Legal & Tax Documents/Quarterly Wage Report for eligible W2 employees Analyze sold rate quote for plan/rate accuracy Review Employee Applications / Waivers Gather ID cards (as needed) Create and send Requirement letter to Broker & Sales Team Perform regular follow-ups with Broker as needed Maintain files and update status in Salesforce through lifecycle of each case Package files for submission to carrier and work with carrier partners to advance group to approval Audit approval to verify enrollment, final rates and policy info Attend all Sales Team meetings to collaborate and strategize to drive sales Assist in identifying opportunities for ancillary attachment Coordinate with RSM/BSR and Broker regarding opportunities Evaluate success / room for improvement and communicate with team Qualifications And Licenses Comprehensive database and Carrier guideline knowledge Proficient in MS Office software, especially MS Outlook, intermediate Excel, MS teams Web based audio/video conferencing Salesforce experience preferred EaseCentral experience preferred University degree preferred Competencies Ability to manage competing priorities, and negotiate mutually successful outcomes Detail-oriented, ability to handle variety of tasks Collaborate and Partner effectively with internal and external teams Mentor assigned employees and new hires to develop their full potential Comprehensive organizational skills Clear, professional oral and written communication skill. Strong problem-solving skills and solutions-oriented mind-set Experience Minimum 5 years of related experience; or equivalent of education and experience Insurance agency experience is preferred Inside sales experience is preferred Professional customer service experience strongly preferred Fluent understanding of carrier products and benefits Experienced and clear understanding of underwriting guidelines Snapshot Of What Amwins Provides To Our Team Members Compensation includes a salary commensurate with experience Full benefits package available Most benefits available first day of employment Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) Collaborative, continuing education focused work environment Career advancement opportunities Pursuant to California regulation, the salary range for this position is $75,000 to $90,000 and includes eligibility for performance-based bonuses. title: Sr. Business Systems Analyst
description: Join a team that is changing millions of lives. Transforming smiles, changing lives. At Align Technology, we believe a great smile can transform a person’s life, so we create technology that gives people the confidence to take on whatever’s next. We revolutionized the orthodontic industry with the introduction of the Invisalign system, and we have never lost sight of that spirit of innovation. Our diverse and collaborative teams are constantly pushing the boundaries of what’s possible. Ready to join us? About This Opportunity The Senior Business Systems Analyst will play a crucial role in the analysis, design, implementation, and support of our customer facing web products. This role involves working closely with product management, design and engineering teams to ensure our systems meet business requirements and operate efficiently. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in systems analysis, technical problem-solving, and experience with complex systems. In this role, you will… Partnering with Product Management and Engineering to ensure continuous refinement of backlog, which may include stories from multiple projects. Be responsible for direct interaction with stakeholders including, but not limited to, eliciting comprehensive business requirements and use cases and recommending appropriate solutions. Accurately translates business requirements to detail-level system specifications Deliver precise functional specifications to include functional hierarchy, workflow, business rules, interface definitions and design, and data mapping Engage with Technical Architects and Developers on technical strategy and designs to meet the business needs Conduct gap analysis between application and stated customer requirements and collaborate with Architects and Developers to estimate project impact. Work with Development, QA, and Production Support teams to communicate, verify, and test the desired functionality changes. Work with the stakeholders to demonstrate the changes to the system to ensure all relevant business needs are addressed. Develop training materials and provide training in one-on-one or classroom environment. Manage multiple competing priorities through effective organization and communication. Recommend and institute BA best practice and methodology and tools Work within or across multiple project teams to ensure that blockers are resolved, and communication gaps are plugged quickly and efficiently Ensure quality and completeness of the finished product by participating in user acceptance testing, ensuring that acceptance criteria are met. In this role, you’ll need … Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education/experience in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field with 8+ years of experience Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to quickly understand complex issues and develop effective solutions. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with business and technical stakeholders. Experience with project management methodologies and tools, such as Agile, Scrum, or Waterfall. Experience with database management systems (e.g., PostgreSQL, Oracle) and writing basic SQLs for analysis and data modeling. Knowledge of programming languages (e.g., Java, JavaScript) is a plus. Sound like a good fit? Great! Click the "Apply" link to let us know you are interested. Not the right fit? Don’t worry, Align is quickly growing so we are creating more opportunities to expand our Align family. Please consider joining our Talent Network to receive notifications about future jobs or sharing this opportunity with others in your network. About Align Align Technology is a publicly traded medical device company that is transforming smiles and changing lives. Our global team of talented employees develop innovative technology, tools and treatment options to help dental professionals worldwide achieve the clinical results they expect. Our digital ecosystem combines the power of technology to create beautiful smiles through the integration of AI and machine learning, digital imaging and visualization, biomechanics and material science to develop the Invisalign system, the most advanced clear aligner system in the world; iTero Intraoral Scanners and OrthoCAD digital services. Did you know? Align is the world’s largest manufacturer of custom 3D-printed materials. By joining Align, you will be part of a global, fast-growing company in one of the most dynamic industries. Great people, innovative technologies, and meaningful work – these are just some of the things employees say make Align Technology a great place to work. We respect your privacy. Please review our Applicant Privacy Policies for additional information. Global Diversity Statement At Align, we believe in the power of a smile, and we know that every smile is as unique as our employees. As we grow, we will continue building a workforce of diverse cultural backgrounds and life experiences and fostering a culture of open-mindedness and compassion for all our employees. We live our company values by promoting healthy people and healthy communities. All with the intent of changing millions of lives, one unique smile at a time. Equal Opportunity Statement It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity in all of our employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category. Applicants for positions with Align must be legally authorized to work in the country which they are applying for and verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire. Primary Location Base Salary Range: $151,100 to $178,800 USD Base salary ranges are a guideline used to determine appropriate pay. Placement depends on the individual skills and experience level of a candidate plus the total compensation and equity across team members. For other locations outside of the primary location, the base salary range will be adjusted geographically. For field Sales roles, the salary listed is the base pay only and does not include the applicable commission plan. A cost of living adjustment may be added to base pay for higher cost areas in the U.S. Our internship hourly rates are a standard pay determined based on the position and your location, year in school, degree, and experience.

Identify opportunities for process and system optimization near and mid-term and contribute to long range strategic planning. Minimum Qualifications At least 5 yrs experience in logistics operations Experience using Oracle Fusion, SAP or other ERP platforms for Logistics area Experience in ERP/supply chain systems or business applications implementations. Experience with machine learning, AI and machine predictability solutions. APICS Certification in CPIM or CSCP

Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders to create best-in-class solutions that integrate technology, information, and business processes. Writes detailed descriptions of user needs, program functions, and steps required to develop or modify business systems. Strong analytic, verbal and written communication skills. Detail-oriented with high degree of accuracy and organizational skills. Able to effectively work as a team player as well as independently Excellent investigative, problem resolution, judgment and decision- making skills required. Excellent presentation and consultative skills, working with internal and external clients at various levels in the organization. Reasoning Ability Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. Mathematical Skills Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations. Language Skills Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public. Competencies To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies: Quality - Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; Looks for ways to improve and promote quality; Applies feedback to improve performance; Monitors own work to ensure quality. Quantity - Meets productivity standards; Completes work in timely manner; Strives to increase productivity; Works quickly. Technical Skills - Assesses own strengths and weaknesses; Pursues training and development opportunities; Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills; Shares expertise with others. Dependability - Follows instructions, responds to management direction; Takes responsibility for own actions; Keeps commitments; Commits to long hours of work when necessary to reach goals; Completes tasks on time or notifies appropriate person with an alternate plan. Planning/Organizing - Prioritizes and plans work activities; Uses time efficiently; Plans for additional resources; Sets goals and objectives; Organizes or schedules other people and their tasks; Develops realistic action plans. Teamwork - Balances team and individual responsibilities; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views; Gives and welcomes feedback; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Puts success of team above own interests; Able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives; Supports everyone's efforts to succeed. Professionalism - Approaches others in a tactful manner; Reacts well under pressure; Treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; Accepts responsibility for own actions; Follows through on commitments. Adaptability - Adapts to changes in the work environment; Manages competing demands; Changes approach or method to best fit the situation; Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events. Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Work Location This position must work on-site at the San Diego offices for purposes of providing adequate support to internal clients; being available for face-to-face interactions and coordination of work with other employees, colleagues, clients, or vendors; as well as for facilitation of quick and effective decisions through collaboration with stakeholders. Remote work is not an option for these purposes. Work Environment The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Therefore one must have the flexibility to work beyond traditional hours and be able to work nights, weekends or on holidays as required. This may be changed from time to time to meet the needs of the business. Typical core business hours are Monday through Friday from 8:00am to 5:00pm. Travel This position requires domestic travel of up to 20% of the time. MedImpact offers high-value solutions to payers, providers and consumers of healthcare in the U.S. and foreign markets. summary: MedImpact Healthcare Systems is seeking a Business Systems Analyst to join their team. This role requires excellent customer service skills and interpersonal communication, and involves collaborating with internal and external stakeholders to create solutions that integrate technology, information, and business processes. The Analyst will also be responsible for identifying, planning, developing, implementing, and maintaining business systems solutions that support client operational needs, as well as creating and maintaining project plans and documentation.

title: CoStar Group - Senior Technical Business Analyst
description: Job Description CoStar Group (NASDAQ: CSGP) is a leading global provider of commercial and residential real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Included in the S&P 500 Index and the NASDAQ 100, CoStar Group is on a mission to digitize the world’s real estate, empowering all people to discover properties, insights and connections that improve their businesses and lives. We have been living and breathing the world of real estate information and online marketplaces for over 35 years, giving us the perspective to create truly unique and valuable offerings to our customers. We’ve continually refined, transformed and perfected our approach to our business, creating a language that has become the standard in our industry, for our customers, and even our competitors. We continue that effort today and are always working to improve and drive innovation. This is how we deliver for our customers, our employees, and investors. By equipping the brightest minds with the best resources available, we provide an invaluable edge in real estate. CoStar delivers real-time, verified commercial and residential real estate data that helps clients confidently spot great opportunities and make smart choices ahead of competitors. By combining the power of CoStar’s independent research organization – the industry’s largest – with global data delivery, software, and application solutions, clients can act on opportunities with confidence. The Analytics team is responsible for the development of CoStar's customer-facing Real Estate Analytics products. We think big, creating innovative data-intensive applications that take the vast amount of data collected by our CoStar Research teams to create a fast, reliable and intuitive analytics platform for our customers. We are a collaborative group with a mix of big data, API/platform and front-end skills, and we are growing rapidly to help invent the future of Real Estate Analytics. Our San Diego team is seeking an accomplished Senior Technical Business Analyst to join our team in supporting multiple software products and brands across the organization, such as www.Costar.com. You will have a direct impact on highly visible web applications that touch millions of users. You will continuously learn emerging technologies and architecture advancements and apply these tools to improve our software products. This position is located in San Diego (UTC Area) and offers a hybrid schedule of 3 days onsite, 2 days remote. Responsibilities Understanding the CoStar business, the goals of our products, and collaborating with Product Development and Design in the creation of those products Writing acceptance criteria for user stories that contain key information for the development team to do their work Maintain direct channels of communication with software developers, management, and Product Design to accomplish team goals Responding to analytic specific issues that are raised by internal and external groups Identifying and document business trends utilizing real data that will support new features and applications Holding regular stakeholder/grooming meetings to keep all interested parties updated in project progress Documenting user requirements and business rules to be used in application development Understanding End-To-End test cases at the application and multi-application levels Working directly with QA Staff to ensure comprehensive testing for all areas and provide input as to how to test new features Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree required from an accredited, not for profit university or college A track record of commitment to prior employers Minimum of 5+ years of Product, Systems, or Business analysis experience 2+ years of Product Owner experience is a plus This role is highly self-directed and requires driving outcomes with very little supervision. Documenting detailed product requirements for multiple development teams Documenting requirements for API work a plus Occasionally, creating flow diagrams in a tool such as Visio is required for this role. Agile/Scrum experience is required Preferred Qualifications And Skills Basic SQL database knowledge Advanced Excel knowledge Experience with Agile Development process Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities What’s In It For You When you join CoStar Group, you’ll experience a collaborative and innovative culture working alongside the best and brightest to empower our people and customers to succeed. We offer you generous compensation and performance-based incentives. CoStar Group also invests in your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program. Our Benefits Package Includes (but Is Not Limited To) Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug Life, legal, and supplementary insurance Virtual and in person mental health counseling services for individuals and family Commuter and parking benefits 401(K) retirement plan with matching contributions Employee stock purchase plan Paid time off Tuition reimbursement On-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes Access to CoStar Group’s Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion Employee Resource Groups Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacks We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply. However, please note that CoStar Group is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position. This position offers a base salary range of $100,000 - $178,000, based on relevant skills and experience and includes a generous benefits plan. CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing
summary: CoStar Group seeks a Senior Technical Business Analyst to support multiple software products and brands, including CoStar.com. This role involves writing acceptance criteria for user stories, maintaining communication with developers, identifying business trends, documenting user requirements, and working with QA staff. The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor's degree, 5+ years of product/systems/business analysis experience, 2+ years of Product Owner experience, strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and experience with Agile Development.
benefits: Virtual and in person mental health counseling services
