summary: IT Business Systems Analyst needed for 18 months to gather requirements, analyze data, and develop test plans for Supply Chain and Commercial Manufacturing applications. Strong Azure DevOps, JIRA, MS Visio, and SQA testing experience required.

title: Planisware Project and Resource Management Business Analyst
description: Job Description Target Pay Rate: 60-80/hr **salary will be commensurate with experience Job Description: Planisware project and resource management business analyst This role we will the dual responsibilities of serving as the business analyst in the defining and creating algorithm in the Planisware parametric estimation module using the Max-Min methodology along with the resource forecast analysis, interpretation, and maintenance for the functions. The role will help with the routine monitoring and running of operational data quality checks in support of the project managers. The role will assist in the management and maintenance of the people table module. Serves as the Planisware business analyst for the process improvement and system enhancements. Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: Experience in the Pharmaceutical industry with demonstrated experience in managing and supporting project planning and collaborations tools Project Management experience with a high-level understanding of the best scheduling and reporting practices to support projects and portfolio decisions Demonstrated ability to implement established Project Management methodologies and enterprise systems Experience leading and working within global multifunctional project teams to establish and implement process change and/or develop deploy software solutions Demonstrated ability to effectively prepare, delivery role-based business process training. Experience leading in a matrix environment and collaborating across multiple business units. Cogent and persuasive writing and presentation skills Approaches change with an open mind and proactively seeks the opinions of others. Technical aptitude for enterprise tools such as SharePoint, Teams, Planisware Bachelor’s Degree in engineering, operations, math, or healthcare related discipline CO/NY candidates may not be considered The Planet Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Strong communication skills and experience working with stakeholders during daily activities and requirement gathering Ability to design end to end solutions along with the surrounding systems Excellent documentation skills. Competency in preparing business analysis documents, stories and test cases Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills. Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations. Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills. A history of leading and supporting successful projects. A good communication and teamwork attitude is a must. Responsibilities Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing end to end solutions. Participating in ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies. Staying up-to-date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems. Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings. Updating, implementing, and maintaining the steady state (Keep business running) and enhancement tracks. Performing requirements analysis for these tracks. Documenting and communicating the results of your efforts. Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management. Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports. Working closely with clients, technicians and managerial staff. Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements. Performing user acceptance testing. Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements. Serving as a liaison between stakeholders and users. Managing competing resources and priorities. Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects. Desired Qualifications Bachelor's degree in business or related field or an MBA is nice to have
summary: This job posting is for a Business System Analyst with 10-15 years of experience in business analysis or a related field.  Experience with web application development, API development and Integration processes and systems is required. The role requires strong SQL and PL/SQL knowledge with data mining experience. The ideal candidate will have a bachelor's degree in business or a related field, or an MBA.

company: California Governor's Office of Business and Economic Development (GO-Biz)
title: Small Business Finance Center (SBFC) Analyst
description: Job Description And Duties As a valued member of the California Infrastructure and Economic Development Bank (IBank) team, each employee is expected to report to work regularly and on time; work cooperatively with team members and others; and treat others fairly, honestly and with respect. In addition, each employee is expected to adhere to the highest possible standards for performance and quality of work products, including clarity, coherence and consistency in articulating an overall vision for the incumbent’s area of responsibility. The Associate Governmental Program Analyst (AGPA) of the Small Business Finance Center shall be detail oriented in written documents to ensure maximum effectiveness in communications. Under the supervision of the Staff Services Manager II (Supervisory), the AGPA performs a variety of analytical and contract management work in the support of the Small Business Finance Center Programs. The incumbent works with a high degree of responsibility and self-initiative in carrying out assignments. This position does not make policy decisions. You will find additional information about the job in the Duty Statement . Working Conditions Hybrid: this position is eligible for a hybrid telework schedule and requires reporting in-person at headquarters in Sacramento 2 times a week. Position Details Job Code #: JC-439510 Position #(s): 373-105-5393-703 Working Title: Small Business Finance Center (SBFC) Analyst Classification: ASSOCIATE GOVERNMENTAL PROGRAM ANALYST $5,684.00 - $7,114.00 A # of Positions: 1 Work Location: Sacramento County Telework: Hybrid Job Type: Permanent, Full Time Department Information The Governor's Office of Business and Economic Development (GO-Biz) serves as the State of California's leader for job growth and economic development efforts. GO-Biz offers a range of services to business owners including: attraction, retention and expansion services, site selection, permit streamlining, clearing of regulatory hurdles, small business assistance, international trade development, assistance with state government, and much more. The GO-Biz is committed to enhancing the workforce to improve California's job growth and economic development efforts, through a culture of diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging. All interested candidates are encouraged to apply. Department Website: http://www.business.ca.gov/ Special Requirements Interested individuals must submit a SOQ. Please describe your experience in finance and lending to small businesses and/or nonprofits, or another analogous area of expertise. Please include any experience with credit enhancement programs and stakeholders in the California small business community. Please describe your experience in large scale data collection and analysis. title: Business Systems Analyst / Project Manager - Pacific Southwest Container - Modesto, CA
description: Job Description Senior Business Systems Analyst/ Project Manager Job Summary We are a world-class, ISO 9001 manufacturer of custom packaging. We are a market leader in the design and conversion of corrugated, folding carton, single-face lamination, foam protective packaging and point-of-purchase displays. Our facilities in Modesto and Visalia serve a wide variety of end use customers who value creativity, flexibility, speed to market and best total system cost. We have amazing people who are the driving force, the inspiration, and foundation of our family-owned company. Our thriving culture can be broken down into four components: 360 degrees Health; Teamwork; Quality; and Sustainability. Position Overview The Senior Business Systems Analyst/Project Manager will play a critical role in analyzing business processes, identifying opportunities for improvement, and leading the implementation of new systems and technologies. This position requires a blend of strong analytical skills, project management expertise, and business acumen to ensure the successful delivery of projects on time and within budget. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, proactive, and capable of managing multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. Key Responsibilities Collaborate with key stakeholders to gather and document business requirements for new systems or enhancements to existing systems. Conduct thorough analysis of business processes and workflows to identify inefficiencies and areas for improvement. Develop detailed project plans, timelines, and budgets for system implementation projects, and oversee the execution of project tasks to ensure successful delivery. Serve as the primary point of contact for stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle, providing regular updates on project status, risks, and issues. Coordinate cross-functional teams including IT, business units, and external vendors to ensure alignment and collaboration on project objectives. Facilitate requirements gathering sessions, stakeholder meetings, and user acceptance testing sessions as needed. Manage project scope, timelines, and budgets, and proactively identify and mitigate risks to ensure project success. Provide training and support to end users to ensure successful adoption of new systems and processes. Conduct post-implementation reviews to evaluate project success and identify opportunities for further improvement. Qualifications Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field. Proven experience in business analysis and project management roles, preferably in a technology-driven environment. Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions. Proficiency in project management methodologies and tools, with experience managing projects from initiation to completion. Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively engage and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization. Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time management skills. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously. Experience working with cross-functional teams and external vendors. Knowledge of Agile and/or Waterfall project management methodologies is a plus. Certification in project management (e.g., PMP, PRINCE2) is desirable.
summary: Senior Business Systems Analyst/Project Manager will analyze business processes, identify improvement opportunities, and lead system implementation. The role requires strong analytical skills, project management expertise, and business acumen, with a focus on successful project delivery on time and within budget.

title: Global Retail Operations Analyst
description: At Deckers Brands, Together, Every Step is a promise kept that every employee can bring their authentic self, is valued and supported, as a whole person, at work and beyond. Together, Every Step is how we continue to deliver exceptional business results, experience an amazing place to work, and have a positive impact on the communities and world around us. Job Title: Global Retail Operations Analyst Reports to : Global Retail Operations Manager Location: US-Remote Interested applicants must reside in one of the following approved states: California, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Hawaii, Illinois, Maryland, Massachusetts, Minnesota, Missouri, Nevada, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Pennsylvania, Texas, Virginia, Washington, Wisconsin The Role In the heart of this role lies the critical responsibility of optimizing our retail operations through detailed data analysis and insights. As a Global Retail Operations Analyst, you will illuminate pathways to mitigate losses, propel efficiency, and advance strategic initiatives that underpin the financial stability and operational excellence of Deckers Brands. We celebrate diversity--of your background, your experiences, and your unique identity. We are committed to ensuring an inclusive and equitable workplace where all our employees can Come as They Are. We believe that when we bring our different perspectives to work, we are truly Better Together. Your Impact The primary functions of this role, include but are not limited to: Exception-Based Reporting Craft automated systems for anomaly detection in sales, inventory, and transactions. Develop and implement real time alerts for prompt corrective action. Loss Prevention Analysis: Use data to identify risks and support the formulation of robust loss prevention strategies. Collaborate with cross functional teams to apply findings and reduce operational losses. Operational Efficiency and Performance Analysis: Analyze financial, sales, and operational data to identify improvement opportunities. Provide actionable insights for efficiency gains and cost optimization. Strategic Support for Retail Growth: Offer analytical support for new store launches and existing operations. Leverage technology to improve customer experience and operational processes. Who You Are Strong analytical and critical thinking skills Effective communicator with an ability to convey complex ideas succinctly. Adaptable and innovative with a proactive approach to problem solving. We’d love to hear from people with Required Experience: 3+ years as a Business Analyst in retail or similar environments. Preferred Knowledge: Advanced understanding of loss prevention and retail operations analytics. Utilized programs: Proficiency in Tableau, Excel, and other data analysis software is crucial. Necessary Skills: Advanced data analysis, strategic thinking, and effective communication. What We'll Give You Competitive Pay and Bonuses - We’ve created a variety of competitive compensation programs to foster career development, reward success and to show our employees just how much they’re valued. Financial Planning and wellbeing - No matter what financial goals our employees have set, we want to help them get there. Our plans provide powerful ways to protect income, pay for expenses and invest in the future. Time away from work - Sometimes we need time away to be with family, focus on our health or just simply recharge. Our plans support our employees’ needs to get out, get healthy and come back stronger than ever. Extras, discounts and perks - Being a valued member of the Deckers Brands team means more than just a paycheck. From generous discounts to community-based programs, we offer a variety of cool extras Growth and Development - Deckers Brands was built on the idea of pursuing passion. That’s why we offer extensive opportunities and support for personal and professional development. Health and Wellness - There’s nothing basic about our comprehensive health and wellness programs and offerings. While at work and at play, we aim to support a healthy lifestyle. $85,000 - $90,000 The salary range posted reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for this role in our Goleta, CA location. Individual pay will be determined by location and additional factors, including job related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary for your preferred location during the hiring process. Equal Employment Opportunity Diversity and inclusion are key to our success. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and our employees are people with different strengths, experiences and backgrounds who share a passion for our brands. We welcome qualified applicants regardless of their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, military or veteran status, mental or physical disability, medical condition and all of the other beautiful parts of your identity.
summary: Deckers Brands seeks a Global Retail Operations Analyst to leverage data analytics for optimizing retail operations, reducing losses, boosting efficiency, and supporting strategic initiatives. The role involves crafting automated systems for anomaly detection, conducting loss prevention analysis, and providing insights for operational efficiency and growth. Ideal candidates possess 3+ years of retail business analysis experience, advanced understanding of loss prevention and retail analytics, proficiency in Tableau, Excel, and other data analysis software, and strong analytical, communication, and problem-solving skills.

title: Regulatory Reporting Analyst
description: Job Title: Regulatory Reporting Analyst Job Description: We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Regulatory Reporting Analyst to join our team and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements by preparing accurate and timely regulatory reports. The Regulatory Reporting Analyst will play a critical role in interpreting regulatory guidelines, gathering data from various sources, and preparing reports for submission to regulatory authorities. This role requires strong regulatory knowledge, attention to detail, and proficiency in data analysis and reporting. Roles And Responsibilities Interpret regulatory requirements and guidelines issued by relevant authorities (e.g., SEC, FINRA, FCA) to ensure accurate and timely reporting. Collect, validate, and analyze financial and operational data from internal systems and departments to support regulatory reporting requirements. Prepare and submit regulatory reports, filings, and disclosures in accordance with regulatory deadlines and standards. Develop and maintain documentation of regulatory reporting processes, procedures, and controls to ensure compliance and audit readiness. Collaborate with internal stakeholders, including finance, legal, and compliance teams, to gather information and address reporting inquiries. Monitor changes in regulatory requirements and industry standards, assessing their impact on reporting obligations and implementing necessary adjustments. Conduct quality assurance reviews and reconciliation processes to verify the accuracy and completeness of regulatory reports. Assist in responding to regulatory inquiries and requests for information, ensuring timely and accurate responses. Participate in regulatory examinations and audits, providing support and documentation as needed. Stay informed about emerging regulatory developments and trends, communicating potential impacts to management and stakeholders. Skills Required Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Business Administration, or related field. Proven experience as a Regulatory Reporting Analyst, Financial Analyst, or similar role in a regulated industry (financial services preferred). Strong understanding of regulatory requirements and reporting frameworks (e.g., GAAP, IFRS, SEC filings). Proficiency in data analysis and financial reporting tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Bloomberg). Attention to detail and accuracy in preparing and reviewing complex financial data and reports. Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet tight deadlines. Effective communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment, handling sensitive and confidential information with discretion. Knowledge of regulatory reporting software and systems is advantageous. Compensation The salary for this position will be competitive and commensurate with experience and qualifications. Comprehensive benefits package including health insurance, retirement plans, and performance-based incentives. Opportunities for professional development and career advancement within the organization.
summary: We are looking for a detail-oriented and analytical Regulatory Reporting Analyst to join our team and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements by preparing accurate and timely regulatory reports. The ideal candidate will have experience in a regulated industry, strong understanding of regulatory requirements and reporting frameworks, proficiency in data analysis and financial reporting tools, and excellent communication and organizational skills.

title: Vans: Allocation Analyst
description: DTC Allocation Analyst Be ready to take part in the ever-changing retail industry in executing your vision to drive sales for our retail business. As an Allocation Analyst, you will manage an exclusive category of products, identify, and implement allocation strategies across the US and Canada for both full price and outlet stores. You will collaborate with Allocation, Planning, and Merchant teams to support key marketing initiatives and specialized assortments. Excellent organizational skills will be key as you balance multiple projects, including frequently monitoring product performance, inventory levels, and sell through to achieve the company’s sales and profitability objectives. We welcome individuals who will be strong team players to support and drive our retail vision. You make our customers happy, therefore we count on you to sustain our successful US and International retail store business! Join the Vans Family Vans® is the original action sports footwear company, rooted in authenticity and creativity. Founded in 1966, we have thrived on a legacy of impacting our greater community through four pillars: action sports, music, art and street culture. We are constantly inspired by the creative voyagers within our company and community. For them, creativity is about the journey, not just the output. Our mission is to empower everyone to use creativity to discover themselves. Our vision is to create a world where anyone can be their unique self. At Vans, our culture sets us apart and influences everything we do. We are driven by our five values: We have HEART – also referred to as the “Van Doren Spirit”. We are relentlessly CURIOUS about our consumers and the world around us. We are UNAPOLOGETICALLY AUTHENTIC and whole heartedly believe the most “Off the Wall” thing you can do is be yourself. We are driven by a spirit of INGENUITY. And we are passionate about local COMMUNITIES. And most of all, we are a family that has fun together. At Vans we empower creative exploration and inspire youth culture through a commitment to inclusivity. We welcome anyone and everyone into our global family and proudly celebrate and environment where individuality is embraced, equal opportunities thrive, and everyone is empowered to reach their greatest potential. By joining our family, you will be immersed in an environment of incredibly supportive and collaborative people. We work hard across a multitude of initiatives to bring the Van Doren Spirit to life. We live for what we do. DTC Allocation Analyst How You Will Make a Difference What you will do : Develop and execute merchandise allocation strategies through analyzing reports and making independent decisions that support merchandise financial plans, inventory turn objectives, regional and store attributes for assigned categories. Track classification/style performance weekly and adjust allocation strategy to maximize sales opportunities and minimize markdown liability. Create and analyze ad-hoc reporting as needed to drive allocation and business decisions. Manage inventory consolidations between Ecommerce, full price, and outlet stores in partnership with Allocation, Planning, and Merchant teams. Create and build appropriate product mix and inventory levels for new, remodel, and relocation stores. Analyze assortment plans with the Merchant team to ensure their vision is aligned with allocation needs. Build strong cross-functional partnerships with Merchant, Planning, Visual, Store and DC teams. How you will do it: Be inclusive, value various points of view, and demonstrate an intellectual curiosity. Ongoing product review utilizing reporting and the allocation system combined with visiting stores to understand impact of visual guidelines, product density, and in store trends. Your diverse experiences and background enable you to provide a unique perspective to fuel our global growth. What success looks like: Bring your creative and analytical skills to ensure well-balanced store assortments that achieve both sell through and financial targets. Build strong cross-functional partnerships to ensure alignment on allocation strategies across multiple channels and countries and build brand love. Free to Be, Inclusion & Diversity As a purpose-led, performance driven company, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness, and authenticity. We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day. Skills For Success Years of related professional experience: 5+ years Educational position requirements: A formal education and subsequent undergraduate/graduate degrees are nice to have, but we are most interested in your total experience and professional achievements. What we expect you already know: In-depth knowledge of store allocation philosophies and methodology, with strong analytical, written, and verbal communication skills, and an aptitude for retail allocation systems. Experience in JDA or Blue Yonder is a plus. What we will teach you: To think strategically and build creative allocation strategies across multiple countries and channels including Ecommerce. To be your authentic self and to share your unique talents and skill set with our team. We will empower you with opportunities and create a space where you can independently drive your business, but will support you throughout your journey. VF Guiding Principles : Live with Integrity, Act Courageously, Be Curious, Act with Empathy, and Persevere. What’s In It For You We’re in the business of unleashing human potential, driven by the ideas, energy and commitment of our people. That’s why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical and financial well-being for all VF associates. When it comes to benefits, we’re the total package. Go to MyVFBenefits.com and click on “Looking to Join VF?” to learn more. Our Parent Company, VF Corporation VF is one of the world’s largest apparel, footwear and accessories companies connecting people to the lifestyles, activities and experiences they cherish through our family of iconic outdoor, active and workwear brands. At the heart of our journey lies our company-wide purpose: We power movements of sustainable and active lifestyles for the betterment of people and our planet. This is our purpose. It’s the reason we come to work every day. It’s a commitment shared by our global associates across all brands. Our purpose unites us and leads us to pursue our goals, together. This is our calling. Learn more at vfc.com. We just have one question. Are you in? Hiring Range: $73,440.00 USD - $91,800.00 USD annually Incentive Potential : This position is eligible for additional compensation awards that may include an annual incentive plan, sales incentive, or commission potential. Specific details of the additional compensation eligibility for this position will be provided during the recruiting and interview process. Benefits at VF Corporation : You can review a general overview of each benefit program offered, including this year's medical plan rates on www.MyVFbenefits.com and by clicking Looking to Join VF? Detailed information on your benefits will be provided during the hiring process. P lease note, our hiring ranges are determined and built from market pay data. In determining the specific compensation for this position, we comply with all local, state, and federal laws. At VF, we value a diverse, inclusive workforce and we provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. All qualified applicants for employment will be considered without regard to an individual’s race, color, sex, gender identity, gender expression, religion, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, marital status, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws. If you are unable to submit your application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at peopleservices@vfc.com. VF will reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with disabilities to the extent required by applicable law. Pursuant to all applicable local Fair Chance Ordinance requirements, including but not limited to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, VF will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
summary: Vans is seeking a DTC Allocation Analyst to manage product allocation strategies for both full price and outlet stores across the US and Canada.  This role involves analyzing reports, making independent decisions, and collaborating with other teams to ensure optimal inventory levels and sales performance.  Strong analytical and communication skills are essential, as well as experience with retail allocation systems.

title: Technical Project Manager/Business Analyst Hybrid
description: Job Title: Technical Project Manager/Business Analyst Hybrid Department: Customer Success Reports to: Director, PMO Job Summary: The Technical PM is a Specright Expert who is responsible for the project schedule, budget, and timeline and orchestrating activities to mitigate risk and hit targets jointly with customers. In this role, you will collaborate with our customers while providing best practice recommendations, consulting services, and expert project management governance to ensure the success of their implementation. You will work cross-functionally with teams including Sales, Marketing, Product Management, Customer Success, and Software Engineering. Responsibilities And Duties Plan, organize and manage all phases of projects to ensure on time and on budget delivery, customer satisfaction, quality deliverables, and exceptional project governance to avoid scope creep and project risk. Able to guide resources and customers that provide impactful solutions resulting in highly referenceable accounts enabling strong adoption, renewal and upsell. Act as a Solution Consultant that can support conversations throughout the project lifecycle including active participation in requirements gathering sessions, strong understanding of solution best practice principles, assisting in QA testing and capable of discussing the solutions built for customers. Interact with business partners to learn and document requirements. Produce business requirements documents and user stories. Research customer needs and collaboratively plan solutions. Coordinate development to meet business requirements. Support development and and management of test cases and User Acceptance Testing Ability to forecast resource needs to execute the project on time and within budget High level of discipline with status updates, Salesforce.com hygiene, etc. Utilize Project management principles to establish full implementation plans including defining scope, deliverables, dependencies, duration estimates, resource estimates, risk identification and mitigation, and contingency planning. Have a strong ability to communicate project boundaries with customers and also negotiate mutual plans that keep projects on schedule, timeline and scope. Be customer-centric in style and approach, with a genuine desire to create and deliver value with outstanding customer experiences. Maintain up to date required product and project management knowledge. Collaborate with the Specright team to proactively uncover additional customer needs and possible upsell opportunities. Adopt and evangelize our Specright implementation methodology and provide ongoing input to maintain and enhance our methodology. Qualifications Industry experience in Consumer Goods, Food & Beverage, Packaging or Supply Chain 5+ years of project management, business analyst, solution consultant or related experience required in SaaS, preferably Salesforce.com related Great communication skills to convey implementation objectives, project boundaries, and drive projects to successful outcomes for internal stakeholders and customers. Must be able to develop credibility and trust from customers and internal stakeholders with technical acumen on the solution and project management expertise. Comfort in presenting to C-suite executives on project health and discussing difficult topics to drive mutual resolution. Experience and ability to manage highly complex Enterprise software projects. Salesforce.com knowledge preferred but not required Smartsheets project management experience PMP Certification is preferred About Specright Specright offers cloud-based software (SaaS) for specification data management to Fortune 1000 companies with complex needs. Whether it's packaging, formulas or products, Specright helps companies reduce costs and empower efficiencies by sharing, analyzing, and auditing specifications. Perks Competitive salaries & equity packages Open vacation policy & flexible work hours Full benefits package that includes Medical, Vision, Life, Dental, 401k, etc Salary: $80000 - $110000 per year
summary: The Technical PM will be a Specright expert who manages project timelines, budgets, and orchestrates activities to achieve customer success. This role involves collaborating with customers, providing best practice recommendations, consulting services, and expert project management to ensure successful implementation. Responsibilities include planning, organizing, managing all project phases, acting as a Solution Consultant, interacting with business partners, producing business requirement documents, research customer needs, coordinating development, and managing test cases and User Acceptance Testing.

title: Sr. Business System Analyst - Business Systems
description: Who are we? Trader Joe's is your favorite neighborhood grocery store! With 540 stores nationwide (and growing ), we are the place to be. Looking for something delicious and a friendly conversation? At Trader Joe's, you can find both. We love being your first and favorite place to shop. What do we do? Like shopping at Trader Joe's? Then, maybe you'll love working with us. We are looking for an experienced Sr. Business System Analyst - Business Systems who is searching to do what they'll love - working on integrations of SaaS applications! Do you have experience working with Business Stakeholders to implement SaaS solutions? Do you love food? If so, read on! We may have the role of a lifetime for you! Trader Joe's is unlike any place you've ever worked. Trust us on that. The qualified Sr. Business System Analyst has at least 5 years of SaaS implementations experience and is a raving fan of the Trader Joe's concept. A Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration or Computer Science is strongly preferred. This role is based in our office in Monrovia, CA. The Sr. Business System Analyst Is Responsible For Demonstrate strategic agility in understanding business requirements and translating them into solution proposals, including custom development projects and/or industry-standard solutions. Build trust and demonstrate integrity with business partners by regularly checking-in and anticipating their needs. Manage and measure software development and implementations - including directing and validating development, communicating with stakeholders, preparing rollout schedules and validating releases. Prepare project plans and provide project statuses. Provide technical support by responding to inquiries, running incidents, and escalations. Working collaboratively with other departments. The Sr. Business System Analyst Has 5+ years of experience working in a variety of SaaS solutions in a Systems Analyst capacity. A Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science or relevant experience. Experience communicating technical solutions to non-technical end-users. Experience working with SaaS partners specifically in Human Resources and/or Marketing. Strong Analytics experience - Google Analytics / Adobe Analytics). Ability to juggle multiple projects with a variety of stakeholders with varying deadlines. We want to hear from you! We Get a Lot Of Resumes; So To Help Us Get To Know You Better, Please Submit Your Resume And Cover Letter. When Creating Your Cover Letter, Please Answer These Questions What is your favorite Trader Joe's product and why? What makes you uniquely qualified for this position? Trader Joe's is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to hiring a diverse Crew.
summary: Trader Joe's is seeking an experienced Sr. Business System Analyst with a minimum of 5 years of SaaS implementations experience. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of business requirements and be able to translate them into solution proposals. They will also be responsible for managing and measuring software development and implementations, preparing project plans, and providing technical support.

title: Mammalian Senior Program Management Business Analyst - Vacaville, CA
description: United States, Hayward (California) Today , Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of . Following our agreement with Roche to acquire the Vacaville manufacturing facility, we are now looking to recruit a Mammalian Senior Program Management Business Analyst for the Vacaville site! The Mammalian Senior Program Management Business Analyst is responsible for ensuring data quality, financial compliance, and informed decision-making within the S&OP cycle. Key responsibilities include providing accurate site revenue predictions, facilitating profitability analysis, assisting PMs with financial data recording, and a contact for financial audits. Reporting to the Site PM Head, the Senior Business Analyst will work with the PM Team and Integration team to transition the Vacaville financial forecasting, in alignment with Lonza’s regulations and standards. Key Responsibilities Reporting to the Site PM Head, the Senior Business Analyst will work with the PM Team and Integration team to transition the Vacaville financial forecasting, in alignment with Lonza’s regulations and standards. Ensure data quality, financial compliance, and informed decision-making within the S&OP cycle. Uses all Standard Work processes as defined for the Business Analyst role Provide accurate site revenue landing predictions through management and facilitation of the standard work tools and meetings. Analyze and align with finance to ensure revenue invoiced is recognized within the month and oversight on deferred revenue Analyze the planning outlook, making necessary corrections to ensure data accuracy for financial planning cycles and target setting. Facilitate meetings and provide analysis to examine site profitability. Support the correction of program inaccuracies affecting revenue outlook and implement solutions to address data discrepancies. Illustrate and communicate changes in site outlook clearly and concisely. Ensure effective tracking tools are in place, align with internal stakeholders, and promote globally standardized tools and methodologies within the PM department. Build strong relations with internal stake holders, Program Managers, Billing, Finance, Supply Chain and Program team members. Perform other duties as assigned. Key Requirements Bachelor's Degree Life Science/Business/Finance Lean and Six Sigma certification green belt preferred Strong experience in business analysis with a focus on data quality and financial compliance. Ability to effectively multi-task with evolving priorities Extensive experience of SAP IBP, Business Warehouse & PowerBI systems Expertise in delivering accurate revenue predictions and managing global deliverables. Proficiency in financial recognition rules and deferred revenue topics Experience in facilitating profitability analysis and Senior Management level meetings. Skilled in identifying and correcting data inaccuracies and implementing effective solutions. Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams. This position is contingent upon Lonza’s successful completion of the acquisition of the site located in Vacaville, California (the “Closing”), currently anticipated to occur in H2, 2024. If the Closing is delayed for any reason, Lonza may delay the start date up to sixty (60) days. Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically. People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference . The full-time base annual salary for this position is expected to range between $118,800.00 and $138,600 . Compensation for the role will depend on a number of factors, including the successful candidate ’s qualifications, skills, competencies, experience, and job-related knowledge. Full-time employees receive a comprehensive benefits package including performance-related bonus, medical and dental coverage, 401k plan, life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance, an employee assistance program, paid time off (PTO), and more. Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Reference: R61540 Apply
summary: Lonza, a global leader in life sciences, is seeking a Mammalian Senior Program Management Business Analyst to join their Vacaville, California site. The role focuses on ensuring data quality, financial compliance, and informed decision-making within the S&OP cycle. Key responsibilities include providing revenue predictions, facilitating profitability analysis, assisting PMs with financial data recording, and managing financial audits. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in business analysis, proficiency in SAP IBP, Business Warehouse & PowerBI systems, and a keen understanding of financial recognition rules and deferred revenue topics.

title: Consulting Group Analyst **
description: Position Summary The Consulting Group (CG) Analyst participates in overall business growth of a Wealth Management team by developing customized Financial Plans /Asset Allocation proposals, designing tailored reporting for new and existing clients, and creating and executing marketing strategies to attract new clients. The CG Analyst is also responsible for matters of technical policy and standards, presentation materials, and performance measurement for complex accounts. The role is responsible for ensuring a consistent, positive client experience to help ensure all commitments are completed and delivered in a timely manner. DUTIES And RESPONSIBILITIES Business Development: Synthesizes client/prospect data to develop customized financial plans/asset allocation proposals utilizing the Firm’s proprietary software tools Designs and produces strategy reports and other types of communications for Financial Advisors / Private Wealth Advisors to use with clients and prospects as part of the overall marketing initiative Provides tailored recommendations to the Financial Advisor / Private Wealth Advisor about specific client situations and opportunities to consider by using Consulting Group manager research Thoroughly understand and utilize the firm’s financial planning tools to analyze complex financial information and lead presentations in partnership with the Financial Advisors / Private Wealth Advisors on the team Client Support Prepares performance reports and other data for clients, that may involve computing account performance, analyzing investment portfolio holdings, and generating quarterly investment performance monitors Develops presentation materials and proposals to assist Financial Advisors / Private Wealth Advisors in prospecting and cultivating new business opportunities May objectives, current portfolio status, risk tolerance, and other information necessary to craft comprehensive financial strategy in conjunction with the Financial Advisor / Private Wealth Advisor licenses may be required K nowledge/Skills Enjoys working with people and solving problems Effective written and verbal communication skills Ability to measure performance of clients’ portfolios environment Willingness to obtain the CIMA or CFA designation Reports To Business Service Officer Expected base pay rates for the role will be between $50,000.00 and $105,000.00 per year at the commencement of employment. Morgan Stanley's goal is to build and maintain a workforce that is diverse in experience and background but uniform in reflecting our standards of integrity and excellence. Consequently, our recruiting efforts reflect our desire to attract and retain the best and brightest from all talent pools. We want to be the first choice for prospective employees. Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce (M/F/Disability/Vet).
