summary: The Consulting Group (CG) Analyst plays a key role in growing a Wealth Management team by crafting personalized financial plans, generating custom reports, and executing marketing strategies to attract new clients. The Analyst also ensures smooth client experiences by managing technical matters, presentations, and performance measurements for complex accounts.

title: Buying Analyst
description: Meet REVOLVE: REVOLVE is the next-generation fashion retailer for Millennial and Generation Z consumers. As a trusted, premium lifestyle brand, and a go-to online source for discovery and inspiration, we deliver an engaging customer experience from a vast yet curated offering totaling over 45,000 apparel, footwear, accessories and beauty styles. Our dynamic platform connects a deeply engaged community of millions of consumers, thousands of global fashion influencers, and more than 500 emerging, established and owned brands. Through 16 years of continued investment in technology, data analytics, and innovative marketing and merchandising strategies, we have built a powerful platform and brand that we believe is connecting with the next generation of consumers and is redefining fashion retail for the 21st century. For more information please visit www.revolve.com. At REVOLVE the most successful team members have a thirst and the creativity to make this the top e-commerce brand in the world. With a team of 1,000+ based out of Cerritos, California we are a dynamic bunch that are motivated by getting the company to the next level. It’s our goal to hire high-energy, diverse, bright, creative, and flexible individuals who thrive in a fast-paced work environment. In return, we promise to keep REVOLVE a company where inspired people will always thrive. To take a behind the scenes look at the REVOLVE “corporate” lifestyle check out our Instagram @REVOLVEcareers or #lifeatrevolve. Are you ready to set the standard for Premium apparel? Main purpose of the role: The Buying Analyst is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting sales data to provide actionable insights to support the buying team in achieving business objectives. This role involves evaluating sales performance, identifying trends, and creating reports to guide strategic decision-making. The Buying Analyst collaborates with various departments to ensure data accuracy and drive continuous improvement in sales processes. Major Responsibilities: Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned. • Collect, compile, and analyze sales data from various sources • Evaluate sales performance by analyzing key metrics such as sales volume, revenue, profitability, and turns • Generate regular and ad-hoc reports on sales performance, trends, and projections • Identify underperforming areas and suggest actionable strategies to improve sales results • Present findings and recommendations in a clear, concise, and actionable manner Required Competencies: To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies: • An understanding and interest in the contemporary and luxury fashion space • Strong organizational skills - ability to manage multiple projects, prioritize, and meet deadlines • Ability to communicate clearly and responsibly across a team of multiple analysts • Excels in team environments and in building / developing strong interpersonal relationships, while maintaining an individual determination to accomplish goals • Ability to demonstrate logical thinking and problem-solving skills multi-tasking, time management, self-motivation, persistence, and takes full ownership of their success Minimum Qualifications: • Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, or a related field • Proven experience as a Merchandise Planner or in a similar analytical role (1-3 years) • Proficiency in data analysis and utilization of Excel • Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills. • Excellent communication and presentation abilities. • Detail-oriented with a high degree of accuracy in work. • Ability to work independently and as part of a team Preferred Qualifications: • Experience in the fashion retail experience • Ecommerce experience • Interest and knowledge in contemporary, aspiring-luxury, and luxury fashion A successful candidate works well in a dynamic environment with minimal supervision. At REVOLVE we all roll up our sleeves to pitch-in and do whatever it takes to get the job done. Each day is a little different, it’s what keeps us on our toes and excited to come to work every day. For individuals assigned and/or hired to work in California, Revolve includes a reasonable estimate of the salary or hourly rate range for this role. This takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions; including but not limited to business or organizational needs, skill sets, experience and training, licensure, and certifications. A reasonable estimate of the current base hourly/salary range is $75-80K. ATTENTION: After submitting your application, please check your spam folder for emails on your application status. Emails are sent from an ADP email address.
summary: REVOLVE is looking for a Buying Analyst to gather, analyze, and interpret sales data to support the buying team in achieving business objectives. This role involves evaluating sales performance, identifying trends, and creating reports to guide strategic decision-making. The ideal candidate has experience in a similar analytical role, proficiency in data analysis and Excel, and strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.

title: Development Analyst
description: First, the good news: The world now has over 1.7 terawatts of cumulative solar capacity and solar PV is the lowest-cost source of energy generation worldwide. The challenge: The world must build 3 terawatts of new solar capacity every year for the next 25 years. Planted is creating new technology to overhaul how the industry develops and builds solar power resources. And we need help. We're expanding our team of ambitious, curious, and hands-on engineers and operators. Come own large parts of product, company, or business development and help power the world with 100% clean energy. About The Role As the Development Analyst, you will focus on early customer engagement and strategy, proposal development, and pipeline growth of solar power plants. You will own critical pieces of our business development process and apply your knowledge of Planted’s technology, the energy market, and solar projects to support customers. Successful candidates will possess strong leadership and communication skills, energy and infrastructure financial acumen, and a desire to be a part of a growing, early-stage company. This role offers the opportunity to work closely with a talented and cross-functional engineering and business team with a high degree of empowerment and autonomy. Responsibilities Support all aspects of project origination and development to expand the project pipeline and win contracts. Own site analysis, financial and energy modeling, and proposal creation for potential solar power plant projects Support internal and external resources to help negotiate LOIs and master framework contracts. Support the creation and improvement of development and project management tools, processes, and standard operating procedures Structure and prepare analysis and materials for senior management. Qualifications 1+ years of working experience in the energy industry Strong communication, organization, and relationship management skills Financial modeling experience using Microsoft Excel Hands-on ownership mentality, curiosity, and resourcefulness Ability to navigate ambiguity, reduce reasonable risks, and make good decisions with imperfect knowledge Preferred Qualifications Bachelor’s in business, engineering, economics, mathematics, or related field Experience in energy markets or renewable energy project development Experience with solar industry software (e.g., PVsyst, Anderson Optimization) A note on qualifications: Many people are unlikely to apply for jobs unless they believe they can perform every task in the job description. We are most interested in finding the best candidate for the job and will consider equivalent combinations of knowledge, skills, education, and experience to meet minimum qualifications. If you are interested in applying, we encourage you to think broadly about your background and skill set for the role. Physical And Sensory Requirements Mostly desk work using standard office equipment The position requires some travel for customer site visits, conferences, and company-wide meetings The salary range for this full-time position is $75,000 - $100,000 plus stock options and benefits. Pay within the range is based on candidate experience, job-specific skills, education, and work location. The target experience for the position is 1 - 3 years. What We Offer 11 paid company holidays and flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) Company-paid in-office lunches Stock options Medical, vision, dental, and other benefits Pre-tax commuter benefits 401(k) A chance to have an empowered, meaningful, and early role in climate This Will Be a Great Fit If You want to solve challenging problems You are biased toward action and focus on the vital work that drives the most impact You prioritize the physical and psychological safety of yourself and those around you You are humble, embrace change, and deliver and receive candid feedback You are optimistic about the future and can make tough decisions to help get there You have high expectations and coach, develop, and make time to help others Planted Solar is an equal opportunity employer committed to growing inclusively, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, medical condition, age, or veteran status. However you identify, or whatever background you bring with you, please apply. We look forward to hearing from you.
summary: Planted Solar is seeking a Development Analyst to focus on early customer engagement, strategy, proposal development, and pipeline growth of solar power plants. The role involves supporting project origination and development, conducting site analysis, financial and energy modeling, and creating proposals for potential solar power projects. The ideal candidate will possess strong communication and leadership skills, financial acumen in energy and infrastructure, and a passion for clean energy. This is an opportunity to work closely with a talented team and contribute to a growing company.

title: Business Systems Analyst, Supply Chain
description: WHY JOIN ALO? Mindful movement. It’s at the core of why we do what we do at Alo—it’s our calling. Because mindful movement in the studio leads to better living. It changes who yogis are off the mat, making their lives and their communities better. That’s the real meaning of studio-to-street: taking the consciousness from practice on the mat and putting it into practice in life. OVERVIEW We are looking for an entry to mid-level business systems analyst with a background in production and or manufacturing in the apparel industry to help support various Supply Chain departments within our organization. The ideal candidate will be an excellent problem solver, multi-tasker, with some familiarity of the SDLC. Experience with multiple ERP, MRP or PLM systems would be a bonus. As a person who enjoys bridging the gap between technology and business, responsibilities will include regular interfacing with both internal and external partners, troubleshooting daily issues, and assisting in developing solutions to help maximize efficiencies for the business. RESPONSIBILITIES Investigate user reported issues or pain points and executing immediate solutions Recreating and documenting reported issues for long term solutions Help to configure and maintain the systems that support various Supply Chain teams Recurring meetings with various business partners to maintain communications on projects, tasks, or new requests Assisting other members of the BA team with projects and ad hoc activities Provide end user training for new processes or development Documenting processes and maintenance of document archives Execute testing plans for software or configuration changes Light data analysis and reporting to enable informed decision making Continuous and proactive identification of opportunities for improvement QUALIFICATIONS Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively engage with stakeholders at all levels of the organization Strong analytical mindset with technical aptitude capable of translating business requirements into practical software solutions Self-motivation, a strong sense of accountability, detail oriented and good organizational skills Able to work independently, organize priorities in a thoughtful manner, and adaptable to changing priorities Experience in Business Analysis, ERP analysis, or application support of commonly used tools in the apparel industry BA in Business Administration preferred The base salary range for this position is $80,000-$110,000 per year which represents the current range for the base salary for this exempt position. Please note that actual salaries will vary based on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. As such, on occasion and when applicable, there is the possibility that the final, agreed-upon base salary may be outside of the upper end of the range. Please also note the range listed is just one component of the company’s total rewards package for exempt employees. Other rewards may include performance bonuses, long term incentives, a PTO policy, and many other progressive benefits. Please review our company California Job Applicant Privacy Policy HERE.
summary: Alo is seeking a Business Systems Analyst with experience in apparel production or manufacturing to support their Supply Chain departments. The ideal candidate will be a problem solver, multitasker, and have familiarity with SDLC and ERP/MRP/PLM systems. Responsibilities include investigating user issues, configuring and maintaining systems, collaborating with internal and external partners, providing training, and analyzing data to improve efficiency.

title: Quality Systems Business Process Analyst
description: Summary Seeking a skilled IT Business Analyst to join our team remotely for a duration of 18-24 months, with a possibility of extension. The role involves being a key resource for Quality systems within the Information Technology department, reporting to the Manager of Business Technology for Quality Systems. Key Responsibilities Understand and apply Quality Assurance principles related to Electronic Quality Management Systems Provide insights and recommendations based on business needs and industry trends Collaborate with internal clients to gather requirements and implement automated systems Work on business cases, cost benefit analysis, and strategic roadmaps for process and technology enhancements Act as a technical liaison between clients and vendors to ensure solutions meet requirements Create technical documentation and provide application support for validated systems Requirements Bachelor's degree or equivalent with 2-5 years of experience in quality systems or QA, including electronic Quality Management Systems proficiency Knowledge of cGMPs and quality assurance processes Strong communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills Familiarity with industry standards, systems development lifecycle, and change management Preferred Qualifications Experience with IT project management methodologies Join us in this exciting opportunity to make a significant impact within the Quality Assurance domain through technical expertise and collaboration. Employment Type: Contractor
summary: A remote IT Business Analyst is needed for 18-24 months (with potential extension) to work on Quality Systems within the Information Technology department. The role involves understanding and applying Quality Assurance principles related to Electronic Quality Management Systems, gathering requirements, implementing automated systems, and creating technical documentation.

title: Corporate - Sr. Business Systems Analyst
description: Requisition ID 848230 Position Full-Time Shift Oakley, Inc. is a sport and lifestyle brand, driven to ignite the imagination through the fusion of art and science. Building on its legacy of innovative, market-leading optical technology, the company manufactures and distributes high performance sunglasses, prescription lenses and frames, goggles, apparel, footwear, and accessories. The essence of the brand is communicated through hundreds of professional and amateur athletes who depend on Oakley products to provide them with the very best while they redefine what is physically possible. Oakley is part of Luxottica, a global leader in the design, manufacture and distribution of fashion, luxury and sports eyewear. Our wholesale network covers more than 150 countries and our retail presence consists of over 9,100 retail stores across the globe. In North America, our wholesale business is the home to other global brands like Ray-Ban and many of the top fashion house brands. Our leading retail brands include; LensCrafters, Sunglass Hut, Pearle Vision, and Target Optical. We are also home to EyeMed, the fastest growing vision care company in the United States. GENERAL FUNCTION The Senior Business Systems Analyst is responsible for creating and maintaining KPI reporting, and providing analytics support for the Supply Chain and Manufacturing groups. Elicit and document reporting requirements through interviewing clients and reviewing and analyzing existing reporting systems and processes. Translate functional specifications into technical specifications. Major Duties And Responsibilities Partner with the business to understand the functional needs and develop KPI reporting that provides insightful and actionable analysis Elicit and document functional and technical report specifications. Support solution development lifecycle, including requirements gathering, specification documentation, quality assurance, training, implementation and support Gathers and documents reporting requirements, including refining functional specifications into technical specifications, develops reporting frameworks, writes and maintains standards and engages in continuous improvement within the organization Analyze data for the following problem identification, root cause identification, trends, measurement of key processes, improvement opportunities Develop data structures to support the reporting requirements Maintain expert knowledge of Department applications and interfaces between applications, reporting processes and data capture Consult with clients, management and staff to determine reporting requirements, and ensure consistent process and data definitions in line with Operational Excellence concepts Ensure reporting requirements and data output is in line with needs of the business to drive business and KPI efficiencies Provide analytics support for Supply Chain and Manufacturing departments Automate and Visualize data to provide the business with operational insight and to help them see problems in real time Actively participate in business unit projects and/or initiatives as assigned Works on one or more projects as a team member Perform other duties as assigned Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree 5+ years of related professional experience Expert level knowledge in Excel, Access and other MS Office tools Knowledge of SAP, Business Objects. Power BI reporting tool SQL Server management studio & Data Tools experience Proficiency in Python or Pandas Programming Server (VM) management Strong communication, interpersonal and analytical skills (written and verbal) Strong attention to detail Knowledge of database and data warehousing concepts Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) experience (e.g. SAP, Oracle, JD Edwards, etc.) Preferred Qualifications Supply chain experience Manufacturing experience Power BI (Power Query, DAX, Visualization) experience SAP/Business Objects experience Knowledge of Oakley’s philosophy and operations Pay Range 100,355.52 - 142,742.22 Employee pay is determined by multiple factors, including geography, experience, qualifications, skills and local minimum wage requirements. In addition, you may also be offered a competitive bonus and/or commission plan, which complements a first-class total rewards package. Benefits may include health care, retirement savings, paid time off/vacation, and various employee discounts. Upon request and consistent with applicable laws, EssilorLuxottica will provide reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities who need assistance in the application and hiring process.  To request a reasonable accommodation, please call the EssilorLuxottica SpeakUp Hotline at 844-303-0229 (be sure to provide your name and contact information so that we may follow up in a timely manner) or email HRCompliance@luxotticaretail.com. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, national origin, social origin, social condition, being perceived as a victim of domestic violence, sexual aggression or stalking, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, citizenship, ancestry, veteran or military status, marital status, pregnancy (including unlawful discrimination on the basis of a legally protected pregnancy or maternity leave), genetic information or any other characteristics protected by law. Native Americans in the US receive preference in accordance with Tribal Law.
summary: Oakley, Inc. is seeking a Senior Business Systems Analyst to create and maintain KPI reporting and provide analytics support for Supply Chain and Manufacturing groups. Responsibilities include: understanding business needs, developing KPI reports, documenting functional and technical specifications, supporting the solution development lifecycle, analyzing data for problem identification and improvement opportunities, developing data structures, maintaining expert knowledge of applications and interfaces, consulting with clients and management, ensuring reporting requirements align with business needs, automating and visualizing data for operational insight, participating in projects, and performing other duties as assigned. The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor's degree, 5+ years of related experience, expert-level knowledge in Excel, Access, and other MS Office tools, knowledge of SAP, Business Objects, Power BI reporting tool, SQL Server management studio & Data Tools, proficiency in Python or Pandas Programming, experience with server (VM) management, strong communication, interpersonal, and analytical skills, attention to detail, knowledge of database and data warehousing concepts, and ERP experience (e.g., SAP, Oracle, JD Edwards). Preferred qualifications include supply chain experience, manufacturing experience, Power BI (Power Query, DAX, Visualization) experience, SAP/Business Objects experience, and knowledge of Oakley's philosophy and operations.

title: Business Analyst, application via RippleMatch
description: This role is with RippleMatch's partner companies. About RippleMatch RippleMatch is the recruitment automation platform changing how Gen Z finds work. By replacing job boards with matching and automation, RippleMatch eliminates the most time-intensive parts of the recruitment process for both employers and job seekers. Leading employers such as eBay and Teach For America leverage RippleMatch to build diverse, high-performing teams and Gen Z job seekers across the country trust RippleMatch to launch and grow their careers. Requirements for the role A Bachelor's degree in Finance, General Business, Business Administration, Business Analytics, or a related degree. Strong financial and analytical skills. Proven ability to organize and interpret large amounts of data. Meticulous, organized and proficient at managing multiple workstreams simultaneously. Excellent written and verbal communication skills needed to interact with internal team members and external client personnel. Dedicated, result oriented and ability to learn quickly in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment under tight deadlines. Highly proficient in Excel; SQL and Tableau experience preferred. Proficiency in the English language, including the ability to listen, understand, read and communicate effectively both in writing and verbally in a professional environment. Previous internship or project experience in business analytics is a plus.
summary: This role involves analyzing large datasets, creating reports, and communicating insights to internal and external stakeholders. It requires strong financial and analytical skills, data organization, and the ability to multitask effectively. Proficiency in Excel is essential, while SQL and Tableau experience are preferred.

title: Sr. Salesforce Business Analyst (local to Burbank, CA)
description: The Salesforce Business Analyst is responsible for understanding business needs and developing solutions to meet those needs. This position requires a candidate to be local to Burbank and open to going to the client's workplace 2-3 days a week. Media experience is required. Roles And Responsibilities You will work on sophisticated business systems projects and be responsible for the complex analysis and definition of requirements for applications that automate business processes. Has a detailed understanding of the business functions for which applications are used, works with Business and IT cross-function teams to identify and resolve business systems problems, and consults with various users to identify potential improvements. Perform hands-on solution design, prototyping, proof-of-concepts, process design, and development tasks as required in support of current and new projects. Leverage business knowledge and expertise to drive business process improvements. Document functional business requirements, process flow diagrams, and business cases. Key contributor to cross-functional teams, user stories, BRD, and roadmap development. Conduct Solution reviews with project teams prior to design and development activities and ensure solutions are aligned with business requirements. Build and deliver high-quality presentations. Assists in planning projects/programs and supports business process redesign. Education And Required Experience 15+ years’ experience in successful software project implementations with at least three years related to Salesforce Bachelor’s degree in software engineering or similar preferred Excellent communication skills SFDC Certifications preferable Ability to communicate in a clear and concise professional manner tailored to the appropriate audience, including verbal and written communications. Experience leading distributed teams to design architecture and requirements for and oversee the development of packaged and integrated solutions Ability to work on complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation and may require collaboration across multiple functional/technical teams. Experience in Agile Experience and willingness to work in the Onsite/Offshore model. Why Cognizant Salesforce Cognizant is one of the top 2 GSIs and is a trusted leader in designing, implementing, and driving ground-breaking experiences using Salesforce solutions. We have 9800+ Salesforce-skilled people globally. Ranked #3 in total number of certifications with an overall 4.77/5 rating in the Salesforce ecosystem. 2400+ projects for 800+ clients, many of which are Fortune 500 companies. Powered by our world-class global delivery, our unique partnership is based on our shared obsession with helping our clients create ground-breaking experiences. Cognizant's Salesforce services span Consulting & Advisory services, design, implementation, and continuous value improvement. 7 Innovation Partner Awards (Industry and market awards and rated the no.1 in 2 Industry Segments Applications will be accepted until 07/31/2024. The annual salary for this position is between $160,000 – 175,000, depending on the experience and other qualifications of the successful candidate. This position is also eligible for Cognizant’s discretionary annual incentive program, based on performance and subject to the terms of Cognizant’s applicable plans. Benefits: Cognizant offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance Paid holidays plus Paid Time Off 401(k) plan and contributions Long-term/Short-term Disability Paid Parental Leave Employee Stock Purchase Plan Disclaimer: The salary, other compensation, and benefits information is accurate as of the date of this posting. Cognizant reserves the right to modify this information at any time, subject to applicable law.
summary: Salesforce Business Analyst needed for sophisticated business systems projects in Burbank, CA. Requires 15+ years' experience with at least 3 in Salesforce, excellent communication skills, SFDC certifications, and experience with Agile & Onsite/Offshore models. Responsibilities include understanding business needs, developing solutions, analyzing & defining requirements, resolving business systems problems, and collaborating with cross-functional teams.

title: Oracle Apps Financials Business Analyst - Remote / Telecommute
description: Job Description: Business System Analyst with 10+ years of experience working in Finance domain projects. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Partner with the Business and development team to drive out the requirements. Perform document analysis to elicit requirements. Analyze and document high level system requirements with Use Case Modeling or other compliant techniques. Good to have experience in projects in the finance domain in compensation. ERP/Callidus.
summary: Business System Analyst with 10+ years of experience in Finance domain projects, specializing in compensation. Excellent communication and documentation skills with experience in Use Case Modeling. ERP and Callidus knowledge preferred.

title: SAP S4 Reporting Business Analyst - Remote / Telecommute
description: Job Description: Pay Range $65hr - $70hr Experience Level: 10+ Years. The SAP FI Team Member position will be part of the SAP Service Delivery organization. The position will be focused on Design and Architecting Project Systems in an SAP S4HANA 2022 implementation project. The SAP FI Team Member requires an in-depth knowledge of accounting business processes and the General Ledger module Design & Blueprinting experience Experience in all General Ledger process changes in S4HANA as well as Fiori Apps Experience in working with BW team and design the Cashflow, AR Aging, P&L/Balancesheet, Project Allocation and FP&A Reporting. Can work closely with Business and Analytics team to define the requirements and provide functional design, test for Financial Actual and planning reporting Good understanding on using SAP BI/AO, BEX Reporting. Experience in Chart of account definition & Well versed with GL Account attributes • Experience with Multi Currency Requirements (Functional Currency, LC3, Additional S4 HANA currency). Experience with Parallel Ledger & Extension Ledger. Experience with Forex Revaluations. Experience with Universal Allocations. Experience in working with BW team and design the Cashflow, AR Aging, P&L/Balancesheet, Project Allocation and FP&A Reporting. Can work closely with Business and Analytics team to define the requirements and provide functional design, test for Financial Actual and planning reporting Good understanding on using SAP BI/AO, BEX Reporting. Experience with Custom Coding block. Experience with standard Document Splitting as well as splitting on Custom fields Experience with Statutory requirements. #monsterit
summary: This position is for a Senior SAP FI Team Member to work on an SAP S4HANA 2022 implementation project. The role requires strong knowledge of accounting processes, General Ledger module Design & Blueprinting, and experience with S4HANA changes, Fiori Apps, BW integration, and Financial Reporting. The ideal candidate will have experience with SAP BI/AO, BEX Reporting, Chart of Accounts, Multi Currency, Parallel Ledger, Extension Ledger, Forex Revaluations, Universal Allocations, Custom Coding, Document Splitting, and Statutory requirements.

title: Onsite, Business Systems Analyst | San Bernardino, CA
description: OUR DIRECT CLIENT is Seeking an experienced Business Systems Analyst. Onsite, Business Systems Analyst | San Bernardino, CA 1+ year contracts The position is responsible for analyzing business processes, eliciting user requirements and utilizing best practices to determine how to implement those requirements. The position will require a thorough understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle Waterfall model and Agile Software Development for the practical application of business analysis and application development methodologies. Responsibilities Strong ability to gather business requirements and develop functional/technical specifications. Strong ability to coordinate project efforts with varying degrees of complexity, deadlines, goals, etc. Strong ability to communicate with executive management, supervisors, colleagues, and customers. Strong collaboration skills and the ability to work effectively in a team environment. Strong understanding of the full end-to-end business processes. Strong problem solving skills, ability to design, and implement solutions. Solid project management and leadership skills. Ability to create detailed project documents including but not limited to a Charter, Business Requirements Document, Proposal, etc. Ability to recommend best practices and business process efficiency improvements. Ability to perform quality assurance testing strategies, plans, and execution. Ability to interact with end users, developers and act in a lead capacity for other technical staff. Hands-on experience solving technical issues. Knowledge of business analysis tools and methodologies. Knowledge of procurement related tasks, such as product research and comparison tables, as well as an understanding of related documents including quotes, contracts, terms and conditions, etc. Skills And Qualifications Exceptional organizational, documentation, written and verbal communication skills. Experience with drafting use case scenarios, and test cases. Experience with charting and charting tools for the creation of swim lanes diagrams, process flow diagrams, data flow diagrams, etc. Experience with off-the-shelf software product reviews, and research comparison tables. Experience with procurement processes and related documents. User training and user acceptance testing experience. Proficient understanding of Agile tools and Microsoft TFS. Experience And Education Bachelor's degree in Information Management, Computer Science or any closely related field. 3 - 5 years' experience performing business systems analysis, working with both business and technical stakeholders of the project, preferably with at least one year lead role experience in managing IT related projects An equivalent combination of experience, education and training will be considered.
summary: This position requires a Business Systems Analyst with 3-5 years of experience to analyze business processes, gather requirements, and implement solutions using Agile and Waterfall methodologies. The ideal candidate will have strong communication, problem-solving, and project management skills, as well as experience with various business analysis tools, procurement processes, and user training.

title: Financial Systems Business Analyst
description: Are you ready to join a place where you can see rapid growth, high-visibility & are treated like family? We are a multi-state (throughout North America!) owner, operator and third-party manager of single-family & multi-family residential homes. We operate in over 20 metro areas across the US & Canada, and have established our stellar reputation over the course of many years. We love our employees, and believe that a positive work environment where every employee is treated like family is a must! Ready to join a rocket ship of a company & take your career along for the ride? Please read on! Position Overview: As a key player bridging the gap between our business vision, accounting/finance systems & successful IT execution, you'll be driving business analysis focused on improving systems, processes in an Agile/Scrum environment. Key Responsibilities Data validation, data migration functions for large-scale migrations for system conversions & growth functions Conducting business analysis, basic cost/benefit analysis, needs assessments aligning business initiatives with how we'll get there (IT solutions) Designing new tech solutions via analysis, workflow charts, diagrams, system capabilities & writing specs Writing, maintaining test plans, business requirements, functional specs Functional liason between IT Support, Accounting, App support, Developers & infrastructure for system enhancements, modifications & implementations Troubleshooting issues, providing solutions to help desk system, automating & eliminating manual processes and support requests Helping to improve processes by identifying process improvement opportunities, being creative to solve challenges & issues that arrise Aid in training and support when needed Qualifications Bachelor's degree in IT, engineering, computer science or related 3+ years of industry experience focused on IT business analysis, application support, technical accounting, QA testing ore related experience. Accounting principals & systems a must Yardi or related real estate or property management software is nice to have In-depth knowledge of both Accounting Principles & Project Management SQL queries & reporting experience Agile / Scrum environment experience is a big plus Confluence, Jira or related PM experience is a big plus Experience with Sage or Workday or related financial focus ERP is a plus Note, this is a Hybrid work opportunity (Tue-Thur in-office, Mon/Fri WFH) so must be in commuting distance to Orange County California or willing to relocate Benefits Vacation/PTO 1 Standard + paid holidays Medical 2 - Full coverage options for individual + families / dependents Dental 3 - Full coverage options for individual + families / dependents Vision 4 - Full coverage options for individual + families / dependents 401k 7 - Yes Bonus 6 - Yes - 10% Relocation 5 - Hybrid schedule, some relocation assistance may be avail for top candidates Telecommute 10 - Yes Email Your Resume In Word To Looking forward to receiving your resume through our website and going over the position with you. title: Senior Business Performance Analyst - San Diego, CA
description: Associates at California Bank & Trust work in a relationship-centered culture where they are provided with the tools, training, and opportunities to build the best possible relationships with our clients and with each other. Our workplace culture values each associate’s unique experiences, background and perspectives and provides a collaborative environment for all employees to grow and thrive. As a premier California-focused financial services company dedicated to serving its communities, families, and businesses (small, mid-sized and large), CB&T has been active for 70 years and has more than 80 full-service branch offices across the state. This dedication has helped the bank earn recognition as a perennial powerhouse in yearly voting for “Best Bank” and “Best Commercial Bank” from the readers of San Diego Union-Tribune and Orange County Register . Additionally, as a division of Zions Bancorporation, the bank has collected multiple Greenwich Excellence Awards for “Overall Client Satisfaction” in Small Business & Middle Market Excellence Awards. We are looking for a seasoned Business Performance Analyst in San Diego, CA . This role provides management reporting and analysis of portfolio growth and sales activities for assigned business groups. Job Requirements: Creates and analyzes financial statements and other financial documents or data to aide management in decision making process. Responsible to complete analysis in one or more of the following areas: cost analysis, profitability, pricing, valuation, budgeting, forecasting, financial modeling or reconciliation utilizing related analytical tools and procedures . Responsible for financial analysis of business transactions and planning cycle activities. Prepares short and long term financial planning reports of key performance indicators, ad hoc analysis reports, economic valuations and cost benefit information . Other duties as assigned. Job Qualifications: Requires a Bachelor's in accounting , finance or related field and 4+ years experience in accounting, financial analysis, budgets or other directly related experience . A combination of education and experience may meet qualifications. Extensive knowledge of financial analysis practices, principles, applications and analysis methods . Must have strong analytical skills . Ability to develop financial models . Strong written and verbal communication skills . Ability to prepare oral and written reports. Ability to work in a heavily deadline oriented environment. Ability to work individually and as part of a team. Ability to identify , research, coordinate and resolve issues . Must be organized, detail-oriented, and able to multi-task . Works effectively with co-workers and both internal and external customers. Excellent computer skills (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access). Benefits: Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance – START DAY ONE! Life and Disability Insurance, Paid Paternal Leave, and Adoption Assistance Health Savings (HSA), Flexible Spending (FSA), and dependent care accounts Paid Training, Paid Time Off (PTO), and 11 Paid Federal Holidays 401(k) plan with company match, Profit Sharing, competitive compensation in line with work experience Mental health benefits, including coaching and therapy sessions Tuition Reimbursement for qualifying employees Employee Ambassador preferred banking products This position is eligible to earn a base salary in the range of $70,000 - $102,000 annually depending on job-related factors such as level of experience.

This role involves creating and analyzing financial statements, cost analysis, profitability, pricing, valuation, budgeting, forecasting, and financial modeling. title: Sr. Sales and Operations Planner / Analyst
description: Job Summary As a S&OP Planner/ Business Analyst, you will utilize your analytical expertise to identify opportunities and make recommendations to enhance Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) process. You will develop various forecasting / financial models and demand planning algorithms to increase demand predictability and S&OP plan accuracy. You will work cross functionally with Sales, Product Management, Finance and Supply Chain Operations to drive alignment and increase process effectiveness. Your data driven insight will enable effective decision making and help the organization become more agile, scalable, and efficient. To be successful in this role, you must be a motivated self-starter who is highly analytical, inquisitive and has a solid understanding of data storage business and configured systems. You must have a passion for solving business problems and be a team player with strong communication skills. Key Responsibilities Analyze large data from various source and create bookings forecast models for Sales & Operations plan. Identify critical data and data patterns to improve demand predictability and accuracy. Run simulations to evaluate how various factors (i.e., pricing, technology, capacity, configuration, etc.) impact product mix and volume. Develop data visualization and dashboards. Plan/coordinate product transitions with cross-functional team to support revenue target and proactively mitigate excess & obsolete inventory. Facilitate and lead ML /AI capabilities implementation in the forecasting space. Appy analytical expertise to develop and report KPIs. Conduct ad-hoc analysis to identify gaps, risks, and opportunities to improve S&OP plan. Lead root cause identification and continuous improvement efforts in the S&OP process. Provide data driven insights that help in operational decision-making processes such as strategic spend, cost reduction and supply chain strategy. Facilitate and lead S&OP Plan review with various functions. Assist in supply and demand optimization by providing demand outlook and risk assessment. Lead/participate in supply chain projects from data analytics perspective Job Requirements 8+ years of experience in S&OP, Demand/Supply Planning or Supply Chain Operations. 3+ years of experience in an analytical role; experience in source/blend information for analysis and building statistical forecasting models. Strong understanding of ML/AI concepts. Working knowledge of SQL, R or Python/ML Strong experience with data visualization/BI SW (Tableau, Power BI, etc.). Problem solver and change agent who can identify problems in advance and propose solutions. Ability to build rapport with all key stakeholders. Excellent organizational and time management skills with ability to manage multiple competing priorities while understanding impact on business results. Experience with SAP IBP a plus Education Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain, Operations Research, Statistics, Mathematics, or Industrial Engineering. Master’s degree a plus Compensation The base salary range for this position is [$152,550] - [$186,450} and will be determined by the candidate's location, qualifications, experience, and education. Final compensation packages are competitive and in line with industry standards, reflecting a variety of factors, and include a comprehensive benefits package. This may cover Health Insurance, Life Insurance, Retirement or Pension Plans, Paid Time Off (PTO), various Leave options, Performance-Based Incentives, employee stock purchase plan, and/or restricted stocks (RSU’s), with all offerings subject to regional variations and governed by local laws, regulations, and company policies. Benefits may vary by country and region, and further details will be provided as part of the recruitment process.
summary: As an S&OP Planner/Business Analyst, you'll leverage your analytical skills to optimize the Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) process by identifying opportunities for improvement and creating forecasting models and demand planning algorithms to increase demand predictability and S&OP plan accuracy.  You will work cross-functionally with Sales, Product Management, Finance, and Supply Chain Operations to drive alignment and increase process effectiveness. This role requires strong analytical skills, data visualization expertise, and a passion for solving business problems. You'll be responsible for analyzing large data sets, developing forecasting models, identifying critical data patterns, conducting simulations, developing dashboards, facilitating ML/AI implementations, and leading root cause analysis for process improvements.

title: Senior Calypso Business Analyst
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Motion Recruitment Partners, LLC, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today! Our large financial company is looking for a contract Senior Calypso Business Analyst. This is a fully remote position. Contract Duration: 5-Months Required Skills & Experience Calypso Experience (Required): Extensive experience in a Lead Calypso BA capacity, preferable involved in Calypso Upgrade projects as well as migrating from legacy applications to the Calypso platform from initiation to completion. In-depth experience with Fixed Income, Derivatives, Money Markets, Advances, LCs and Equity products in Calypso, including their workings and lifecycle events. Experience implementing Calypso Pricing, Accounting, ERS, Workflows, Reporting, Task Station and Scheduled Task functionality. Experience with Calypso versions 16.1 onwards. Experience with the implementation and support of Calypso Hedge Accounting Module. Experience in implementing the Calypso Collateral Module with multiple integrations in and out of Calypso with other platforms. Business Analysis Experience (Required): 7+ years of experience in documenting business requirements and translating them into development User Stories. Self-motivated individual who takes the initiative to thoroughly understand existing business processes, system integrations, and dependencies. Ability to quickly grasp business concepts, objectives, and processes to establish trust and credibility with stakeholders. Proficiency in Atlassian tools (particularly JIRA and Confluence) and Microsoft Office Applications (especially Excel and Visio). Knowledge of Agile/SAFe software development practices. Financial Services Experience (Required): Proficiency in Fixed Income, Derivatives, Advances, LCs and Equity products, with the ability to clearly articulate their workings and lifecycle events. Knowledge of Derivatives Clearing affirmation processes. What You Will Be Doing Daily Responsibilities Collaborate with stakeholders to gather business requirements and, document development user stories and acceptance criteria. Leverage extensive Calypso Domain expertise to design and configure tailored Calypso solutions to meet the business needs. Create detailed current and future state solution documentation, including detailed process flow diagrams, to effectively communicate and secure buy-in from internal and external stakeholders. Work closely with the Calypso Development team to ensure the delivered functionality meets business requirements and delivers value. Collaborate with the Calypso QA team to develop and execute test cases, ensuring the quality and accuracy of developed functionality. Collaborate with Automation Engineers to establish automated regression testing coverage for developed functionality. Actively participate in functional testing to verify that functionality meets business requirements. Provide training, support, and procedural documentation for Calypso business users.
summary: A large financial company is seeking a contract Senior Calypso Business Analyst to work fully remote for 5 months. The role requires extensive experience with Calypso, specifically in leading Calypso BA roles, upgrading Calypso projects, migrating from legacy applications to the Calypso platform, and working with Fixed Income, Derivatives, Money Markets, Advances, LCs, and Equity products. Experience implementing various Calypso functionalities like Pricing, Accounting, ERS, Workflows, Reporting, Task Station, and Scheduled Task is crucial, along with familiarity with Calypso versions 16.1 onwards and Hedge Accounting and Collateral Modules. The ideal candidate will have strong business analysis experience, including documenting requirements, translating them into user stories, understanding business processes, and proficiency in Atlassian tools and Microsoft Office applications. A deep understanding of financial services products and derivatives clearing affirmation processes is essential. Daily responsibilities include collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements, documenting user stories, designing Calypso solutions, creating detailed documentation, working closely with the development and QA teams, participating in testing, and providing training and support.

title: Earned Value Management Business Program Analyst
description: Job Summary General Atomics Aeronautical Systems, Inc. (GA-ASI), an affiliate of General Atomics, is a world leader in proven, reliable remotely piloted aircraft and tactical reconnaissance radars, as well as advanced high-resolution surveillance systems. We have an exciting opportunity for an Earned Value Management (EVM) Business Program Analyst to join the Earned Value Resource Center (EVRC) at General Atomics Aeronautical Systems located in Poway, CA. The EVRC purpose is to provide EVM leadership, guidance, program support, surveillance, and tools management. This position combines finance/business and program management support disciplines to provide support to GA-ASI programs that are required to manage using Earned Value Management (EVM) techniques. The position requires analysis of EVM program data artifacts, deliverables, and metrics; identifying compliance corrective actions and continuous improvements; supporting EVM tool and automation implementations; and providing actionable recommendations to the EVRC program support and surveillance functions. As a GA-ASI EVRC team member, the candidate must be able to both take direction for assigned tasking and act as a leader and role model for EVM implementation, working in a fast-paced, multi-tasking environment, often driven by CDRL, customer, or other deadlines. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: The most important attributes for this position are business/program management analytical skills, customer focus, and the ability to work well with people. As a representative of the GA-ASI EVRC, it is critical that the candidate forge and maintain excellent working relationships with customers (program EVM stakeholders), management, and other EVRC team members. Perform specific tasking to support GA-ASI programs with planning, setting up baselines, implementing automated tools, developing cost/schedule/EVM deliverables, and meeting contractual management requirements. Perform analysis of program management artifacts used for customer and government audit reviews. Perform independent analysis of program management and performance metrics. Collect data to identify root cause of problems and evaluate existing processes. Develop and lead the communication/delivery of business system/process documentation including presentations, work instructions, templates, job aids, and training materials that support program and business management. Provide EVM tool implementation and support to programs and stakeholders. Support program Integrated Baseline Reviews (IBRs) and Joint Surveillance Reviews (JSRs). Perform tasking to support development of Earned Value Management (EVM) training materials; provide training on specific areas of expertise to program and business management stakeholders. Manage non-technical project completion using an internal customer perspective, typically from initiation through delivery including entire tool or system development, system integration projects, and business system and process development or modification. Continually assess project performance, identify issues, and develop solutions to meet project goals and objectives. Develops appropriate reports to document performance and convey to leadership. Analyze, validate, and develop surveys and analysis of best practices for techniques and processes to optimize approaches and achieve more efficient results. May provide leadership and training to less experienced professional staff. Maintain the strict confidentiality of sensitive information. Perform other duties as assigned or required. We recognize and appreciate the value and contributions of individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences and welcome all qualified individuals to apply. Job Qualifications Typically requires a bachelor's degree in Business Administration or a related field and three or more years of experience as a Business Program Analyst (e.g., working with computerized management systems to include, but not limited to, product life cycle systems, business processes, project/business management, or project administration). May substitute equivalent experience in lieu of education. An MBA, Program Management Professional (PMP), and/or Earned Value Management (EVM) credential (e.g., Earned Value Professional (EVP)) is a plus. Must have a good knowledge of business process/life cycle management principles, theories and concepts and a general understanding of industry practices, techniques, and standards. Candidate must demonstrate strong analytical and project leadership skills including organizing, scheduling, conducting, and managing work assignments to meet project milestones. Must be able to contribute to the development of program and business management processes and system, best practice, and continuous improvement for efficiencies and cost savings. Must be self-driven, customer-focused, and possess: the ability to identify issues and develop solutions to a variety of complex problems of diverse scope and complexity. excellent analytical, interpersonal skills, and verbal/written communication skills to accurately document, report, and present EVM findings. the ability to represent the department or company on projects. Proficiency in all Microsoft Office core applications. Ability to work independently or in a team environment is essential. Ability to work extended hours and travel as required. The following are desirable but not mandatory: SAP accounting system and material management (e.g., MRP) experience. Program planning and scheduling experience. Expertise on the EIA-748 EVM guidelines. An understanding of industry/government EVM guidance, including the DFARS clauses 252.234-7001/7002, DoD EVMS Interpretation Guide, EVM Implementation Guide, IPMR/IPMDAR DID, and MIL-STD-881 (work breakdown structure). An ability to interpret/analyze the IPMR Formats 1-7, identify key takeaways, and support program staff accordingly; conduct independent analysis of EVM data and metrics, including DCMA EVMS Compliance Metrics (DECM), followed by recommended actions. Experience with one or more EVM tools (EVMS for Project and Empower are preferred). SharePoint experience is desirable to support the Earned Value Resource Center (EVRC) intranet site (including user documentation library) and program artifact sites. Job Type: Full-Time Salary Salary range: 68,770 - 116,193
summary: General Atomics Aeronautical Systems (GA-ASI) is seeking an Earned Value Management (EVM) Business Program Analyst to join their Earned Value Resource Center (EVRC). The position requires analysis of EVM program data, identifying compliance actions and improvements, supporting EVM tools, and providing recommendations to the EVRC. The analyst will work closely with program EVM stakeholders, management, and other EVRC team members. Responsibilities include performing tasks to support GA-ASI programs with planning, setting up baselines, implementing automated tools, developing cost/schedule/EVM deliverables, and meeting contractual management requirements.

title: BAS Specialist Supervisor
description: Albireo Energy, LLC is seeking a Sr. Field Technician Supervisor to supervise a Building Automation Field Technician Team for Albireo Energy, Inc. You will apply your leadership skills to improve team performance, develop & monitor training, resource assigning, and safety policy adherence. The Technician Supervisor will drive and improve metric reporting procedures and develop team performance. You will act as a mentor to train and develop future project leaders. This position reports to Branch Solutions Operations Manager. Key Responsibilities Mentor a Team of Field Technicians Collect, develop, and report performance metrics Partner with Project Managers to fulfill their project staffing requirements (short and long term) Identify opportunities for process improvement Be responsible for the safety requirements amongst the Technician Team Identify the resource needs for the project teams and deploy the skilled workforce accordingly Manage and identify skill gaps, certifications, utilization & billability to ensure our team is adequately trained Organize and conduct training for the Technicians As needed, execute project chargeable work Drive business growth by enabling and leading a highly effective team, focused on innovation and customer satisfaction Collaborate with Engineering Perform monthly one on one's with Direct Reports Requirements Field Technician Experience Prior People Management Experience Leadership Qualities A valid driver's license We Value Associate's or Bachelor's Degree Previous industry experience Excellent communication skills Demonstrated ability to influence at varying levels across the organization Demonstrated ability to operate independently Ability to use experience to appropriately apply the established standards Demonstrated ability to effective manage a team Pay Rate: $43-$53/hr. DOE. Responsibilities include mentoring technicians, collecting performance metrics, partnering with project managers for staffing, identifying process improvement opportunities, ensuring safety, managing resource needs, identifying skill gaps, conducting training, executing project work, and driving business growth. title: Business Systems Analyst 3 - Req. 2899
description: This position is eligible for a remote work arrangement within the state of California. The selected candidate must reside within the state of California or be willing to relocate The mission of The Arthur Ashe Student Health and Wellness Center (The Ashe Center) is to support UCLA students in the successful attainment of their educational goals through the personalized delivery of accessible, high-quality health and wellness services, rendered with kindness and competence, by diligent, dedicated professionals. Our comprehensive services include Primary Care, Gynecology Services, Immunizations, Travel Medicine, Physical Therapy, Specialty Clinics, Radiology & Laboratory, and Acupuncture – all under one roof! We are also pleased to offer additional services in the Ackerman Student Union: a full-service optometry center, U See LA Optometry, and the Bruin Health Pharmacy. UCLA's student health center and its suite of services consistently rank as best in the nation. Most recently, the wellness fintech brand Ness awarded UCLA and The Ashe Center as the healthiest college in the state of California. The Business Systems Analyst Level 3 will provide support and analysis for Student Affairs Systems, which includes moderate-to-complex systems, but not limited to, Student Information Systems, Student Health Systems (including EPIC System, Compulink System, ProPharrm System, Point and Click System), Student Records Systems, and Student Affairs IT Systems, and will be applying thorough knowledge of business and process analysis functions as they pertain to Student Information Systems. Incumbent will create, maintain sketches, workflow diagrams, wireframes and mock-ups based on models created from department discovery process. Analyze and resolve production system problems in Student Affairs systems and campus systems. Required: 2 years Experience in computer systems, information systems or related area. Strong skills and methodologies in managing operational systems including providing guidance, managing scope, setting priorities, establishing timelines, directing modifications, assigning work, and providing feedback, and applying knowledge of business and process analysis functions. Demonstrated strong skills in eliciting and developing business requirements, specifying and designing inputs and outputs, producing system and programming specifications and requirements and recommending modifications to existing programs and processes. Strong skills in systems analysis and design for systems including completing feasibility studies of projects, analyzing functional processes, determining scope, developing overall system requirements, designing detailed inputs and outputs, and producing system and programming specifications. Strong project management, business systems analysis and problem-solving skills. Strong ability to analyze operational and organizational systems: define objectives; identify concerns and tendencies; formulate conclusions; recognize alternatives; implement procedural changes to affect the results. Strong Ability to define testing procedures and to rigorously carry out such procedures. Thorough knowledge of SQL, SQL objects, and, SQL Server and .NET, Visual Basic, VB Script, VBA, ASP, and JavaScript. Strong ability to learn new programming languages and technology. Demonstrated strong ability to prototype and design user-interface solutions to user problems. Thorough knowledge of user interface design patterns and strong ability to use tools to wireframe and prototype user interfaces. Thorough knowledge of business systems analysis methodologies which includes developing business systems analysis artifacts, such as wireframes, use cases, traceability matrix, and process models. Strong interpersonal skills to work effectively and diplomatically with diverse groups of administrators, colleagues, managers, technical staff, faculty, students, staff, vendors, representatives of governmental agencies and the public. Effective oral communication skills to represent the unit on task forces, committees, and conferences. Ability to write effective proposals and instructional/technical documentation concerning feasibility studies, systems requirements and design, processing requirements, programming specifications. Thorough knowledge of complex on-line interactive systems and ability to schedule production reports; PC software including MS Office Suite; and desktop publishing, HTML, and graphic software including Adobe products. Ability to work independently, following through on assignments with minimal direction, working as part of a team, performing with constant interruptions, setting priorities, meeting competing deadlines, and handling varying requirements, obstacles, and job complexities.
summary: The Business Systems Analyst Level 3 at the Arthur Ashe Student Health and Wellness Center at UCLA will support and analyze Student Affairs Systems, including Student Information Systems, Student Health Systems (EPIC, Compulink, ProPharrm, Point and Click), Student Records Systems, and Student Affairs IT Systems. The role involves business process analysis, system design, and development, along with troubleshooting and managing system operations. Strong communication and interpersonal skills are essential for collaboration with various stakeholders.

title: Business Development Support Analyst
description: PIMCO is a global leader in active fixed income with deep expertise across public and private markets. We invest our clients' capital across a range of fixed income and credit opportunities, leveraging our decades of experience navigating complex debt markets. Our flexible capital base and deep relationships with issuers have helped us become one of the world's largest providers of traditional and nontraditional solutions for companies that need financing and investors who seek strong risk-adjusted returns. Since 1971, our people have shaped our organization through a high-performance inclusive culture, in which we celebrate diverse thinking. We invest in our people and strive to imprint our CORE values of Collaboration, Openness, Responsibility and Excellence. We believe each of us is here to help others succeed and this has led to PIMCO being recognized as an innovator, industry thought leader and trusted advisor to our clients. Position Description The Business Development Support (BDS) Team is responsible for managing the coordination and submission of Request for Proposals (RFPs), Requests for Information (RFIs), and Due Diligence Questionnaires (DDQs) for PIMCO clients and prospects globally. This role is essential to the firm's client servicing and business development efforts and the team partners with departments across the organization to ensure that all responses are compelling, accurate and timely. BDS works with subject matter experts to write and edit standard or customized language and manage the content within the team's database to ensure integrity and quality. Team members work both independently and in a team environment where the culture encourages collaboration and development. Location Newport Beach, CA Responsibilities The key responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Manage the coordination and submission of RFPs, RFIs, and DDQs for PIMCO clients and prospects globally. Partner with client management and departments across the organization to provide compelling, accurate and timely responses covering firm-level and strategy-specific topics. Work with subject matter experts including product strategists, legal, compliance, human resources, operations, technology, and others to write and edit standard or customized responses. Maintain the integrity and quality of content in the team's database by updating existing and creating new responses on a regular and ad hoc basis. Field ad hoc questions to support the client management team in responding to client and prospect inquiries. Develop a deep understanding of PIMCO's investment strategies as well as the many facets of firm-level topics. Position Requirements Must have a Bachelor's Degree with a preferred major in economics, finance, accounting, or business. Minimum 3.2 overall GPA. Open to undergraduate applicants who have graduated between May 2022 and June 2024 only. Relevant internship or job experience, ideally in a financial, client-oriented role. Completion of Series 7 and 63 is required within the first six months of employment. Background and / or interest in investment management. Strong written and verbal communication skills to collaborate effectively with all levels of personnel across the organization. Effective organizational and project management skills with the capacity to prioritize multiple projects and deadlines. Excellent attention to detail to ensure the accuracy of qualitative and quantitative content. Self-starter who can succeed in a demanding and dynamic environment. Proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel (VBA or programming experience viewed favorably). PIMCO follows a total compensation approach when rewarding employees which includes a base salary and a discretionary bonus. Base salary is the fixed component of compensation that is determined by core job responsibilities, relevant experience, internal level, and market factors. The discretionary bonus is used to award performance and therefore is determined by company, business, team, and individual performance. Salary Range: $ 75,000.00 - $ 81,000.00 Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Statement PIMCO recruits and hires qualified candidates without regard to race, national origin, ancestry, religion (including religious dress and grooming practices), sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender (including gender identity and expression), age, military or veteran status, disability (physical or mental), any factor prohibited by law, and as such affirms in policy and practice to support and promote the concept of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action, in accordance with all applicable federal, state, provincial and municipal laws. The company also prohibits discrimination on other basis such as medical condition, or marital status under applicable laws. Applicants with Disabilities PIMCO is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. We provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, including veterans, in job application procedures. If you have any difficulty using our online system due to a disability and you would like to request an accommodation, you may contact us at 949-720-7744 and leave a message. This is a dedicated line designed exclusively to assist job seekers with disabilities to apply online. Only messages left for this purpose will be considered. A response to your request may take up to two business days.
summary: PIMCO, a global leader in active fixed income, seeks a Business Development Support (BDS) Team member. This role involves managing and submitting RFPs, RFIs, and DDQs for clients globally, partnering with various departments to ensure timely and accurate responses. BDS team members collaborate with subject matter experts to write and edit responses, maintaining database integrity and quality. The ideal candidate has a Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, or a related field, relevant internship experience, and strong written and verbal communication skills. The position requires proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel (VBA experience is a plus). PIMCO offers a competitive salary range of $75,000 - $81,000 plus a discretionary bonus based on performance.

title: Sr Market Settlement Analyst (Remote)
description: Company Description The California Independent System Operator (ISO) manages the flow of electricity across the high-voltage, long-distance power lines that make up 80 percent of California's power grid. We safeguard the economy and well-being of 30 million Californians by operating the grid reliably 24/7. As the impartial grid operator, the California ISO opens access to the wholesale power market that is designed to diversify resources and lower prices. It also grants equal access to 25,865 circuit-miles of power lines and reduces barriers to diverse resources competing to bring power to customers. The California ISO's function is often compared to that of air traffic controllers. It would be grossly unfair for air traffic controllers to represent one airline and profit from allowing that company's planes to go through before others. In the same way, the California ISO operates independently—managing the electron traffic on a power grid we do not own—making sure electricity is safely delivered to utilities and consumers on time and reliably. The California ISO is committed to the health, safety, and work/life integration of its employees, and is proud to offer flexible work arrangements. This position would be eligible to participate in a hybrid or fully remote work capacity, Relocation assistance is available. Job Description Under the general direction of the Manager, provide technical expertise related to electricity market applications, and power systems operations. Support processes and activities required for accurate and timely publication of settlement statements and invoices including verification and correction of market transactional data, ensuring complete and accurate calculation of energy accounting, and commitment cost determination. What's In It For You Our purpose is to lead the way to tomorrow's energy network. Make a difference and impact millions of people who depend on electricity in their everyday lives. You get to work on interesting and challenging assignments that will help grow your skill set. You will be able to work in an extremely collaborative environment inside our LEED certified Folsom, California campus. You will be challenged, be a part of a winning team, and your contributions will be rewarded and recognized. What You Will Be Doing Applies technical expertise related to energy market results, calculation of expected energy, and commitment cost determination. Interprets and validates settlements results based upon market behaviors, system conditions, and resource characteristics. Create business documentation as needed to support analysis. Develops metrics and tools to perform data analysis. Author’s gathers data using query logic in SQL, develops business rules and logic in analytics software such as SAS or R, and produces summary results for review. Identify root causes of data anomalies including market, operations, and scheduling data. Participate in cross-departmental efforts to resolve software and process issues. Reviews policies, procedures, and processes for upcoming market changes and assess impact to business processes; develop implementation plan for impacted processes. Perform user-acceptance testing for new business processes or system changes to promote quality implementations. Adhering to ISO Tariff, BPMs, and audit standards, support settlement production activities for validation and correction of market transactional data ensuring timely and accurate settlement. Identifies and implements process improvements for efficiency gains, increased accuracy, control compliance, and error detection. Qualifications Level of Education and Discipline A Bachelor's degree (BA, BS) or equivalent education, training or experience in Business, Accounting, Finance, Economics, Management of Information Systems, or related technical field. Amount Of Experience Equivalent years of education and training, plus five (5) or more years related experience. Type Of Experience A combination of experience in any of the following disciplines required: utility/power industry, preferably in a similar ISO; system analysis; regulatory, energy accounting, commitment cost determination, or settlements. Exposure and experience with applied optimization principles and techniques, power system operations and market design. Experience with identification of data quality issues (accuracy, completeness, etc.) and creation of specific SQL queries to access large volumes for data analysis is required. Advanced Excel skills, SQL, and analytics software such as SAS, or R, is strongly preferred Additional Skills And Abilities Competency in Microsoft Office software applications, specifically, advanced knowledge of Excel, Access, and Word is required. Must be able to work effectively in a team environment as facilitator and team member. Excellent analytical, verbal and written communication and documentation skills required, with a demonstrated attention to detail. Ability to use deductive reasoning and analytical thinking with sound judgment and decision-making skills. Excellent interpersonal and conflict resolution skills are also essential. Must be self-starting and willing and able to work independently in a dynamic corporate organization under pressure of tight deadlines and aggressive expectations. Self-motivated, problem solving skills and the ability to influence others without direct authority. Additional Information The pay range for the Sr Market Settlements Analyst is $50.34 - $83.90 per hour. **We will also consider applicants for a Market Settlement Analyst position. This position requires a Bachelor's degree (BA, BS) or equivalent education, training or experience in Business, Accounting, Finance, Economics, Management of Information Systems, or related technical field. This position requires equivalent years of education and training, plus two(2) or more years related experience. the pay range for the Market Settlements Analyst is $38.26 - $63.77 per hour.** All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
summary: The California ISO seeks a Sr. Market Settlements Analyst to provide technical expertise related to electricity market applications and power systems operations. Responsibilities include supporting processes for accurate settlement statements and invoices, verifying market transactional data, calculating energy accounting, determining commitment costs, and identifying data anomalies. Experience with SQL, analytics software (SAS or R), and utility/power industry is required.

title: CAMBR - Operations Analyst
