title: Sales Operations Analyst, SMGS Ops - WWSO Sales & Biz Ops
description: Description AWS Sales Marketing and Global Services Operations (SMGS) is seeking a Sales Operations Analyst to work with the Core Services and Advanced Compute teams globally. This role will be a member of the Service-Aligned Operations team supporting Worldwide, GTM and Area Specialists, partnering to help grow adoption for strategic AWS domains and services. This role will have the responsibility to continuously evolve forecasting models, analyze historical results, and make business recommendations to senior management based on those analyses – all in an environment of rapid growth and increasing complexity. This will include working with the Specialized Sales leadership to develop, implement and manage the business processes, systems, reports and strategies that optimize business functions to meet organizational goals and initiatives. In this role, you will work closely with members of the Specialist teams for Core Services and Advanced Compute, to ensure we are capturing and surfacing the best data and information to make optimal business decisions across our global program. Key job responsibilities Work Directly with data and data models. Work with large data sets and the technical tools needed to work with them. Advocate on behalf of customers to other internal stakeholders. Drive towards simple, scalable solutions to difficult problems. Project-manage multiple workflows. Communicate complex analytical results, both written and verbal, in a clear and easy-to-understand way. Work with key business stakeholders to understand requirements and shape analytical deliverables. Strategically analyze business, product and technical challenges. About The Team About AWS Diverse Experiences AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying. Why AWS? Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses. Inclusive Team Culture Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness. Mentorship & Career Growth We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional. Work/Life Balance We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud. About Sales, Marketing And Global Services (SMGS) AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. Basic Qualifications 3+ years in experience in Sales Operations, Sales Analytics, Business Analyst or Finance 3+ years of experience building data analysis 3+ years of experience with Excel, SQL, Python 3+ years of experience in data visualization with tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, or AWS QuickSight Strong written and verbal communication skills, with a track record of supporting a variety of stakeholders Preferred Qualifications 3+ years of advanced proficiency in Excel (including VBA, Macros, Pivot Tables, array functions, Power Pivots, etc) 3+ years of experience in SQL and manipulating large data sets in a database Proven experience working with sales systems and tools such as CRM, variable compensation, and revenue reporting 5+ years of finance, business management and sales operations experience A motivated self-starter who can work independently in a fast paced, ambiguous environment Detail oriented and experience balancing multiple tasks and deadlines Exhibits sound business judgment and a proven track record of taking ownership, leading data-driven analyses, and providing clear answers to complex problems Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $79,300/year in our lowest geographic market up to $169,500/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site. Company - Amazon Web Services, Inc. Job ID: A2650230

company: University of California Office of the President
title: BUSINESS SYSTEMS ANALYST 4, Financial Management - 63075
description: Job Posting For UCOP internal applicants, please login to the internal candidate gateway at: Jobs at UCOP UC OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT At the University of California (UC), your contributions make a difference. A world leader producing Nobel and Pulitzer prize recipients with over 150 years of groundbreaking research transforming the world. Choose a career where you can leverage your knowledge, skills and aspirations to inspire and support some of the greatest minds in the world, and those who will follow in their footsteps. Working at the University of California is being part of a unique institution, and a vibrant and diverse community. At the University of California, Office of the President, we propel our mission through impactful work locally, in government centers and systemwide. We are passionate people, serving the greater good. The University of California, one of the largest and most acclaimed institutions of higher learning in the world, is dedicated to excellence in teaching, research and public service. The University of California Office of the President is the headquarters to the 10 campuses, six academic medical centers and three national laboratories and enrolls premier students from California, the nation and the world. Learn more about the UC Office of the President Department Overview The Financial Accounting Unit provides systemwide financial management, reporting, policy, procedures, and administrative services in support of UC's mission. Additionally, Financial Accounting is involved in various initiatives to enhance the reporting and transparency of financial information. These efforts involve coordination and collaboration with local, campus, medical center, laboratory personnel at all levels. Position Summary Under general supervision, provides subject matter expertise to ongoing and new Oracle Financials systems projects and initiatives. Works at the highest technical level of various phases of systems analysis and considers the business implications of applying technology to the current and future business environment to support Oracle Financial Cloud applications and other systemwide financial applications. Conducts complex business process analysis resulting in the identification of process issues and associated solutions. Recognized expert in business systems analysis across all modules within Oracle Financials. Coordinates with business users, and IT departments to manage and maintain Oracle Financial components and related tools. Provides system support for day-to-day operations including, gathering and documenting business requirements, configuration, testing, Oracle support requests, Oracle patches, and other related activities. Supports month end and year end activities in Oracle cloud. Provides Oracle functional expertise in Asset Management, Oracle Enterprise Data Management Cloud Service (EDMCS), and General Ledger. Key Responsibilities 30% Performs highly complex analysis of business and user needs, documentation of business requirements and translation into proper system specifications. Provides advanced support and training on existing and new financial applications, including Oracle Financial Consolidation & Close Cloud Services (FCCS), Oracle Enterprise Data Management (EDMCS), and AWS (Financial Data Warehouse). Provides subject matter expertise during the planning and execution of systems integration and acceptance testing and production support of Oracle Cloud applications. 30% Applies business process and analysis concepts, up to and including the most complex and advanced, while formulating and defining systems scope and objectives relative to the organization's business needs and corresponding system requirements. Independently analyzes systemwide and local business practices, processes, and problems. Regularly analyzes and determines methods and procedures on new assignments. Independently performs business and functional analysis, up to and including the most complex, related to system integration issues and creates and maintains interface specifications / requirements. Considers the business implications of applying and updating technology to the current and future business environment. 25% Initiates, facilitates, implements, and documents business process changes. Initiates and oversees changes in processes and procedures as they relate to system enhancements with Oracle cloud applications and other financial systems. Manages and troubleshoots end-user incidents and tickets by effectively working with corporate accounting, local accounting offices, and IT services to understand and resolve business concerns and issues. Maintains and keeps business processes and procedures up-to-date and provides end-user training when financial systems are updated and modified. Manages and maintains security profiles and permissions for the University’s financial systems and applications. 15% Initiates, designs or modifies highly complex systems and procedures where standardized policies or procedures may or may not exist. Creates test plans and maintains test scripts for routine updates and works with ITS and managed services execute test plans and review and validate results. Experience Required Qualifications Min 8 years Relevant financial systems experience (e.g., General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Fixed Assets and Financial planning systems) and is inclusive of a minimum of 2 years of experience with EPM FCCS and EMP Cloud. Skills And Abilities Required Qualifications +4 years of experience interacting with business users to define and document business requirements. Demonstrated ability to bridge IT and Finance functions and partner with IT to provide relevant system solutions. Familiarity with systems integration security, user provisioning, and single sign-on technologies. Self-motivated and proactive with excellent problem solving, critical thinking, and team/collaboration skills that enable you to be successful both working independently with minimal supervision while ensuring your team maintains visibility and connection to the big picture. Prior experience with reporting and data extraction tools e.g., Smartview. Clear and effective writing and documentation skills. Team-oriented with strong interpersonal, communication skills, and customer interaction skills Excellent prioritization skills with the ability to see a task to completion. Demonstrated effective communication and interpersonal skills. Demonstrated ability to communicate technical information to technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization. Interpersonal and communications skills to work with both technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization. Self-motivated and works independently and as part of a team. Able to learn effectively and meet deadlines. Demonstrates problem solving skills. Demonstrated testing and test planning skills. Finance and Accounting knowledge: financial process, data management, reporting. Preferred Qualifications Hands-on experience in Oracle finance cloud configurations, testing, and managing data governance using EDMCS. 2 years of hands-on experience as a Business Analyst supporting Oracle Financials ERP cloud specifically GL, Asset Management, Workflow Management, EDMCS, FCCS, and AWS knowledge will be a huge plus. Advanced skills and understanding of methodologies associated with process and software design, modification and implementation. Demonstrated skills needed to develop process and system implementation plans. Advanced knowledge of business processes and procedures. Knowledge of Oracle Cloud implementation methodology and best practices Knowledge of Oracle Cloud support methodology including updates (monthly/quarterly) Meticulous attention for detail as demonstrated by the ability to consistently prepare and review financial transactions, ensuring correct coding of data and discerning data anomalies with a high degree of accuracy. Education Required Qualifications Bachelor's degree in related area and / or equivalent experience / training. Licenses and Certifications Preferred Qualifications Oracle certified professional. SPECIAL CONDITIONS This position has been approved for a hybrid work arrangement. The person hired may be asked to report to work on-site at UC’s Office of the President (UCOP) located in Oakland, CA two days per week, subject to change. The person hired will be required to reside in the state of California. SALARY AND BENEFITS Job Title Business Systems Analyst 4 Job Code 000657 Salary Grade Grade 24 Payscale: $123,000 - $140,000 Full Salary Range: $95,300 - $178,100 The University of California, Office of the President, is required to provide a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. This range takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to experience, skills, knowledge, abilities, education, licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs. It is not typical for an individual to be offered a salary at or near the top of the range for a position. Salary offers are determined based on final candidate qualifications and experience. The full salary range shows the growth potential for this position and the pay scale is the budgeted salary or hourly range that the University reasonably expects to pay for this position. Benefits: For information on the comprehensive benefits package offered by the University visit: Benefits of Belonging ADDITIONAL INFORMATION HOW TO APPLY Please be prepared to attach a cover letter and resume with your application. APPLICATION REVIEW DATE The first review date for this job is January 10, 2024. The position will be open until filled. CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT Background Check Process: Successful completion of a background check is required for this critical position. Background check process at UCOP Smoke Free Work Environment: The University of California, Office of the President, is smoke & tobacco-free as of January 1, 2014. UC Smoke & Tobacco Free Policy As a condition of employment, you will be required to comply with the University of California Policy on Vaccination Programs , as may be amended or revised from time to time. Federal, state, or local public health directives may impose additional requirements. EEO STATEMENT The University of California, Office of the President, is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age or protected veteran status. EEO/AA Employer UC Nondiscrimination Policy The University of California, Office of the President, strives to make this job board accessible to any and all users. If you have comments regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact us at: Accessibility or email the Human Resource Department at: epost@ucop.edu .

title: BSA Analyst II
description: Introduction Since 1973, East West Bank has served as a pathway to success. With over 120 locations across the U.S. and Asia, we are the premier financial bridge between the East and West. Our teams of experienced, multi-cultural professionals help guide businesses and community members on both sides of the Pacific looking to explore new markets and create new opportunities, and our sustained growth and expertise in industries like real estate, entertainment and media, private equity and venture capital, and high-tech help build sustainable businesses and expand our associates’ potential for career advancement. Headquartered in California, East West Bank (Nasdaq: EWBC) is a top performing commercial bank with an exclusive focus on the U.S. and Greater China markets. With a strong foundation, and enterprising spirit and a commitment to absolute integrity, East West Bank gives people the confidence to reach further. Overview East West Bank is seeking a BSA Analyst II. The BSA Analyst II's primary function is to complete SAR reviews of the bank's high risk customers. We offer flexible Hybrid schedule. Responsibilities Perform research, analysis and investigation of a SAR Filing Document results of SAR file review Escalate potentially suspicious activity findings to management Understand the bank's products, services, customers and geographical locations in order to conduct effective research/investigation of accounts Perform additional duties as assigned Makes recommendation for account closure Experience with search engines Review SAR’s filed as they approach the 90-day renewal date to decide whether a renewal will be necessary. Qualifications 3+ years in banking, operations or compliance regulations and policies related to BSA/AML Well organized, critical thinking and ability to prioritize workload and use sound judgement Excellent verbal and written communication skills Attention to detail Compensation The base pay range for this position is USD $26.00/Hr. - USD $35.00/Hr. Exact offers will be determined based on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and location.
summary: East West Bank is seeking a BSA Analyst II to review SAR (Suspicious Activity Reports) filings for high-risk customers. This role involves researching, analyzing, and investigating potential suspicious activity, understanding bank products, services, and customer profiles, and recommending account closures. The position requires 3+ years of experience in banking, operations, or compliance regulations related to BSA/AML.  The successful candidate will have strong critical thinking, prioritization, and communication skills, as well as attention to detail. The position offers a flexible hybrid schedule.

title: Corporate Strategy - Analyst III - Business Intelligence - Hybrid - Sacramento, CA
description: TITLE: ANALYST III – BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE STATUS: EXEMPT REPORT TO: MANAGER BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE DEPARTMENT: CORPORATE STRATEGY JOB CODE: 11460 PAY RANGE : $89,600.00 - $92,000.00 ANNUALLY General Description The Analyst III on the Business Intelligence team provides reporting and information to our business partners. Work closely with credit union personnel and business partners to identify and maximize opportunities to create monitoring and reporting using information to improve products, services and/or business processes. This includes gathering, preparing, analyzing, and summarizing data from multiple systems or external sources for into visualizations for management’s reference to guide strategic development. This mid-level analyst with Golden 1 Credit Union where you will work with leadership or senior analysts on complex analysis to develop your skills. Leadership on the team working as a subject matter expert or technical expert will be expected. Projects will require the use of critical thinking and communication to complete, along with technical skills including SQL, PowerBI and Excel. You will also need to be able to quickly understand, clean and interpret data for use in the reporting. Tasks, Duties, Functions Create data storytelling, converting data into usable information to assist the Credit Union in making data driven decisions. Assist Leadership and Senior Analysts with complex analysis, using data to add value to our business partners. Using PowerBI, create visuals that will assist Senor Management with business decisions. Using PowerBI, Excel and SQL, aggregate multiple data sources into a single story to summarize the results of a review into actionable points for Senior Management. Develop reports for executive management and credit union committees, ensuring that the reports are accurate and thorough. Assist with automation of Excel based reports. Assist with requirement gathering using interviews, document analysis, use cases, scenarios, and workflow analysis. Continue to expand on an understanding of lending/deposit rates, policies and procedures impacting responsibilities. Update procedures in response to changes in operational activities or technological upgrades. Perform reviews or validations of Business Intelligence Analyst I work prior to, or in lieu of, review by Team Leadership. Ensure compliance with applicable standards, rules, regulations, and systems of internal control. Work with Leadership and with other Analysts on complex analysis, using data to add value to our business partners. Use Statistical concepts and tools to find causation, patterns, and trends. Assist with modeling and model creation to solve complex problems. Recommend enhancements to analytical modeling tools to further support strategic plans and initiatives. Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements for projects. Develop and Recommend Internal Controls improvements. PHYSICAL SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND EXERTION UTILIZED IN THE PERFORMANCE OF THESE TASK: Effective oral and written communication skills required to assist other staff, share reports, coach staff, communicate clearly with management, and perform other related tasks. Must possess sufficient manual dexterity to skillfully operate standard office equipment, such as financial calculators, personal computer, and telephone. Organizational Contacts & Relationships INTERNAL: All levels of staff and management. EXTERNAL: Vendors, other financial institutions, business partners and industry peers. Qualifications EDUCATION: Requires a bachelor's degree in area of specialty (Accounting, Mathematics, Business Administration, Information Technology, or similarly quantitative/analytical degrees). Equivalent work experience with required knowledge/skills may be substituted for degree. EXPERIENCE: 5+ years or more of progressive banking/credit union experience. 5+ years of Analytical Experience. Knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices, and procedures within credit union operations. KNOWLEDGE / SKILLS: Technical Skills Required- knowledge in the following systems/applications: Microsoft Excel- Formulas, functions, pivot tables, dashboard creation, data connections and writing macros. PDF Creation/Editing (Nitro Pro) Microsoft Power BI - Building Visuals using existing Datasets, and Power BI Desktop to build datasets and complex reporting. SQL Programming - Select Statements, Joins, Aggregating Data, and Querying. Preferred- knowledge in the following systems/applications: SAS Enterprise Guide - Data Manipulation and transformation, data aggregation using the GUI tool. VBA Coding to support automation of tasks. Leadership Guides external stakeholders to proper resources for inquiries. Provide guidance and training to Junior Business Intelligence Analysts. Mentor and develop employees throughout the department to assist with skills growth. Effective delegation skills; knows when to delegate and when to lead. Supports team and department leadership with projects. Supports teammates. Behavior Self-Motivated, can stay focused with minimal oversight. Takes ownership of their own professional and personal development to ensure their skills remain current and relevant. Attention to detail; ensures accuracy in work product. Ability to independently prioritize tasks. Leverages available tools and resources to stay organized and proactive. Knows when work product requires additional attention to presentation and acts accordingly to ensure deliverables match the need. Is available and sought after as a resource of relevant skill and knowledge. Takes initiative to identify, investigate and resolve stakeholder issues, including operational and support situations. Ability to structure workload, adding or delegating tasks as time allows. Establishes, monitors, and reports key performance indicators. Communication and Interactions Contributes to an inclusive environment, where everyone is treated with courtesy, dignity, and respect, regardless of perceived differences. Fully participates in meetings, proactively bringing forward relevant information, ideas, and potential solutions. Communicates clearly and concisely, both in written and oral form. Able to speak in technical and business language based on the audience. Ability to ask relevant probing questions of external stakeholders to ensure appropriate accounting treatment. Solid presentation skills; Speaks clearly and confidently. Makes complicated information understandable to the audience. Confident communicating with all levels of management outside the team, including executive leadership. Takes time to understand co-workers work goals and supports them in their effort to do their best work. Physical Requirements Prolonged sitting throughout the workday with occasional mobility required. Corrected vision within the normal range. Hearing within normal range. A device to enhance hearing will be provided if needed. Ability to lift 15 lbs. as may be required. Occasional movements throughout the department daily to interact with staff, accomplish tasks, etc. Licenses / Certifications Preferred: Data Analytics Certification like: Certified Analytics Professional (CAP), IBM Data Science Professional Certificate, Datacamp Analyst Certification, Microsoft Data Analyst Associate Certification, SQL Certification, or other graduate work in the fields of finance, business intelligence or data analytics. THIS JOB DESCRIPTION IN NO WAY STATES OR IMPLIES THAT THESE ARE THE ONLY DUTIES TO BE PERFORMED BY THIS EMPLOYEE. HE OR SHE WILL BE REQUIRED TO FOLLOW OTHER INSTRUCTIONS AND TO PERFORM OTHER DUTIES REQUESTED BY HIS OR HER SUPERVISOR THAT ARE WITHIN HIS / HER KNOWLEDGE, SKILL AND ABILITY AS WELL AS HIS / HER MENTAL AND PHYSICAL ABILITIES. REV. 06/26/2024 Apply Now

title: Sr. Business Systems Analyst - Growth Initiatives (Remote)
description: #WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight. About The Role CrowdStrike is looking for a Senior Salesforce Business Systems Analyst to join our fast growing Customer Applications team. In this role, you will work closely with business partners to align technology solutions with business needs. Based on your deep understanding of the business, you will be responsible for designing, managing, strategizing and improving our Salesforce Growth applications. Working with the IT teams, you will help design and implement features that enable our Sales, Professional Services and Finance teams around our sales processes. You will also define the scope of technical projects and oversee execution. Our mission is to implement and optimize systems and applications that make it easier to do business at CrowdStrike. What You’ll Do Partner with business stakeholders to maintain a prioritized strategic roadmap, and coordinate and execute Service Cloud, Commerce Cloud, Marketing Cloud and Data Cloud related projects and enhancements.. Provide strong analytical, problem solving, technical, and project management skills to effectively collect requirements, evaluate options, and design and deliver quality solutions. Own functional tasks and deliverables, including, but not limited to process definition, requirements gathering, vendor selection, fit/gap analysis, functional design, testing, training, reporting, support, and continuous improvement of business applications. Create and maintain project, application and architectural design documents and Salesforce development best practices Independently drive sprint planning sessions, standups, retrospective and cross-functional design sessions adhering to Agile best practices. Work to drive adoption and alignment across the company’s business processes and systems. Ensure the consistency and quality of related data across Salesforce and integrated systems. Use and recommend best practices while delivering scalable high quality solutions. What You’ll Need Bachelor's degree (technical degree preferred). 6+ years of experience implementing, configuring and administering SaaS business systems for a software company, with at least 2 years of Salesforce Service Cloud, Commerce Cloud, Sales Cloud, Marketing Cloud . Detail-oriented, organized, self-motivated, hard working, and a great team player with excellent interpersonal skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills required, including experience meeting with and presenting information to senior leadership. Salesforce.com certification (Administrator, Advanced Administrator, Service Cloud Specialist) preferred but not required. Passion for creating a frictionless end user experience. Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving scenario. Strong knowledge and understanding of the Salesforce.com platform, ecosystem and best-practices. Benefits Of Working At CrowdStrike Remote-first culture Market leader in compensation and equity awards Competitive vacation and flexible working arrangements Comprehensive and inclusive health benefits Physical and mental wellness programs Paid parental leave, including adoption A variety of professional development and mentorship opportunities Offices with stocked kitchens when you need to fuel innovation and collaboration We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone feels seen, heard, valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. Our approach to cultivating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is rooted in listening, learning and collective action. By embracing the diversity of our people, we achieve our best work and fuel innovation - generating the best possible outcomes for our customers and the communities they serve. CrowdStrike is committed to maintaining an environment of Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action. If you need reasonable accommodation to access the information provided on this website, please contact Recruiting@crowdstrike.com , for further assistance. CrowdStrike participates in the E-Verify program. Notice of E-Verify Participation Right to Work CrowdStrike, Inc. is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The base salary range for this position in the U.S. is $115,000 - $185,000 per year + variable/incentive compensation + equity + benefits. A candidate’s salary is determined by various factors including, but not limited to, relevant work experience, skills, certifications and location. Expected Close Date of Job Posting is:08-20-2024

This role involves collaborating with business stakeholders to align technology solutions with needs, designing and managing Salesforce Growth applications (Service Cloud, Commerce Cloud, Marketing Cloud, and Data Cloud), defining technical project scope, and overseeing implementation. The ideal candidate has 6+ years of experience implementing, configuring, and administering SaaS business systems, with at least 2 years of Salesforce Service Cloud, Commerce Cloud, Sales Cloud, and Marketing Cloud experience. title: Senior Performance Analyst
description: Position Summary The Senior Performance Analyst position will join the Performance & Attribution team, which is part of the Investment Risk & Quantitative Research Group. This team supports performance validation, analysis, and insights for TCW investment portfolios, including Fixed Income, Equity, Emerging Markets, among others. Although the initial focus will be on Fixed Income, the role will eventually expand to cover other TCW assets. The role is part of a team responsible for the overall performance and attribution cycle. This cycle includes the review and validation of security returns, management of systems for calculating security and portfolio performance, review of portfolio returns, performance attribution calculation and analysis, and ongoing ad hoc performance and attribution inquiries. The team is dynamic and works closely with key stakeholders across the firm, frequently interacting with the Portfolio Management, Risk, Product Specialist, RFP, Technology, and Investment Operations teams. Essential Duties Manage the performance validation process by reviewing and validating daily and monthly security returns and portfolio performance Conduct thorough investigation of performance outliers, analyze findings, and make recommendations on adjustments Interface with investment management, product specialist, RFP, and operations teams regularly to address performance inquires and related requests Ensure data integrity and accuracy in all performance and attribution reports Work closely with the investment teams and IT to support development and implementation of performance attribution model enhancements Collaborate with the investment and risk teams to understand portfolio strategies and ensure accurate reflection in the attribution analysis Complete ad-hoc performance projects on an on-going basis Stay abreast of industry best practices and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives within the performance analysis function Contribute heavily to the performance attribution workstream of the Aladdin implementation efforts. Required Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting or related field 10+ years of experience in portfolio performance validation and attribution Familiarity with performance attribution models and vendor platforms in the industry Proficient in Excel with demonstrated knowledge and experience in formula writing Solid knowledge of fixed income, equity, and derivatives securities Professional Skills Qualifications Strong analytical skills and rigorous attention to detail Solid written and verbal communication skills A quick learner and a strong team player Demonstrated ability to take initiative and ownership of responsibilities A self-motivated individual with high professionalism and accountability Desired Qualifications Master’s degree CFA and/or CIPM Knowledge of SQL, VBA, and/or Python strongly preferred Fixed income attribution related experience Estimated Compensation Base Salary: For CA based position, the base salary range is $185k to $200k . This is an anticipated range only. Other Compensation : Eligible to be considered for an annual discretionary bonus Benefits : Eligible for TCW’s comprehensive benefits package. title: Business Analyst - Private Capital
description: Who You'll Work With You will join our Private Capital practice in our New York office to work in teams and directly with our clients to help solve some of their most difficult problems. You will also work with a range of experts in the firm, from data scientists and researchers to software and app designers. McKinsey’s Private Capital practice is the world’s leading advisor to the Private Equity and Principal Investor industry. We work with investors of all types Private Equity firms, distressed debt/credit investors, real estate, and infrastructure firms, as well as the institutional investors these alternative investment managers serve, including pensions, sovereign wealth funds, family offices, and endowments. We serve these clients across the deal cycle, assisting with deal identification, due diligence, and portfolio company operational improvements, as well as on firm-level topics including strategy, governance, and operations. What You'll Do You will work in teams of typically 3–5 consultants, playing an active role in all aspects of the client engagement. This includes gathering and analyzing information, formulating and testing hypotheses, and developing and communicating recommendations to leadership. As a Business Analyst within Private Capital, your work will involve conducting extensive due diligence work, which may include collecting historical deal-related information, developing and executing a comprehensive work plan, reviewing contracts and policies, analyzing data, identifying risks, conducting competitor analysis, financial analysis, and valuation, and gathering a comprehensive set of data. During your first few years with the firm, you will consult on multiple client engagements and work with a number of colleagues and investor clients in a range of industries. When you join McKinsey, you are joining a firm that will invest in your professional development. As a Private Capital Business Analyst, you will Structure ambiguous problems and take action to solve them; Synthesize clear takeaways from complex information into clear takeaways and recommendations using both qualitative and quantitative methods; Work effectively with diverse teams to come up with the best solution and move people and organizations to act; Establish trust-based relationships with clients to better serve their organizations; Communicate effectively with all audiences, including senior leaders, in a structured manner; Develop your leadership style, leveraging your own experiences, strengths, and personal values. McKinsey believes in strengths-based development and coaching, and you’ll receive frequent mentoring from colleagues. This will include a senior colleague from your office or practice who will help you grow and achieve your career goals. Additionally, you will have a professional development manager who manages your staffing based on your priorities as well as the needs of client service teams. Qualifications Undergraduate or master’s degree or 1+ years of work experience after completing your undergraduate degree Outstanding record of academic achievement Demonstrated experience or strong interest in the investing industry, with a basic understanding of industry functioning, drivers, or key players based on work experience, internships, or your studies Proven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills Demonstrated aptitude for analytics Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment Ability to work effectively with people at all levels in an organization Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively – both verbally and in writing – in English and the local office language(s)
summary: McKinsey is seeking a Business Analyst to join its Private Capital practice in New York. The role involves working with clients in the Private Equity and Principal Investor industry, conducting due diligence, and providing strategic consulting services. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical background, experience in the investing industry, and excellent communication skills.

Researching, collating, manipulating, analysing, maintaining, and presenting data for the business decision-making process. Preparing and maintaining interactive dashboards, producing for and contributing to, regular weekly and monthly reporting Supporting team members with project related controls, including administration, procurement, payment, invoicing, reporting and budgeting Supporting Strategic Projects What you need to have: You are a graduate, or recent graduate looking for a challenging role. You may already have similar experience as a project accountant working with fixed cost or per hour contracts. You enjoy using data to identify and solve problems and help others to succeed. To be successful in this role, most likely you will have: A degree in Mathematics, Finance, Commerce, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent PowerBi knowledge and skills Excellent excel and data analysis skills What we offer: A competitive remuneration package and employee benefits Flexible working arrangements designed to suit individual circumstances and family needs Birthday and study leave Wellness Days to allow you to focus on your own physical and or mental wellbeing A workplace where you can access 2 weeks additional leave each year so you can take that extra break with family or friends We applaud your need to give back to the community and give you 2 paid volunteer days each year to support one of our-affiliated charities A collaborative and fun culture Plus, so much more! What are the next steps? Click on "Apply" to submit your formal application and our Talent Acquisition Team will be in touch. Don't delay - we'll be moving fast as soon as we find the perfect candidate.
summary: Shine, a strategy, identity and campaigning agency, is seeking a Graduate Business Analyst to join their Business Excellence and Enablement Group. The role involves data analysis, development of analytics tools, and supporting strategic projects. The ideal candidate will have a degree in a relevant field, Power BI knowledge, excellent Excel skills, and a passion for using data to solve problems.

title: Business Analyst
description: Company Description Afficiency is a rapidly growing Insurtech startup whose mission is to provide life insurance to everyone on the platforms they already trust. Located in NYC, we design life insurance products that can be purchased entirely digitally and can be easily embedded into distribution platforms or with agents who sell insurance. The company is experiencing exponential growth and is well-funded. We are looking for new team members to join us on our journey to shake up the life insurance industry. We need individuals who bring passion, curiosity, and a desire for excellence. We are seeking a self-starter; a proactive and self-motivated individual who thrives in a dynamic environment and can independently initiate and drive projects to completion. Job Description We are looking for experienced life insurance BAs, keen to grow their skills and stretch in new directions, in an insurtech environment working rapidly to reinvent the way life insurance is deployed. Strong experience and aptitude with generating lengthy and detailed project artifacts is a must. You will work under the supervision of our Project Managers and subject matter experts, but have the opportunity to own your work and grow into additional responsibilities. Our projects require coordination and working between our life insurance carriers, distributors, and technology partners. Qualifications Drafting detailed requirements documentation for all aspects of the digital life insurance sales process, including UX journeys, product specifications, point of sale controls, underwriting and forms, working with SMEs and Project Managers. Working with a range of project artifacts including BRDs, FRDs, process maps, workflow diagrams, data mapping spreadsheets, etc., to capture all detail necessary for the implementation of client builds. Working with internal and external stakeholders to gather requirements, review documentation, make edits in real-time and asynchronously, manage version control, signoffs and implementation. Support testing and signoff – act as requirements SME to QA and UAT teams (you know the requirements, you will be the first port of call for explaining ‘how it should work’) Collaborate with internal project team to identify and deliver steps to translate requirements to build implementation Collaborate on test plan designs and execution Represent Afficiency with our business partners, delivering a professional and smooth experience through an often-fast paced development cycle Must Have 2-5 years of experience as a business analyst/associate in a life insurance or insurtech function Demonstrable experience in drafting and maintaining BRDs, FRDs, process maps, workflow diagrams and similar Experience in start-ups, consulting, or similar fast-paced, self-starter environment a plus Experience / comfortable with both industry *and* technical worlds - willingness to talk UX, APIs, and platforms. We’re not looking for a pure IT BA, you don’t have to be a coder, but be prepared to work around them! Ability to quickly embrace change and adapt effectively in response. Organized, detailed oriented, and able to prioritize and communicate status to stakeholders. Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving abilities. Superb verbal and written communication skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams, using email, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint (or Google-equivalent Applications). Bachelor/Master's degree. Additional Information What We Offer Fully remote work Competitive salary with equity options Robust health, dental, and vision benefits for employee and dependents 401k matching contributions Generous PTO policy Stipend to purchase work-from-home equipment. Work at a supportive and fast-growing startup with a fantastic team Environment to learn from other team members, grow a business from the ground up. Support in developing your skills and accelerating your career quickly. Opportunity to make an impact in the lives of tens of millions of consumers and get families the protection they need. Salary $70,000-90,000 per year with excellent benefits. Work Arrangement Remote Afficiency is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
summary: Afficiency, a rapidly growing Insurtech startup, is looking for a Business Analyst with 2-5 years of experience in the life insurance industry. The candidate will be responsible for drafting detailed requirements documentation for all aspects of the digital life insurance sales process, including UX journeys, product specifications, point of sale controls, underwriting and forms. They will also work with internal and external stakeholders to gather requirements, review documentation, and manage version control. The candidate must have strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving abilities, as well as superb verbal and written communication skills. The position offers a competitive salary with equity options, robust benefits, and the opportunity to work in a supportive and fast-growing startup environment.

title: Business Analyst
description: Trace One is a global leader in Product lifecycle management (PLM) and compliance solutions within the process manufacturing and retail CPG space. With more than 30 years of industry expertise, we deliver innovative and scalable solutions that support the entire product manufacturing lifecycle and equip our customers to thrive in new markets. Serving more than 9,000 brand owners worldwide, Trace One is committed to delivering the best in every aspect of business, including solutions, data standardization and access, customer success and social and environmental responsibility. Business Analyst Role As a Business Analyst, you are responsible for the innovative business and functional requirements lifecycle, including the requirements collection from various stakeholders, the business and functional requirements definition and design, the requirements alignment and harmonization, their prioritization based on the product vision, and the development monitoring through the methodology applied for each project. You oversee the software implementation iterations making sure that practices, rules, and values are understood, and behaviors are compliant to the Trace One methodology. You ensure that goals, scope, and product domain are understood by everyone in the project team. Responsibilities: Lead workshop sessions with the customer to capture requirements and effectively document them. Act for multiple projects at the same time according to the statements of work. Deliver elements of systems design, including data migration rules, business rules, prototype, or other detailed deliverables. Work closely with the PM, Product, Regulatory, and other departments to design the solution for the given requirements and meet the project constraints. Is responsible, together with the Enterprise Solution Architect, of the design of the solution (through the Business Blueprint document) for the project. Refine and document detailed user requirements, provide clarity for the Development and QA functions. Work with Project teams to enforce best practice implementations and optimizing core product reuse. Specifically, refining requirements with Professional Services team members (and end customers where appropriate) to provide functional clarity and relevance. Validate the product in the development phases following the methodology defined for each project. Support the QA testing processes effort, including development of user acceptance criteria. Support training efforts for Services, Sales, and Marketing departments. Develop and provide PLM solution expertise. Assist with the business case definition for innovation proposals. Support Sales and Pre-Sales departments on RFIs and RFPs, when needed. Work with third-party entities such as system integrators and consulting companies. Core Competencies: Demonstrated outstanding written and verbal communication, including technical writing skills. Ability to conduct demonstrations of the software and maintain the communication at the business and functional level. Self-starter with leadership skills to take charge of or facilitate requirement-gathering sessions. Quick learner on new products, systems, applications, and technologies. Able to work well with both internal and external clients, including the ability to proactively participate in user group workshops. Analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills. Willing to travel to customer premises in the requirements gathering phase. Experience in PLM software implementations, preferably in the food & beverage industry. Education Expertise: 5 years+ experience in preparing functional requirements, working with use cases, business process modelling, and preparing use-case or sequence diagrams. B.S. Food Science and Technology or equivalent experience as Business Analyst in a Food & Beverage market industry. Knowledge of the full Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC). Knowledge of and experience in the use software design and modelling tools (e.g. UML etc.). Trace One is an equal opportunity employer
summary: Trace One seeks a Business Analyst with 5+ years of experience in functional requirements, use cases, business process modeling, and software design and modeling tools. The role involves leading workshops to capture customer requirements, defining and designing business and functional requirements, aligning and harmonizing requirements, prioritizing based on product vision, and monitoring development. Responsibilities include working closely with stakeholders, designing solutions, refining user requirements, validating products, supporting testing, and providing training. The ideal candidate possesses strong communication, problem-solving, and analytical skills, and has experience in PLM software implementations, preferably in the food & beverage industry.

title: Business analyst
description: Client: Mizuho Location: NYC Hybrid: 3 days in the office (local) Start Date: ASAP End Date: 12/31/2024 with probably extensions Interview process: 3 rounds but they can go fast: 1st and 2nd are 30 minute zoom calls. 3rd and final is onsite. Big Four experience a plus Excellent communication skills, verbal and written Financial services experience not required Need linlkedin Key Input From Client We need seriously experienced people with analytical skills and minds who have operated successfully in disciplined environments where people proactively document all sorts of things - process flows, meeting action items, requirements, test cases and test results, BRDs. And they are used to setting deadlines for everything and don’t need to be pushed to do it. Jd Drive delivery of key initiatives through disciplined and effective business analysis, data analysis, testing, and change management; projects that may include CRM, strategic data repository, data controls model and business intelligence tools Requirements analysis responsibilities include requirements gathering and documentation, process analysis and documentation (process flow diagrams), development of user stories and business requirements documents (BRDs), mock-ups of screens Perform analysis of business requirements and data elements in support regular and ad hoc management reporting Work with front office to define and document business requirements Analyze and identify opportunities for business process improvement and technology efficiencies Quality assurance responsibilities may include test planning, refinement of user stories to include clear exit criteria, test case documentation & execution, coordination of user acceptance testing (UAT), analysis of test results and summary of test results for team and management consumption Minimum Job Requirements / Experience All or part of (depending on the level) the following is required: BA or BS degree 6+ years’ experience in a hands-on BA capacity working on technology implementation and/or business transformation initiatives Extensive experience producing high-quality business requirements documents (BRDs) and working in tandem with development partners Experience with both agile and waterfall and adaptive methodologies a plus Highly analytical & strategic thinker who distills complex ideas & research down to what matters Strong business, analytical, quantitative, problem-solving and decision-making skills Skilled in Jira (Confluence a plus) Highly responsive, mature and accountable in all aspects; a trusted partner to staff of all levels in both business and technology organizations Very strong skills with advance MS-Excel, SQL / VBA, PowerPoint and tools to create mock-ups of screens / user designs Consistent accuracy and attention to details in work product Ability to plan, organize and handle multiple tasks simultaneously, with limited supervision Superior oral/written communication skills Strong drive and motivation to excel; keen to learn more and assume more responsibility Thrives in a diverse, multi-cultural environment Some Additional Notes From The Client From this point forward let’s only consider BAs who have at least 2-3 years experience as a BA on technology projects for a major consulting firm - eg, Deloitte, Accenture, etc. People who excel at the BA basics, gathering / soliciting, analyzing, documenting and organizing requirements. Understanding and documenting process flows. Writing good use cases. People with very business-oriented resumes and not the usual laundry list of tech buzz words and jargon that suggest they have more experience than they do. The technically-oriented BAs who have worked in IT organizations do not qualify, full stop. Financial services experience not important. If they have strong BA experience thru the full SDLC and the baseline BA skills noted above they will do well.
summary: Mizuho is seeking a highly experienced Business Analyst (BA) with a strong track record of success in technology implementation and business transformation initiatives. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 6 years of experience in a hands-on BA role, with a focus on delivering key initiatives through disciplined and effective analysis, data analysis, testing, and change management. The role will involve gathering and documenting requirements, analyzing and documenting processes, developing user stories and BRDs, and collaborating with development partners throughout the SDLC. Experience with both Agile and Waterfall methodologies is a plus. The ideal candidate will also have a strong understanding of financial services concepts and demonstrate excellent communication, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.

title: Business Analyst, Amazon Fresh
description: Description Do you have relentless grit, a love for problem solving, high ownership, high learn and be curious, and some level of retail business experience (so absolutely everything isn’t a ramp, since we technically support all retail functions)? If so, this role is for you! We are looking for an experienced Business Analyst who is excited about using data analysis and acquiring deep business expertise to answer difficult business questions that drive decision and action for the Amazon Fresh business. This role will focus on solving critical catalog defects in the US and will be responsible for analyzing all aspects of our business to provide insights that inform business strategy and solve complex problems. Our team seeks to Invent and Simplify solutions that increase the speed and quality of decision-making through business analysis and reporting, econometric research and models, business process automation, and cloud computing infrastructure. Analytics is the first line of defense for analyzing acute business problems that inform or impact KPIs. In this role, you must be comfortable dealing with ambiguity, be an effective communicator, and be organized. Our business moves rapidly, and it’s important to be able to adapt to the latest changes in the business, systems, tools, and techniques for extracting, processing, analyzing, modeling, and taking action on data. You will work directly with business stakeholders to define strategy and requirements, and then lead analyses from design through delivery. Key job responsibilities As a Business Analyst on our team, you will focus on exciting and challenging problems, including: Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing and ad-hoc metrics, reports, and analyses, to drive key business decisions Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format Partner with BIEs and Finance to scale automated solutions and collect stakeholder feedback to drive improvement over time Develop mechanisms and metrics to track stakeholder satisfaction and drive projects to continuously improve satisfaction scores Learn new technology and techniques such that you can meaningfully support product and process innovation Engage business stakeholders in constructive dialogues to convert business problems into logic problems that can be solved with data, scripting, and visualizations Work closely with data engineering, product management, and business stakeholders to deliver features to customers Basic Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent 3+ years of business analyst, data analyst or similar role experience 3+ years of Excel or Tableau (data manipulation, macros, charts and pivot tables) experience Experience in Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools Experience with SQL Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders Proven problem solving skills, project management skills, attention to detail, and exceptional organizational skills Ability to display complex quantitative data in a simple, intuitive format and to present findings in a clear and concise manner Preferred Qualifications Master's degree in business or analytical discipline 5+ years of business analyst, data analyst or similar role experience 5+ years of business or financial analysis experience 5+ years of Excel or Tableau (data manipulation, macros, charts and pivot tables) experience Prior experience in Retail, Consumables, and/or Supply Chain Management industry Proficient in a programming language (e.g., Python) for automation of data extraction, processing, and computation Experience working with AWS products and environment (e.g., Redshift, S3) Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us. Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $66,900/year in our lowest geographic market up to $143,100/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site. Company - Amazon.com Services LLC Job ID: A2673624
summary: Amazon Fresh is seeking an experienced Business Analyst with a passion for problem-solving and data analysis. The role involves using data to address catalog defects, inform business strategy, and solve complex problems. The ideal candidate has strong analytical, communication, and organizational skills, and is comfortable dealing with ambiguity. They will be responsible for developing metrics, reports, and analyses to drive key business decisions, partnering with stakeholders to define strategy and requirements. The role requires experience in data visualization tools, SQL, and problem-solving, as well as a strong understanding of retail, consumables, and/or supply chain management.

title: Business Analyst
description: Job Description: We are seeking a skilled and adaptable Business Analyst to join our team. This role requires a blend of business acumen and analytical expertise, along with exceptional problem-solving skills. The ideal candidate will be tasked with enhancing the quality and efficiency of our business processes by leveraging data-driven insights to recommend strategic and operational improvements. Your work will influence key business decisions across multiple departments including finance, operations, sales, and IT. Key Responsibilities Requirements Gathering: Conduct thorough stakeholder interviews and workshops to gather business requirements. Develop comprehensive understanding of business needs and pain points. Process Mapping and Analysis: Analyze current processes to identify inefficiencies and areas for improvement. Create detailed business process models and workflow diagrams using industry-standard tools like Visio or Lucidchart. Data Analysis and Reporting: Collect, compile, and analyze data from various internal and external sources. Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using tools such as Excel, SQL, Power BI, or Tableau to support business decisions. Solution Design and Implementation: Propose and design practical solutions to improve business processes, reduce costs, enhance customer satisfaction, and achieve operational excellence. Collaborate with IT and other departments to implement these solutions effectively. Change Management: Support the organization through change initiatives, ensuring smooth transitions by managing stakeholders’ expectations and communication. Facilitate training sessions and create documentation to assist users in adopting new systems or processes. Project Management: Manage projects from inception to completion. Define project scope, goals, and deliverables that support business goals in collaboration with senior management and stakeholders. Performance Metrics: Develop and track key performance indicators to measure the effectiveness of implemented solutions and continuously improve business practices. Qualifications Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Science, or related field. A Master’s degree or professional certifications (such as CBAP, PMP) are beneficial. Experience: 2-5 years of experience in a business analysis role, with proven success in project management and process improvement. Technical Skills: Proficiency in MS Office, especially Excel, and familiarity with SQL databases and business intelligence tools. Knowledge of ERP systems or CRM platforms like SAP or Salesforce is a plus. Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to handle complex data and generate meaningful insights. Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to interact effectively with all levels of management and staff. Proficiency in preparing clear and concise reports and presentations. Interpersonal Skills: Strong facilitation and negotiation skills, capable of managing stakeholder expectations and mediating compromises. Compensation Salary: The base salary for this position typically ranges from $65,000 to $90,000 per year, depending on experience, location, and company size. Bonus: Performance-based bonuses are available, which can add a significant percentage to the total compensation package. Benefits: Comprehensive benefits package including health insurance, retirement plans with company match, paid time off, flexible working conditions, and opportunities for career advancement and professional development. Work Environment This position may involve a combination of on-site and remote work, with flexibility depending on project needs and company policy. The role may require occasional travel for off-site meetings, training, or conferences. As a Business Analyst within our company, you will play a crucial role in driving improvements and ensuring the successful execution of business strategies. This position offers the opportunity to work in a dynamic and collaborative environment, where you will be empowered to take initiative and drive change.
summary: We are looking for a Business Analyst with 2-5 years of experience to improve business processes by gathering requirements, analyzing data, designing solutions, and managing projects. This role requires strong analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills. The ideal candidate will have experience with Excel, SQL databases, and business intelligence tools, and may have experience with ERP systems or CRM platforms like SAP or Salesforce. This position offers a salary of $65,000 to $90,000 per year, performance-based bonuses, health insurance, retirement plans, paid time off, flexible working conditions, and opportunities for career advancement and professional development.

title: Strategy Analyst (recent grads welcome!)
description: Company Description Level All is a well-funded, fast-growing media and technology company. Our mission is to build products and content that improves the outcomes of high school students in the United States. We embrace inclusivity and are building a diverse team with people from a wide variety of cultural and life experiences. , Job Description We are on the search for a Strategy Analyst to join our dynamic Strategy team. You will work closely on our existing products and new initiatives. You will have the opportunity to help shape our product and direction and see your work have a real-world impact. This is a full-time role working onsite at our Midtown Manhattan office 4 days per week. Analyze and synthesize data, information and knowledge from external sources into compelling insights-driven, fact-based reports Support senior leaders in developing plans to address business opportunities Document, review, and conduct research regarding existing and potential business relationships Assist in preparation of presentations for schools, sponsors and partners Contribute and participate in a wide range of company initiatives, ability to “wear many hats” Other projects as assigned , Qualifications Excellent research, analytic and communication skills Exceptional attention to detail and the ability to deliver under deadline pressures Self-starter with the ability to work independently as well as collaboratively with others Goal-oriented, project-oriented, and results-oriented Resourceful, curious, eager to learn, and extremely organized Desire to be part of an intellectually rich and action-oriented work environment Excellent computer skills (Excel, PowerPoint) Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience Additional Information Level All does not provide work authorization and/or visa sponsorship. Compensation range: $60,000 - $65,000 per year. This represents the expected compensation range for this job requisition. Ultimately, we will consider location, skills, relevant experience, and other job-related factors in determining our offer. Level All is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Business Analyst
description: Summary & Scope We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Business Planning Analyst to join the Club Monaco Planning & Allocation team. The Business Planning Analyst will be responsible for analyzing sales and key performance indicators to optimize sales performance and drive overall profitability. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of retail operations, excellent quantitative skills, and the ability to communicate insights effectively. Reporting to the Director of Business Planning, this individual will work cross-functionally with both the Retail, E-commerce, Merchandising, Operations, and Finance teams. Business Analyst Responsibilities Responsible for pulling and publishing the daily sales reporting with accuracy and speed Support in the completion and analysis for the weekly and monthly business presentations Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and performance metrics to track progress towards business goals. Breakout topline budget from a bottoms up for both stores vs Ecom at a daily level Support reforecast process based on current trend and future promotional cadence Provide analysis of promotional activity for both stores and Ecom Assist in streamlining reporting to allow for improved business analysis Analyze sales data, customer demographics, and market trends to identify opportunities for growth and improvement. Develop forecasts and projections to support inventory planning and purchasing decisions. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and implement strategies to optimize sales and profitability. Prepare and present reports and insights to senior management, providing actionable recommendations based on data analysis. Continuously assess and improve analytical processes and methodologies to enhance efficiency and accuracy. Support in the completion and analysis for the weekly and monthly business presentations Requirements Bachelors degree required 1-2 years business planning, retail analytics, or related field experience (preferred) Highly motivated with a strong foundation in analytical skills and an aptitude for understanding financial metrics with the ability to translate data into actionable insights A hands-on problem solver with a willingness to work in the details and find opportunities to change processes to drive efficiency Ability to synthesize business performance into key highlights, root cause analysis and action plans Proven ability to build strong cross-functional partnerships and influence others Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills; ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines Works well with ambiguity Computer proficiency in MS Office: Excel, Outlook, Word as well as the ability to quickly master new applications and systems such as D365, Power BI, Salesforce (preferred) For individuals assigned and/or hired to work in New York, Club Monaco includes a reasonable estimate of the salary or hourly rate range for this role. This accounts for the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions; including but not limited to business or organizational needs, skill sets, experience and training, licensure, and certifications. A reasonable estimate of the current base salary range is $60,000 per year to $65,000 per year.
summary: The Business Planning Analyst role at Club Monaco focuses on analyzing sales data and key performance indicators to optimize sales performance and drive profitability. Responsibilities include daily sales reporting, KPI monitoring, budget breakdowns, reforecasting, promotional analysis, sales data analysis, forecasting, collaboration with cross-functional teams, report preparation, and process improvement. title: Business Continuity Analyst
description: Salary: $ 91,500.00 We have partnered with a financial company in the New York, NY area to provide them with a Business Continuity Analyst. Please review the below description and let us know if you are interested. Prioritized Must Haves For The Business Continuity Analyst #1. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent #2. Must have experience in business continuity planning #3. Professional designation – Certified Business Continuity Professional (CBCP, MBCI) is a plus Responsibilities For The Business Continuity Analyst The Business Continuity Analyst reports to the Business Continuity Coordinator in the Planning Department. This role requires a deep understanding of business continuity planning and crisis management methodologies. The business continuity analyst will maintain and improve the business continuity and crisis management functions of the New York Branch to ensure resiliency and compliance with regulatory guidance. The business continuity analyst will support preparation for and response to actual emergencies, able to assume leadership if needed. Your Duties And Responsibilities Work closely with the Business Champions on projects that impact the resiliency of the branch, updating the business continuity team on progress. Responsible for supporting the administration of the branch’s business continuity program, including: Ensuring that program components (Business Impact Analysis, Risk Assessment, plans, strategies, etc.) are current and effective. Organizing business recovery tests and exercises, and completing After Action Reports which identify issues and lessons learned, including but not limited to: Tabletop Exercises Work Area Recovery Site tests Emergency Notification System Tests Developing schedules and materials for business continuity training and awareness to ensure all staff is proficient in implementing business continuity plans. Revising and maintaining branch wide policy, procedures, and manuals as needed Preparing reporting for executive management and the business continuity working group Administering and managing content on the Business Continuity SharePoint site Supporting the Crisis Management Team through preparing emergency communications, situational reports, ensure execution of action items, create post-incident reports. Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned by management. Requirements For The Business Continuity Analyst Bachelor’s degree or equivalent with 3 - 5+ years of related experience in business continuity planning Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, etc.) Excellent analytical skills Excellent verbal and written skills Ability to interact and work efficiently and effectively with employees across the organization. Strong administrative skills, including effectiveness in developing project plans to achieve target dates. Strong and productive team player and comfortable working independently. Professional designation – Certified Business Continuity Professional (CBCP, MBCI) is a plus. Prior business continuity experience in a financial institution is preferred. Experience managing disruptive events is preferred. Other Key Requirements Hybrid Schedule - Must be able to commute to the office a few times per week No sponsorships or visa holders. No Corp-to-Corp. Benefits Of The Business Continuity Analyst Medical Insurance Dental Insurance Retirement Plans #Hybrid About Relevante, Inc. – the Recruiting Firm Representing the Client for this Job Relevante is an accounting & technology direct hire recruiting and contract staffing firm. We help our Clients identify and recruit the best talent in the market and help our candidates win engaging and enriching jobs. Our Clients are some of the best companies to work for among F1000 and emerging fast growth companies in the region. Relevante has been consistently ranked as a fast growth company and one of the largest recruiting, accounting, and management consulting firms in the Philadelphia region. To stay connected with our network, please follow us on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/relevante.

This role requires strong analytical and communication skills, proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, and experience in business continuity planning, preferably in a financial institution.
