title: Business Analyst
description: Our client, the nation't largest state public power organization, is seeking a Business Analyst for a hybrid postion in White Plains, New York . The Business Analyst will play a key role in gathering Business, Stakeholder, functional, and technical requirements, conducting data mapping, preparing test plans and scripts, executing testing, assisting with the completion of Disaster Recovery and Technology Impact documents, assisting with stakeholder communications, and change management. Responsibilities Be proactive in eliciting requirements for process transformation initiatives. Lead or guide business stakeholders in laying out future processes. Create Business, Stakeholder, and Solution Requirements. Assist business stakeholders with transition approaches or requirements. Create Business Process Flow documents and Business Process documents. Create Technical Requirements documents. Create Requirements Traceability Matrix. Create data mapping documents and Technical Interface specification for electronic files (e-files). Create test strategy, scenarios, and scripts. Assist the team in developing application support RACI and support handover documents. Assist the team with stakeholder communications. Assist the team with the completion of provided Business Impact Assessment and Technology Impact Assessment forms. Prepare weekly status reports, meeting agendas, materials, and minutes for weekly meetings. Develop Epics, features, and user stories in Azure DevOps for technology initiatives. Create test cases and track test results where needed under the Testing COE guidance. Create and/or assist in the creation of a business case where required. Skills Extensive experience in developing business, stakeholder, and detailed requirements - functional and technical. Thorough understanding of Portfolio and project management processes. Experience in enterprise transformation initiatives. Knowledge of proper requirements specification and development, such as process/functional requirements definition methods, JAD/RAD sessions, use case development, process flow diagrams. Proactive and experienced in requirements elicitation techniques. Extensive experience in Agile and Waterfall projects. Expert knowledge in Agile and Waterfall methodologies. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and interpersonal skills. Excellent analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving abilities. A deep understanding of technical concepts, principles, and terminology. Knowledge of data science concepts and experience gathering data requirements. Ability to work in a team environment with both employees and consultants is a must. Ability to communicate effectively across many different levels of technical and business teams. Ability to engage diplomatically with stakeholders. Demonstrated experience with Agile and hybrid project methodologies. Superior presentation and negotiation skills. Proven management and organizational skills. Strong adaptability and capacity to work in fast-paced environments. Experience with Azure DevOps and other enterprise applications is a plus. Strong understanding of Agile concepts. Utilities experience is highly preferred. Work hours and location: Monday through Friday 7.5 hour work day with .5 hour unpaid lunch. Candidate REQUIRED to be LOCAL to Tri-State area Education & Certifications BS in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field from an accredited school, or equivalent. 5-10 years of applicable experience in the area of Business Analysis for Technology initiatives. Any of the following BA certifications is highly preferred: IIBA Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) IIBA Entry Certificate in Business Analysis (ECBA) IIBA Certification of Competency in Business Analysis (CCBA) IIBA Agile Analysis Certification (AAC) IQBBA Certified Foundation Level Business Analyst (CFLBA) IREB Certified Professional for Requirements Engineering (CPRE) PMI-Professional in Business Analysis (PBA) Certification Spruce Technology, Inc. is a mid-size, award-winning (Inc 5000, SmartCEO, Entrepreneur of the Year) technology services firm with a steadily growing portfolio of commercial and government clients. Spruce provides innovative technology solutions, specialized IT staff, and IT strategy consulting nationwide. Spruce maintains partnerships with major technology vendors and continually develops leading-edge offerings in service areas such as digital experience, data services, application development, infrastructure, cyber security, and IT staffing. Spruce Technology, Inc. is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information. Consistent with the Americans with Disabilities Act, it is the policy of Spruce Technology, Inc. to provide reasonable accommodation when requested by a qualified applicant or employee with a disability, unless such accommodation would cause an undue hardship. The policy regarding requests for reasonable accommodation applies to all aspects of employment, including the application process.

Primary Responsibilities You will work with business and solution owners to define and document requirements for the assigned products and services, as well as write user stories, acceptance criteria, feature description decks, process flows, manage traceability and UAT You will maintain a solid knowledge base of the functional capabilities of the various areas and products within the assigned product portfolio You will use agile methods to analyze, define and document requirements and manage traceability. You will work with stakeholders and product teams to drive consensus on scope, design and implementation decisions Provide analysis and impact to user and business for changes to current functionalities and applies problem solving skills to meet business needs Develop and integrate requirement management to the delivery approach and schedule; you will also be responsible for product quality, project timeliness, and customer satisfaction Participate in the presentation of information to customer and internal business and or IT teams Creates business / product / third party vendor specifications for product integration and implementation Essential Qualifications Minimum 6-7 years of experience as a business analyst in healthcare payer industry Expertise and experience in preparing High Level requirements, UseCases, Business Requirement Documents, Functional specifications, Test strategy & cases and Traceability matrix Proven ability to map business process and workflows, conducting gap analysis and documenting requirements, ensuring requirements are developed and tested Excellent verbal/written communication skills; comfortable leading business and technology teams within the organization to translate business issues & requirements into technical solutions Healthcare Insurance Payer in one of more of the following areas: Claims Administration, Enrollment & Eligibility, Benefit Administration, Contribution Accounting, Billing & Payment, Member, Provider and Employer facing portal/service Ability to analyze problems and resolve issues through resolution quickly and methodically Proficient with Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, Visio Knowledge of BA/ MS project Tools, JIRA, MS Project Self-motivated and detail oriented Flexibility to adapt to change and willing to learn and develop new skill sets as applicable Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience. title: Business Analyst (Healthcare)

Creating or improving existing templates for the business analysis functions. Participating in project meetings and calls with State, project, and vendor staff. Client focused business and requirements analysis experience and documentation. Conducting business process analysis and optimization in a technology environment. Creating requirements documentation. Strong analytical, written, and verbal communication skills. Bachelor’s or Master's’ degree with coursework in Information Technology, Business or Public Administration, Project Management and/or Communications. Preferred Qualifications: Familiarity with the Business Analysis Body of Knowledge (BABOK). Ability to apply industry best practices and state/federal mandates to system requirements. Experience identifying project risks/issues and proposing solutions. Ability to work independently and manage work to a defined schedule. Current Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or similar.

title: - Business Analyst
description: Level 2 Business Analyst an anticipated start date of 7/5/24, listed duration of 32 Months, located in Albany, NY (50% On-Site Requirement ) Roles & Responsibilities The Business Analyst (BA) will conduct requirements analysis of the state systems and document requirements to assist in implementation of IES. The BA will identify and document as-is and to-be IES system requirements using the IES prescribed business analysis methodology including but not limited to business process flows, detailed use cases, business rules catalogs, context diagrams, and wireframes. The BA will meet with relevant stakeholders, including agency and local district subject matter experts, users, and executive teams to elicit requirements. The BA will produce artifacts that reflect and ensure system planning, design, and delivery are in line with business needs. The BA will conduct peer reviews, understand and adhere to project timelines and priorities, and work with blended teams of State and vendor resources. NOTE: DESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONS ARE BASICALLY MANDATORY Mandatory Qualifications Level II- Between four (4) and seven (7) years of experience as a Business Analyst Between four (4) and seven (7) years of client centered business analysis experience including: Conducting and leading requirements gathering sessions, analyzing requirements gathered, working on software development projects with an active role working with stakeholders, project managers, technical teams, and other business analysts. Between four (4) and seven (7) years of extensive requirements analysis experience including: Identifying, documenting, and validating system requirements that span multiple complex domains for continuous integration and deployment and preparing proposals for best fit technology based on the elicited requirements. Desirable Qualifications Between four (4) and seven (7) years of experience identifying, documenting and validating system requirements in the Human Service domain with a focus on enrollment, eligibility, case management, financial management, and child support. Between four (4) and seven (7) years of experience identifying, documenting, and validating system requirements on a modernization project covering several complex functional domains. Between four (4) and seven (7) years of experience working independently on end-to-end business process analysis and optimization in a technology environment, while documenting the To-Be requirements for the online solution. Between four (4) and seven (7) years of experience creating requirement artifacts such as: business process flows, detailed use cases, business rules catalogs, data dictionaries, wireframes , and specifications while adhering to pre-established templates. Between four (4) and seven (7) years of experience in facilitation which may include requirement workshop preparations, facilitating and leading collaborative sessions with stakeholders, discussions with leadership, and reporting on project status. Between four (4) and seven (7) years of experience implementing web based, client facing applications and aligning requirements with federal standards, conditions, and regulations

title: Senior Business Analyst
description: Job Description: We are seeking a skilled and adaptable Senior Business Analyst to join our team. This role requires a blend of business acumen and analytical expertise, along with exceptional problem-solving skills. The ideal candidate will be tasked with enhancing the quality and efficiency of our business processes by leveraging data-driven insights to recommend strategic and operational improvements. Your work will influence key business decisions across multiple departments including finance, operations, sales, and IT. Key Responsibilities Requirements Gathering: Conduct thorough stakeholder interviews and workshops to gather business requirements. Develop comprehensive understanding of business needs and pain points. Process Mapping and Analysis: Analyze current processes to identify inefficiencies and areas for improvement. Create detailed business process models and workflow diagrams using industry-standard tools like Visio or Lucidchart. Data Analysis and Reporting: Collect, compile, and analyze data from various internal and external sources. Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using tools such as Excel, SQL, Power BI, or Tableau to support business decisions. Solution Design and Implementation: Propose and design practical solutions to improve business processes, reduce costs, enhance customer satisfaction, and achieve operational excellence. Collaborate with IT and other departments to implement these solutions effectively. Change Management: Support the organization through change initiatives, ensuring smooth transitions by managing stakeholders’ expectations and communication. Facilitate training sessions and create documentation to assist users in adopting new systems or processes. Project Management: Manage projects from inception to completion. Define project scope, goals, and deliverables that support business goals in collaboration with senior management and stakeholders. Performance Metrics: Develop and track key performance indicators to measure the effectiveness of implemented solutions and continuously improve business practices. Qualifications Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Science, or related field. A Master’s degree or professional certifications (such as CBAP, PMP) are beneficial. Experience: 2-5 years of experience in a business analysis role, with proven success in project management and process improvement. Technical Skills: Proficiency in MS Office, especially Excel, and familiarity with SQL databases and business intelligence tools. Knowledge of ERP systems or CRM platforms like SAP or Salesforce is a plus. Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to handle complex data and generate meaningful insights. Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to interact effectively with all levels of management and staff. Proficiency in preparing clear and concise reports and presentations. Interpersonal Skills: Strong facilitation and negotiation skills, capable of managing stakeholder expectations and mediating compromises. Compensation Salary: The base salary for this position typically ranges from $75,000 to $100,000 per year, depending on experience, location, and company size. Bonus: Performance-based bonuses are available, which can add a significant percentage to the total compensation package. Benefits: Comprehensive benefits package including health insurance, retirement plans with company match, paid time off, flexible working conditions, and opportunities for career advancement and professional development. Work Environment This position may involve a combination of on-site and remote work, with flexibility depending on project needs and company policy. The role may require occasional travel for off-site meetings, training, or conferences. As a Business Analyst within our company, you will play a crucial role in driving improvements and ensuring the successful execution of business strategies. This position offers the opportunity to work in a dynamic and collaborative environment, where you will be empowered to take initiative and drive change.
summary: We are looking for a Senior Business Analyst with 2-5 years of experience to improve our business processes. This role involves gathering requirements, analyzing processes, designing solutions, managing projects, and ensuring smooth change management. We are seeking someone with a strong analytical mindset, excellent communication skills, and proficiency in MS Office, SQL, and business intelligence tools. Experience with ERP systems like SAP or Salesforce is a plus.

title: Business Analyst

Responsibilities The candidate will provide analytical and project support for the firm’s non-investment team activities, including strategic and transaction modeling, business development support, capital market comparisons, portfolio monitoring and analysis, and investor relations support Responsible for maintaining the firm’s forecasting model while incorporating strategic options Research and develop work products for projects across the platform, analyze new business opportunities, market competitors, and provide general support for the business development function as needed Perform capital structure relative value analysis and tracking, track capital markets activity across the firm’s portfolio and support the capital markets function as needed Provide support for the firm’s weekly/monthly & quarterly portfolio monitoring process and ongoing analytics to track portfolio construction and performance Support the IR function Requirements Bachelor’s degree required 4-7 years of experience in the financial services industry Experience with FP&A work and credit analysis Strong analytical and writing skills Salary Range $190,000-$200,000

title: Business Analyst
description: ROLE: Business Analyst Location - Brooklyn , NY - HYBRID 24 + Months Project Business Analyst Professional Experience Required 10+ years of IT industry experience working as a Business Analyst. Gained comprehensive knowledge from working in several software development life cycle processes, such as Agile methodologies and acquired hands on experience in Scrum. Successfully elicited requirements using analysis like As-is and To-be, Must Have and Good to Have, GAP analysis, SWOT analysis, impact analysis and cost/benefit analysis. Participated in all Scrum ceremonies Master, incorporated sprint ceremonies on projects (sprint planning, daily standups, sprint review, sprint retrospective) and backlog grooming session or story times. Skilled at using estimation techniques such as Planning Poker, T-shirt sizing, and relative mass evaluation. Evaluate statistical Data and execute dada mining for large data sets using MS excel, Sas and R. Proficient using prioritization techniques such as Walking Skeleton, Validated Learning, Business-value based, MoSCoW and Kano. Ensured adherence to INVEST (Independent, Negotiable, Valuable, Estimable, Small, and Testable) criteria and SMART (Specific, Measurable, Attainable, Realistic and Timely) model. Experienced using MS Visio for creating Unified Modeling Language (UML) diagrams, workflow diagrams, dataflow diagrams, process flow diagrams. Produced document artifacts such as Business Requirement documents (BRD), Use-case specifications, system requirements specifications (SRS), functional specification documents, (FSD) Requirement tractability documents (RTD), data mapping documents and data dictionary documents. Developed test cases, test plans and test strategy to ensure quality. Conducted and administered several types of testing, for instance, User acceptance testing (UAT), regression testing, integration testing, smoke testing, sanity testing. Demonstrate strong analytical, problem solving, communication skills (both oral and written), leadership skills, time management and interpersonal skills. Proficient in writing SQL Queries to fetch data from multiple tables and also check for data integrity. Interview key functional and technical personnel, complete analysis of existing data, systems and processes, and collect relevant data and workflows to define user system requirements. Experience and proficiency in JIRA/confluence.
summary: Business Analyst with 10+ years of IT experience, proficient in Agile methodologies (Scrum), requirements elicitation techniques, data analysis, estimation, prioritization, documentation (BRD, SRS, FSD, etc.), testing (UAT, regression, integration, smoke, sanity), and SQL queries. Skilled in using tools like MS Excel, SAS, R, MS Visio, Jira, Confluence, and UML diagrams.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description: Tech Valley Talent (TVT) has an opening for a Senior Business Analyst. DURATION: 6 months LOCATION : Onsite with potential for hybrid; New York, NY Must be 1099 or on our W2 - no third parties please. The successful candidate will have excellent communications skillsets and who has working expertise in documenting business processes and systems. The potential candidate will be responsible for the documenting of Grant Management System business requirements and processes. This position will play a vital role in helping revamp an outdated system. The ideal candidate will demonstrate critical thinking skills when solving problems and making recommendations for new solutions. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree; MBA or relevant technical degree preferred. Minimum of 7 years of successful experience as a business analyst and proven history managing and delivering large-scale, complex, multi-year project. A strong background in technology, analysis and critically evaluating information gathered from multiple sources; experience decomposing high-level information into details, distinguishing user requests from the underlying true needs, and developing solution ideas from requirements. Proven experience successfully working in a team setting and ability to reconcile conflict. Experience in related professional business / project analyst capacity. Proven experience writing business requirements documentation (BRDs) and functional requirements documentation (FRDs), including creating workflow/process flow diagrams (Candidate will be expected to produce examples of written materials from previous experience). Experience managing/working on projects through all phases of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). Extensive organizational skills to manage agency expectations and project artifacts. Excellent listening skills and the ability to elicit pertinent information from key staff. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Proven work experience in process re-engineering. Excellent technical skills. Knowledge of process related standards. Analytical thinker with interpersonal skills. Experience in finance/housing (e.g. mortgages, mortgage insurance/underwriting and audits.) Public sector experience is a plus. Grants Management experience is a huge plus Experience with Microsoft Office, Project, Excel and Visio. Experience with SQL Server is a plus. Day to Day Tasks Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders and subject matter experts to elicit, analyze, communicate, and validate functional and strategic needs, as-is processes, and the development of to-be result-oriented solutions. Prepare business cases for project proposals, incorporating the need, solution, feasibility, costs, timeline and results of completing the project. Throughout an approved project, conduct requirements gathering, identify business rules, prepare test plans, monitor and document test results, and report status, issues and risks. Investigate errors in systems and processes and work with technical staff to develop, implement and test resolution plans. Apply Lean concepts in accordance with the NYS Lean Initiative, using methods to help achieve data-driven outcomes within diverse teams. Assess processes, take measurements and interpret data. Design, run, test and upgrade systems and processes. Develop best practices, routines and innovative solutions to reduce waste and improve the quality of output and results. Perform process simulations. Manage multiple competing priorities in process design; weighing and helping process owners assess ways to make progress on multiple fronts while prioritizing the most important outcomes. Subscribe to standard SDLC models. Conceptualize, develop, coordinate, prepare and help implement plans to support key initiatives. Create tracking mechanisms, help identify resources required for successful implementation, establish and implement timetables and control methodologies to ensure robust project management. Support program staff by collecting information, preparing materials, helping coordinate resources, and sharing information freely and proactively. Gather and create business requirements from our project by documenting current state processes and system(s). Use lean methods to re-engineer processes through collaborative and data-driven efforts in order to finish developing new business requirements for future state system(s). Drive the re-platforming of much-improved processes on new technology to better leverage the limited resources. TVT is an Information Technology (IT) professional business leader providing IT services to the public sector. Our firm is founded on the values of high integrity, trust, honesty, and commitment. We take pride in providing exceptional value to our clients by supplying and delivering the best IT project-based and hourly talent across the nation. We are business partners with many technology solution providers such as IBM, AWS, Google, Microsoft, Oracle, Tableau, Salesforce, and others. Tech Valley Talent provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type protected by federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment.

title: Business Analyst
description: A Business Analyst job is available with our client, a large investment firm, located in NYC. This is a Hybrid, W2 only contract role. The Business Analyst role is responsible for specific deliverables within the client's global/regional/line business focused program initiatives. It reports to the Head BA in Technology This role partners with Project Managers across other Client and Regional entities. It requires leadership and coordination of various functional resources in the delivery of new processes, procedures, and technology. Responsible for supporting a broker-dealer firm's efforts to document and strengthen the support model for Middle Office processing for US Govt trading. The role requires a deep understanding of the functions, obligations and reporting requirements for market participants. Will work closely with the broker-dealer's management team and liaise with relevant Regulatory bodies to provide sustainable solutions for Middle Office processing and Regulatory Reporting. It requires a unique blend of financial market expertise, regulatory knowledge, and analytical capabilities to effectively support the broker-dealer's efforts. PLEASE NOTE: Candidates MUST be Aegistech’s W2. DAY-TO-DAY RESPONSIBILITIES: Oversee the creation and approve core project documentation including business requirements, functional requirements, technical specifications, user acceptance testing. Documentation of all required meeting materials. Risk and issue identification, communication and resolution. Work with functional leads and front-to-back stakeholders in the development of workstream strategy and delivery. Objectives planning, defining scope and deliverables. Project plan development including activity planning, sequencing and resource management. Maintain in-depth knowledge of the regulatory requirements such as TRACE, FR2004 reporting. Assess the broker-dealer's current capabilities, systems (Broadridge Impact/Bloomberg) and processes to identify any gaps that need to be addressed to meet the necessary onboarding requirements. Develop a comprehensive onboarding plan and timeline for the broker-dealer to onboard new market participants, including the necessary steps and milestones. Collaborate with relevant regulatory bodies to understand the application process, reporting requirements, and ongoing obligations for the market participants. Facilitate the information gathering and documentation submission required by the regulatory bodies for the broker-dealer's onboarding process. Provide training and support to the broker-dealer's teams on the reporting requirements, communication protocols, and other program-related processes. Continuously monitor the broker-dealer's performance and compliance during the onboarding process, and work with the management team to address any issues or concerns. Identify areas for process improvement in the market participant onboarding and support, and work with stakeholders to implement system and procedural enhancements. Serve as the subject matter expert on market participant onboarding, providing guidance and training to other team members as needed. Deliver large multi-functional projects. THE SKILLS YOU NEED: 5+ years of experience in a similar Business Analyst or Market Operations role, preferably within a broker-dealer or financial institution. Thorough understanding of financial markets, regulatory requirements, and onboarding processes. Demonstrated experience in onboarding and supporting new market participants. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data and identify meaningful insights. Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to translate technical information for non-technical audiences. Proficiency in data analysis tools, such as Excel, SQL, and business intelligence software. Experience in process improvement and project management. Experience in the development of program documentation as noted above. Ability to present well and communicate clearly. Ability to multitask and work in a team environment. Excel, Word, PowerPoint skills a requirement. Experience having worked at a Broker-Dealer. Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, or a related field. periodically identify more advanced methods of query optimization Utilize basic data-manipulation tools and cross-check data to determine accuracy Convert data to information through basic descriptions, aggregations, and pivots Implement/deploy data visualization or communication tools (e.g., metrics dashboards, decks, flashes) Share data with stakeholders to inform business decisions Manage expectations; title: Business Analyst
description: Since our founding in 1996, we have been at the vanguard of financial technology, providing groundbreaking expertise, quantitative analytics and software that redefine pricing and risk management in the financial markets. With the strategic acquisitions of FINCAD and PolyPaths, Numerix has further strengthened its leadership position empowering financial institutions worldwide, to transform risk into opportunities with confidence. As Business Analyst, you will work within the product management team to lead the development of the next generation front-to-risk solution offerings for the financial markets industry. The role will entail working internally across business, research and client onboarding teams as well as externally with clients to determine product features and enhancements that will be commercially successful in providing solutions to capital market participants. What You'll Do Work with delivery teams to deliver trading & risk management Numerix solutions to the financial industry Interact with various departments within our clients as well as the entire Numerix organization as a member of a project team Work with Clients and Financial Engineers to analyze product gaps and enhancement requests, draft business functional specifications and assist Project Managers in prioritizing business requirements Gather and document requirements and liaise with Financial Engineering, Research and Development teams to ensure clear understanding of Client’s requirements Leverage tools for prototyping such as Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Confluence & JIRA to create solution specifications which will be utilized by Developers for Product Development Definition and setup of core static data Comparison of valuation and risk to other systems or client tolerance Implement and configuration of Numerix front-to-risk solutions in client environments. This includes: Configuration of the system including reports and various user interfaces Devise and execute tests including financial and system workflow First line troubleshooting from the client test Basic validation including but not limited to sensitivity and PV Help or drive definition of Testing phase: Security Access Layer definition and setup Integration testing definition and execution User acceptance testing definition and execution Parallel testing definition and execution What We're Looking For 2 to 5 years of experience in the Financial Services industry Undergraduate degree in Engineering, Finance, Mathematics, or relevant business experience Understanding of and experience delivering Software into financial institutions covering the following areas, risk analytics including Historical, Monte Carlo and Scenario VAR, Back testing, P&L, Stress testing, CVA (Collateral Vault Accounts), PFE (Potential Future Exposure), and other Risk and Pricing methodologies Knowledge related to trade static data setup, trade entry and maintenance, analytics, and workflows Knowledge of OTC (over the counter) Credit Derivatives (both Plain-Vanilla and Exotic) including valuation models and methodologies In-depth familiarity with Product Structures, Curve Building, Pricing Models, Risk and Market and Reference Data. Strong understanding of Derivative transaction life-cycle management from both a Front, Middle and Back Office perspective Familiarity with regulatory standards such as Basel II & IMA standards Strong product knowledge of Money Markets, Bonds, and Interest Rate Derivatives Broad working knowledge of Access, Excel (inc. automation skills), Relational DBs, SQL and VBA as well as experience with OTC Derivatives systems: Bloomberg, Calypso, MUREX, Summit, or similar vendor application(s) Ability to self-managed and effectively manage multiple deadlines and deliverables Strong attention to detail and willingness to take ownership of issues Excellent oral and written communication and interpersonal skills Must be willing and able to work closely with others in a fast-paced, complex development environment Must be Interested in working with a high-growth, high-visibility company whose product defines the Front to Risk financial technology worldwide Extra Credit Advanced degree and/or professional certifications Exposure to other Asset Classes (Commodities, Credit, Equities and FX) Knowledge of Incremental VAR, Conditional VAR, and Marginal VAR methodologies Where You’ll Work This hybrid role will be based out of the New York City office, whereby the successful candidate will work 'in office' three days per week.

title: Business Analyst
description: Join the Mizuho team as a Business Analyst! Job Description Derivative Data Integration Team is responsible for integrating trade data from different trading systems in to enterprise database across different asset classes IRD, FXD, CRD, EQD and Commodities. This role will be involved as a business analyst in the following task Source Trade data from various trading platform, transform to the business domain model and load in the enterprise database Load collateral VM and IM from collateral management platform to enterprise database Load market data from various sources in to enterprise database Load static and reference data in to enterprise database create reports for operation and regulatory reporting functions Responsibilities Business requirement writing and refinement Design expected solutions for the development team to implement Collaborate with experienced developers to understand system requirements and functionalities Experience leading the design and development of new components for the next generation of OTC derivatives solutions Co-ordination of quality assurance and testing, including issue tracking and resolution Close stakeholder partnership on business priorities, problem statement definition and project measures of success Business Analysis of Operational processes including flow mapping, root cause analysis & stakeholder interviews Contribute to driving an innovative and continuous improvement culture within integration team Triage support issues for the product team identifying them as either bugs or systems enhancements Skills Required Strong functional knowledge and relevant working experience in Derivatives across different asset classes IRD, FXD, CRD, EQD and Commodities. Technology/Engineering background (either educationally or experience) and detailed knowledge of software development life cycle (SDLC) methodologies Demonstrable knowledge of OTC Derivatives trade lifecycle Strong SQL and excel skills Knowing Murex trading platform is a plus Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken Ability to articulate complex problems and potential resolutions/solutions Design, documentation, and solution execution experience with the ability to address identified business problems and help execute on with product managers for launches of new products. Data analysis skills and ability to review technical specifications and large complex datasets (Structured Query Language (SQL), fpML) The expected base salary ranges from $105k-$160k. Salary offers are based on a wide range of factors including relevant skills, training, experience, education, and, where applicable, certifications and licenses obtained. Market and organizational factors are also considered. In addition to salary and a generous employee benefits package, successful candidates are eligible to receive a discretionary bonus. Other Requirements Mizuho has in place a hybrid working program, with varying opportunities for remote work depending on the nature of the role, needs of your department, as well as local laws and regulatory obligations. Company Overview Mizuho Financial Group, Inc. is the 15th largest bank in the world as measured by total assets of ~$2 trillion. Mizuho's 60,000 employees worldwide offer comprehensive financial services to clients in 35 countries and 800 offices throughout the Americas, EMEA and Asia. Mizuho Americas is a leading provider of corporate and investment banking services to clients in the US, Canada, and Latin America. Through its acquisition of Greenhill , Mizuho provides M&A, restructuring and private capital advisory capabilities across Americas, Europe and Asia. Mizuho Americas employs approximately 3,500 professionals, and its capabilities span corporate and investment banking, capital markets, equity and fixed income sales & trading, derivatives, FX, custody and research. Visit www.mizuhoamericas.com. Mizuho Americas offers a competitive total rewards package. We are an EEO/AA Employer - M/F/Disability/Veteran. We participate in the E-Verify program. We maintain a drug-free workplace and reserves the right to require pre- and post-hire drug testing as permitted by applicable law.

title: Business Analyst
description: About Schroders We’re a global investment manager. We help institutions, intermediaries and individuals around the world invest money to meet their goals, fulfil their ambitions, and prepare for the future. We have around 5,000 people on six continents. And we’ve been around for over 200 years, but keep adapting as society and technology changes. What doesn’t change is our commitment to helping our clients and society prosper. The Base We are based at 7 Bryant Park in the heart of NYC. And we have everything we need to work flexibly. We operate a hybrid working model, with a requirement that our Business Analyst be in the office 3 days per week. This is to sustain our culture of innovation, collaboration, knowledge sharing, and building relationships within the business The Team This is an opportunity to work interdependently with an engaged team that sits within a Global Technology function at a global asset management firm. Position Overview We are looking for a Business Analyst with the experience and desire to help design and optimize Marketing Automation & Analytics solutions, and Marketing Technology Innovation initiatives (AI adoption, emerging technologies analysis, regional proof of concepting) within the our regional and global teams. Our marketing technology stack is underpinned by our core applications consisting of Salesforce, Pardot, TealiumiQ and Cvent. In collaboration with our Digital Marketing experts, we want someone who is passionate about building the tools to allow us to facilitate great client engagement. To excel in this role, it is essential to possess a blend of creative and analytical skills. You should be able to quickly grasp and effectively communicate business requests. This will mean you thoroughly explore them, and actively contribute to the secure implementation of changes in our production environment. You need to demonstrate strong stakeholder management across technical and non-technical teams. Interacting across Marketing, Events, and Sales colleagues you will create, develop and maintain marketing systems that increase and improve client engagement. To be successful you must also demonstrate collaboration with other technology teams to promote solutions which align to our strategic intent. As an experienced analyst, you'll be in an integral role within both the global Marketing Automation & Analytics team, and on the regional digitization team. You will focus on technical integrations, enhancements, marketing innovation and adoption of new technologies. You will be involved in various aspects of the delivery lifecycle including but not limited to; running workshops, scoping enhancements or new project concepts, creating delivery plans, configuring our marketing technology platforms and supporting the team to provide solutions. Responsibilities Apply a wide variety of business analysis tools and techniques to capture business needs, discover requirements, map out domains and generate solutions Demonstrable expertise in Salesforce configuration capabilities, including but not limited to Flows, Dynamic Forms, Permission Sets and Sharing Rules Configuration of CRM Analytics Create alignment and ownership between multiple stakeholder groups Ensure scope is well managed and considers value, feasibility, and implementation constraints Own the discovery phase of multiple new project initiatives that crosscut the needs of multiple teams Ensure the technology team’s backlog is well maintained, appropriately detailed and clearly articulates business value Facilitate sprint events and ensure the team are following Agile ways of working and best practice Proven experience in leading complex projects and implementations Proven experience of Account Engagement (formerly known as Pardot) and its integration with supporting MarTech platforms Building custom integrations and user interfaces using Pardot API A solid understating of global marketing preferences and GDPR Work across disciplinary and geographic boundaries to develop and deploy the best solutions possible for our users. Basic Qualifications Salesforce Admin and Pardot Specialist certification Experience with salesforce deployment release cycle (SF DX, Gearset) Self-motivated and enthusiastic An excellent communicator and problem solver with an aptitude for critical thinking Someone who has high technical literacy, with experience in a hands-on development role Ability to manage requests and expectations from multiple business and technical stakeholders Resourceful with a skill for removing impediments and navigating problems faced by the team Someone who acts to break down information and knowledge silos Skilled at building and sustaining positive relationships with a bias towards achieving buy-in Able to work under pressure, on several priorities at once, and with tight deadlinesCapable of balancing timely delivery against strategic development Adaptable and flexible, such that you will consider the right tool for the situation at hand instead of relying on the same ‘go-to' tools / approaches Able to adopt a servant-leader approach supporting the team Understand the importance of non-functional requirements and how to go about capturing them Ability to adapt and pick up new product domains quickly Solid understanding of Agile principles and practices Able to challenge stakeholders diplomatically but robustly when appropriate Have a continuous improvement mindset and always be looking for new ways to better our platforms and client engagement technologies. Experience with Cloud technologies e.g. Azure Fundamentals or AWS. Preferred Qualifications Agile certification e.g. Scrum.org Salesforce certifications; Sales Cloud, App Builder and Pardot Consultant Experience with CRM Analytics and CDP configuration Experience with Cloud technologies e.g. Azure Fundamentals or AWS. A solid understating of global marketing preferences and GDPR Compensation Schroders offers a base salary in a range of $100,000 to $110,000 for this position. The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training and skill level. ADA Schroder Investment Management North America Inc. complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990. We Recognize Potential, Whoever You Are Our purpose is to provide excellent investment performance to clients through active management. Diversity of thought facilitated by an inclusive culture will allow us to make better decisions and better achieve our purpose. This is why inclusion and diversity are a strategic priority for us and why we are an equal opportunities employer: you are welcome here regardless of your age, disability, gender identity, religious beliefs, sexual orientation, socio-economic background or any other protected characteristics

Spruce maintains partnerships with major technology vendors and continually develops leading-edge offerings in service areas such as digital experience, data services, application development, infrastructure, cyber security, and IT staffing.
