title: Strategic Growth Analyst
description: As a Series B backed growth-stage business, N1 Health is a fast-paced, challenging, and entrepreneurial workspace. With annual growth rates above 50% for the past three years, we are a leader in revolutionizing healthcare engagement for payers, providers, and leading value-based care entities. Join our dynamic team of approximately 50 full-time employees as we revolutionize the healthcare industry through cutting-edge technology. N1 Health provides growth-minded individuals the ability to accelerate their skill development, fast track their career progress, and learn from industry leading executives who have had successful venture-backed exits in the industry. Our business uses leading AI/ML technology infrastructure, data assets and predictive models, to deliver consumer engagement improvements with industry leading healthcare payers and providers. Simply put, we have taken industry leading technology that top performers like Spotify, Netflix and Apple use every day, to help personalize healthcare experiences and drive individual engagement that leads to better care, better health outcomes and business impact. Role Overview This Strategic Growth Analyst role works directly with the N1 Health leadership and leading healthcare businesses to drive outcomes from predictive insights leveraging big data. In this position, you will have the ability to learn about our product, go to market strategy, and client delivery while growing your skills and experience in a fast-paced work environment. Our technology enabled service pairs modern AI technology with an Agile delivery model to provide a consumer-friendly experience for individual engagement in healthcare activities, of which you will be an instrumental part in go to market delivery. Individually, you will be responsible for supporting cross-functional teams of data scientists and engineers to drive strategic growth with our clients, while supporting defined strategic growth initiatives for our business as a whole. You will be responsible for enabling how we partner with clients, lead transformational change and fostering strategic growth activities. Typical day-to-day activities and scope include: Support Account Leads to facilitate executive decision making, account management and client deliverables Support client delivery resources (account leads, data scientists and data engineers) to drive business results, prioritize efforts and execute strategic initiatives with clients; accountable for tracking and managing client deliverables and execution Build strong working relationships with client's operational counterparts Support Account Leads through full lifecycle of client engagements from onboarding to upsell including contract renewals process, pricing and ROI models, negotiations and decision making Lead the preparation, planning and supporting the delivery of internal and partner facing strategic discussions & collaboration Own, implement, and execute key business priorities and special projects that require tight cross-functional coordination Proactively identify areas of opportunity and improvement for account teams to address Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in technical field or proven ability to understand, interpret and communicate technical concepts Proven record of accomplishment and experience working in a team based, fast-paced, performance driven environments where results matter Entrepreneurial attitude - willingness to roll up sleeves and work cross functionally to make things happen quickly with limited oversight from management Analytically oriented with strong problem-solving skills and demonstrated ability to take initiative, critically analyze processes and procedures in a push towards constant improvement and lead decision making based on hard data Organized, detail oriented and extremely thorough while having the confidence and communication skills to ensure work processes are completed accurately and effectively Excellent oral and written communication skills. Ability to articulate and explain complex issues to various individuals in different functioning roles Willingness to quickly learn the nuances of healthcare economics and ability to interpret healthcare data and communicate impact to clients Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills, including financial analysis and data visualization Willingness to travel to clients up to 25% of time $70,000 - $90,000 a year Bonus. Equity. N1 Health is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our vision is to foster an environment in which all N1 Health employees of diverse backgrounds and identities feel supported and empowered through the ongoing development of a shared, inclusive culture. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristics. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please email recruiting@n1health.com, and for any questions around diversity, equity, and inclusion, please reach out to the leaders of our internal Equity Group at equity@n1health.com.
summary: N1 Health, a Series B backed growth-stage business, is seeking a Strategic Growth Analyst to support their team in revolutionizing healthcare engagement through AI/ML technology. This role involves working directly with clients to drive outcomes from predictive insights, managing client deliverables, supporting cross-functional teams, and leading strategic growth initiatives. The ideal candidate will have a technical background, proven experience in fast-paced environments, strong analytical skills, excellent communication, and a willingness to learn about healthcare economics.

company: New York State Technology Enterprise Corporation (NYSTEC)
title: Consultant- Business Analyst
description: About Us NYSTEC is a nonprofit technology consulting company, advising agencies, organizations, institutions, and businesses since 1996. We are independent and vendor-neutral, so we have our clients' best interests at heart. At NYSTEC, we know that we succeed when our employees flourish personally and professionally, so our benefits and perks support that mindset. About The Role As a business analyst in the Modernization and Data Solutions practice, you will collaborate with team members to conceptualize, deliver, and support our clients through today’s ever-changing healthcare landscape. NYSTEC is considered a trusted advisor, providing subject matter expertise and connecting the dots for our clients. NYSTEC has consulted on some of the largest Medicaid initiatives and served in various roles across a multitude of New York State healthcare technology systems. Serving as a business analyst, your day-to-day role as a NYSTEC consultant will include supporting healthcare technology initiatives for our clients, partners, and stakeholders — primarily through applying strong business analysis, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills to our healthcare project(s). Key Responsibilities Developing recommendations and implementation roadmaps to improve clients’ processes, to achieve their goals and objectives. Document user stories/requirements that define the project business objectives. Eliciting and documenting business requirements. Performing analyses and constructing scope statements, business requirements, use cases, business process flows, and implementation needs to support the desired end state. Anticipating and communicating issues/risks. Exhibiting strong writing, documentation, communication, and analytical skills to meet project goals. Developing current-state assessments. About You: Required Qualifications Proficient with Microsoft Office suite. Strong critical thinking, problem solving, and analytical skills. Ability to develop relationships with stakeholders and to understand their needs through excellent listening and effective written and verbal communication. Preferred/Desired Qualifications Experience with health information technology projects. Experience with system development life cycle (SDLC) activities to manage, plan, design, implement, test and deliver information systems and strategies. Education and Experience A bachelor's degree and two years of related experience. An equivalent combination of advanced education, training, and experience will be considered. The pay range for this position is $60,334.00 to $82,959.80 per year. It is NYSTEC's policy to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all individuals, regardless of actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, sex, or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), gender identity or gender expression (including transgender status), age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, protected medical condition as defined by applicable state or local law, genetic information, military service and veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state, or federal laws and ordinances. NYSTEC is strongly committed to this policy and believes in the concept and spirit of the law. Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please contact recruitment@nystec.com if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for or to perform this job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future. Learn more about NYSTEC by visiting www.nystec.com.
summary: NYSTEC, a nonprofit technology consulting firm, seeks a Business Analyst to support healthcare technology initiatives.  The role involves collaborating with team members to conceptualize, deliver, and support clients navigating the evolving healthcare landscape.  Key responsibilities include developing recommendations and roadmaps, documenting user stories/requirements, eliciting and documenting business requirements, performing analyses, anticipating and communicating issues/risks, and exhibiting strong writing, documentation, communication, and analytical skills.  Ideal candidates possess experience with health information technology projects, system development life cycle (SDLC) activities, and strong critical thinking, problem-solving, and analytical skills.

title: Business Analyst for Redburn Atlantic (a Rothschild & Co Group Company), NY
description: About Us Rothschild & Co is a leading global financial services group with seven generations of family control and a history of over 200 years at the centre of the world's financial markets. Our expertise, intellectual capital and global network enable us to provide a distinct perspective that makes a meaningful difference to our clients, communities and planet. We have 4,200 talented specialists on the ground in over 40 countries around the world, enabling us to deliver a unique global perspective across four market-leading business divisions – Global Advisory, Wealth Management, Asset Management and Five Arrows. As a family-controlled business built on relationships, we place a huge emphasis on our people and finding the right colleagues to take our business forward. Rothschild & Co is committed to an inclusive and supportive environment where diversity and different perspectives are valued. We are focused on the attraction and recruitment, development and retention and progression of high calibre talent to ensure we and our clients benefit from the value of difference. About Us Redburn Atlantic is committed to deep and proprietary equity analysis. Our three businesses, Research Services, Execution Services and Equity Capital Markets, all benefit from our founding belief that talented professionals must be given the time and space to deliver the highest quality work and client service to investors, traders and corporates. Ours is a distinct culture. It is challenging, creative and collegial. This is the source of Redburn Atlantic’s top rankings with many asset managers worldwide. Role Overview This role sits within the Redburn CRM team and reports directly to the Head of US Sales. The Business Analyst function helps support the New York office with various reporting data challenges. This includes collaborating with internal teams to build out Tableau reports that will highlight areas of strengths and improvements. We are looking for a Strategic thinker who can build custom reports based on requests and inputs from multiple teams. Additionally, the role will require ad hoc reporting to support our client facing teams as well as providing support with day-to-day questions and tasks to help them succeed. This is a role that requires high levels of detail orientation and the ability to split time between projects and ad hoc requests. Responsibilities Provide support and thought leadership to the New York office around daily functions such as Salesforce, Tier 1, and Data requests Build and manage reports that are requested by various stakeholders Brainstorm and conceptualize new reporting ideas that can help aid the wider team Manage and elevate Tableau reporting by turning complex data into an easy-to-read and access visual form Consistently improve on current processes to help improve the quality of work and data Experience And Skills A bachelor’s degree in computer science or related experience Strong experience in Sales Force (preferably Tier 1 Package) Experience in curating ad hoc data analysis requests and balancing that with various project tasks Experience with ETL Tools At least 2-3 years of experience in the following: Tableau or similar reporting tools Microsoft Suite (Mainly Excel) SQL Language including creating flows, tables, views. and stored procedures (Preferably MS SQL Server Strong planning and organizing skills including the ability to manage several work streams simultaneously Ability to interact professionally with the full spectrum of stakeholders with the appropriate level of gravitas Excellent communication skills with a capacity to present, discuss, and explain complex issues coherently and logically both in writing and verbally Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Expected base salary rates for this role in our New York Office will be between $80,000 and $105,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, salary offers are determined on an individualized basis and are based on a wide range of factors, including relevant skills, training, experience and education. Market and organizational factors are also considered. In addition to salary and our Rothschild & Co employee benefits package, successful candidates may be eligible to receive a discretionary bonus. Rothschild North America is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Disabled/Veterans Notice of applicant rights https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf Notice of applicant rights (Supplement) https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf If you are a qualified individual with a disability or disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access this career website.
summary: Redburn Atlantic, part of Rothschild & Co, seeks a Business Analyst to support their New York office. The role involves building Tableau reports, managing data analysis requests, and collaborating with internal teams to improve data quality and efficiency. Experience with Salesforce, Tier 1, ETL Tools, Tableau, SQL, and Microsoft Suite are required.

title: Compliance Business Analyst
description: Genesis10 is currently seeking a Compliance Business Analyst with our client in the Financial Services industry in their New York location. This is a 6 - 12 month + contract and Hybrid remote position. This is an Onsite Required 3 days in the office per week with potential to convert to a permanent position. Summary: The client now operates from 18 cities across 13 countries. Our investment personnel manage US $247 billion across a wide range of global, regional and country-specific strategies - both traditional and alternative - in listed equity and fixed income. At the client, we pride ourselves in balancing the feel of a small firm with the scale of a large global organization. The client Compliance Technology is looking for a business analyst to join our team. This individual will be responsible for working closely with the internal technology and compliance surveillance teams for gathering and analyzing business requirements, reviewing business processes, developing optimization strategies and solutions etc. This role will also challenge the candidate to crystalize requirements, define best practices, and work with business units and stakeholders to meet project deliverables. Requirements will then be used to drive the selection and implementation of a firmwide regulatory reporting solution. Responsibilities: Performing business requirements analysis, evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions. Reviewing business processes and developing optimization strategies, ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements. Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management. Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports. Ensure deliverables meet product requirements, and work with end users and project stakeholders to define best practices. Work in a dynamic environment, partnering with fast-paced agile teams, to deliver quality software solutions to complex business problems. Requirements: Excellent verbal and written communication skills - ability to gather requirements for projects in financial sector, influence key decision makers, both internally and externally. Problem-solving and continuous improvement attitude. Self-motivated candidate who can work just as easily as an individual and as a team member; flexible attitude and ability to perform under pressure. A passion for new technology and ideas with the drive to move things forward. A passion for working in and developing a culture of collaboration, automation, improvement, sharing and excellence. Familiar with Atlassian tools (JIRA/Confluence). Understanding of compliance activities (Portfolio Surveillance and Regulatory Reporting). Strong time management skills, including the ability to manage multiple cross-functional projects at once. Convey plans, issues, and concerns in a clear, logical and concise manner. The ideal candidate should have at least 10 years' experience working with the implementation of mission-critical financial services solutions within a bank, hedge-fund, or asset manager. Only candidates available and ready to work directly as Genesis10 employees will be considered for this position. Desired: BA/BS or equivalent is required. 10+ years project management/business analyst experience in IT. Relevant experience in financial services or asset management. Functional knowledge of Charles River Investment Management Solution. Knowledge of data management concepts, familiarity with basic SQL and database design principles. Excellent organizational skills and ability to handle multiple projects and timelines while being detail oriented. Accountability and willingness to be pro-active in learning and improving the quality of deliverables and efficiency of processes. Excellent interpersonal skills: we're looking for someone who can work closely with technology teammates and business sponsors, while still being able to challenge traditional thought processes with new and innovative ideas. Track record of being able to communicate complex problems across teams and users in an understandable fashion. Pay rate range: $76.00- $86.00 hourly If you have the described qualifications and are interested in this exciting opportunity, please apply! Ranked a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S. by Staffing Industry Analysts for six consecutive years, Genesis10 puts thousands of consultants and employees to work across the United States every year in contract, contract-for-hire, and permanent placement roles. With more than 300 active clients, Genesis10 provides access to many of the Fortune 100 firms and a variety of mid-market organizations across the full spectrum of industry verticals. For contract roles, Genesis10 offers the benefits listed below. If this is a perm-placement opportunity, our recruiter can talk you through the unique benefits offered for that particular client. Benefits of Working with Genesis10: Access to hundreds of clients, most who have been working with Genesis10 for 5-20+ years. The opportunity to have a career-home in Genesis10; many of our consultants have been working exclusively with Genesis10 for years. Access to an experienced, caring recruiting team (more than 7 years of experience, on average.) Behavioral Health Platform Medical, Dental, Vision Health Savings Account Voluntary Hospital Indemnity (Critical Illness & Accident) Voluntary Term Life Insurance 401K Sick Pay (for applicable states/municipalities) Commuter Benefits (Dallas, NYC, SF) Remote opportunities available For multiple years running, Genesis10 has been recognized as a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S., as a Best Company for Work-Life Balance, as a Best Company for Career Growth, for Diversity, and for Leadership, amongst others. To learn more and to view all our available career opportunities, please visit us at our website. Genesis10 is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Candidates will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. #DIG10-NY
summary: This is a 6-12+ month contract, hybrid remote role for a Compliance Business Analyst at a Financial Services firm in New York. The individual will work with internal technology and compliance surveillance teams to gather and analyze business requirements, review business processes, develop optimization strategies, and implement a firmwide regulatory reporting solution.

title: Research Analyst
description: Job Description Dawnbreaker is seeking inquisitive, highly motivated and experienced market analysts with strengths in competitor and market analysis to work on-site in the Rochester, NY area. Preference is for individuals with a Master of Library Science or degree or Master of Library and Information Science degree. Candidates must have experience with searching databases and preparing actionable reports based on the information gathered. The market researcher works with business strategists in preparing reports to be delivered to small, advanced technology firms. Company: Dawnbreaker Inc. is a professional services firm providing commercialization assistance to advanced technology firms that are funded primarily by Government research and development programs and their investors. Dawnbreaker delivers high-impact strategic planning, market research, and marketing communications assistance to advance national technology innovation initiatives of Federal agencies and small, advanced technology firms. Two distinguishing features characterize our work: (1) an emphasis on measurable results, and (2) a programmatic, yet flexible approach to growing our clients' business. Find us online at www.dawnbreaker.com. Job Summary: In order to continue to meet the demands of our clients, Dawnbreaker anticipates growth in the Market Research Department. The market research/ analyst position assists advanced technology firms that participate in government-funded research and development programs by providing choice information that will help them chart a path to commercialization. Agency clients include the Department of Energy, National Science Foundation, Department of Homeland Security, and other federal agencies. Required Qualifications: A Master of Library Science or Master of Library and Information Science Degree or other, comparable advanced degree 5+ years experience Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite Excellent written and verbal communication skills Effective interpersonal skills Effective organization and prioritization skills Demonstrate high attention to detail The ability to work independently and complete tasks on a timely basis Enjoys learning new things and working with high technology entrepreneurs This is an Exempt level full time position that will be approximately 40 hours per week. Dawnbreaker offers a generous benefits package, which includes medical, dental, vision, short-term disability, long-term disability, Aflac, and Life insurances in addition to 401K contributions and wellness benefits. Dawnbreaker delivers high-impact strategic planning, market research, and marketing communications assistance to advance national technology innovation initiatives of Federal agencies and small, advanced technology firms. Two distinguishing features characterize our work: (1) an emphasis on measurable results, and (2) a programmatic, yet flexible approach to growing our clients' business. Responsibilities include searching databases, preparing actionable reports, and working with business strategists to deliver insights to small, government-funded technology companies.

title: Business Analyst
description: Job Title: Business Analyst – Senior Task ID: HBITS-04-12610 Position Duration: 24 months Client: State of NY Agency: Department of Public Service Please call 888-909-6039 or email at nysreqs@ilinksolutions.com Description Description: Use recognized business analysis methodologies to elicit requirements from business users for the project. Facilitate and guide requirements sessions with IT and DPS business staff. Communicate efficiently the business process requirements to IT staff, program staff and stakeholder. Develop and document Business Requirements for the project using defined ITS template and standards. Develop, analyze and revise system diagrams (flowcharts, state diagrams, strategy maps, etc.) as needed on the project Ensure that requirements and deliverables are verified and validated at each phase of analysis and testing Track and fully document changes for functional and business specifications; write detailed procedures for permanent records and for use in training Participate in developing test plans for the project and in overseeing system changes or enhancements, to ensure user and program requirements are met. Mandatory Qualification 1 76 Months experience working on Business Requirements Project, as lead Analyst, which involved the application of strategies to gather and document business process requirements of new application 2 76 months experience working as the Lead Business Analyst on projects on which they utilized recognized business process management methodologies (e.g., elicitation and documenting of business process requirements, business process modelling, As-Is and To-Be workflow development and gap analysis, UML etc.) to define and analyze current business processes in order to remodel/design the new process and improve on the existing ones. 3 48 months experience with planning, coordinating, developing test cases and test plans to ensure user and program requirements are met. 4 Possession of a valid (active) IIBA CBAP certification or a PMI PBA certification 5 76 months experience with internal and external stakeholder communications and outreach, including the development of presentations and other materials that promote the rethinking of core business processes and envisioning of a reengineered environment. Disclaimer: i-Link Solutions Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. We especially invite women, minorities, veterans, and individuals with disabilities to apply. EEO/AA/M/F/Vet/Disability.
summary: This is a senior Business Analyst role focused on gathering and documenting business requirements for a project at the Department of Public Service in New York State. This involves working with IT and DPS business staff to define and analyze current business processes, develop and document requirements, create system diagrams, and participate in testing and implementation. The role requires extensive experience with business analysis methodologies, process management, stakeholder communication, and test case development.

title: Senior Analyst - Corporate Strategy
description: Bring Your Amazing Self to Work At Macy's, Inc. we're on a mission to create a brighter future with bold representation for all. This is our Mission Every One. We know that each person here is unique. So we respect and invest in each individual to create growth, pride, and satisfaction. If we are able to bring our whole selves to work, it translates into a more abundant and wider array of ideas and energy for all to benefit from. Our success will be built on amazing colleagues, working together. Job Overview The Senior Analyst tackles the most impactful challenges facing Macy's and the retail industry today, by pressure testing the status quo, challenging assumptions, and ultimately driving toward better outcomes through internal alignment. They are responsible for creating executive-level presentations, analyzing data, and strategizing and delivering solutions to internal Macy’s clients to promote growth and address the evolving needs of the business. Senior Analysts have the flexibility to explore various areas within Macy’s, Inc., serving as generalists on a variety of internal projects of strategic importance across the enterprise. They work on project teams of various sizes, leveraging guidance and support from senior managers and direct supervisors, and may also work independently depending on the scope, audience, and deliverable. What You Will Do Apply analytical rigor and creative problem-solving skills to address strategic business challenges. Evaluate new and innovative concepts and approaches. Acquire necessary subject matter expertise to become an informed partner. Synthesize key insights and develop actionable recommendations. Cultivate trusting relationships with key stakeholders across various functions. Collaborate with internal stakeholders to develop long-term strategies, establish strategic project management frameworks, and tackle complex challenges across different functions. Work collaboratively with other teams within the organization and with the broader Continuous Improvement team. Develop and deliver executive-level presentations. Demonstrate regular, dependable attendance and punctuality. Skills You Will Need Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to apply analytical rigor and creative problem-solving techniques to address strategic business challenges effectively. Innovative Thinking: Capacity to evaluate new and innovative concepts and approaches to drive improvements and better outcomes. Synthesis and Recommendation: Skill in synthesizing key insights from data and formulating actionable recommendations to drive business growth and address evolving needs. Stakeholder Relationship Management: Ability to cultivate trusting relationships with key stakeholders across various functions and levels within the organization. Collaboration: Proficiency in collaborating with internal stakeholders to develop long-term strategies, establish project management frameworks, and address complex challenges collaboratively. Executive-Level Communication: Strong presentation skills, including the ability to develop and deliver executive-level presentations tailored to different audiences. Communication Skills: Proficiency in PowerPoint and Excel, including basic modeling, with Tableau skills considered a plus. Strong oral, written, and listening communication skills tailored to various audiences and project stakeholders. Reasoning Ability: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, goal-oriented, and time-sensitive environment. A self-starter with a curious mindset who stays informed about market changes and new trends. Experience developing holistic strategies through structured, project-based approaches. Capacity to work independently with limited day-to-day guidance. Mathematical Skills: Strong proficiency in quantitative and analytical approaches, with experience working with financial models and analyzing large data sets considered advantageous. Other Skills: High-energy and passionate with a proven track record of delivering results. Executes with a "Teams Win" philosophy, fostering a positive and collaborative environment. Who You Are Dedicated to fulfilling ideals of diversity, inclusion, and respect that Macy’s aspires to achieve every day in every way. Candidates with a bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in a related field are encouraged to apply. Strong record of academics, extracurricular activity, professional accomplishment and leadership, as well as professional work experience 1-2 years’ work experience, preferably in management consulting or investment banking. Knowledge and interest in retail, technology, and innovation. Regularly required to sit, talk, hear; use hands/fingers to touch, handle, and feel. Occasionally required to move about the workplace and reach with hands and arms. Requires close vision. Able to work a flexible schedule based on department and company needs. What We Can Offer You An inclusive, challenging, and refreshingly fun work environment Competitive pay and benefits rooted in principles of equity Performance incentives and annual merit review Merchandise discounts Health and Wellness Benefits across medical, dental, vision, and additional insurance Retirement Savings Plan with 401k match opportunity Employee Assistance Program (mental health counseling and legal/financial advice) Resources for continuous learning, career growth, and leadership development 8 paid holidays Paid Time Off (first year prorated depending on start date) Tuition reimbursement program Guild education benefit funds 100% of tuition, books, and fees in designated programs Colleague Resource Groups (CRGs) and give-back/volunteer opportunities Empowerment and autonomy to perform impactful work with tangible results About Macy’s Now is an exciting time for a Macy's career as we continue to focus on creating exciting and memorable experiences for every Macy's customer, whether their journey starts online or in the store. Our opportunities in Sales, Merchandise, Operations, Customer Service, Warehouse, Marketing, and other areas let you express your creativity and commitment to excellence, grow your career and make a difference to your Macy's colleagues and customers. Bring your creativity, energy, and ideas to the Macy's team – Apply Today! This job description is not all-inclusive. Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy's, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. CORP00 This position may be eligible for performance-based incentives/bonuses. Benefits include 401k, medical/vision/dental/life/disability insurance options, PTO accruals, Holidays, and more. Eligibility requirements may apply based on location, job level, classification, and length of employment. Additional benefit details are available at macysJOBS.com.
summary: Macy's is seeking a Senior Analyst to tackle strategic business challenges within the retail industry. The role involves analyzing data, creating executive-level presentations, and strategizing solutions to promote growth and address evolving business needs. The candidate will work on projects across various Macy's departments and collaborate with internal stakeholders to develop long-term strategies and project management frameworks.

title: Business Analyst (CRM)_CSA
description: Description: CRM business analyst: Business analysts are the drivers of our continued growth and success. We are currently searching for an experienced business analyst to help guide our organization to the future. With their commitment to innovation, these analysts seek, develop, and help implement strategic initiatives for improved efficiency and productivity. From researching progressive systems solutions to evaluating their impacts, the ideal candidate will be a detailed planner, expert communicator, and top-notch analyst. Objectives of this role: Drive awareness of requirements in CRM/Service operations across business units and identify substandard systems processes through evaluation of real-time data and design better system processes to overcome deficiencies. • Serve as thoughtful leader for technical business processes, developing systems prototypes that promote increased efficiency and productivity on multiple levels. • Create and implement precise management plans for every project, with attention to transparent communication at all levels. • Perform, evaluate, and communicate thorough quality assurance at every stage of systems development. • Gather user requirements and design and coordinate system development and implement in production to ensure maximum usability. Responsibilities • Partner with stakeholders across business units (ex: Business Operations, Customer Service, Sales & Finance) to develop analysis and documentation in a collaborative way, communicating effectively and efficiently with production, managerial, and executive teams. • Evaluate, analyze, and communicate systems requirements on a continuing basis, and maintain systems processes, including the delivery of monthly status reports to all appropriate parties. • Author and update internal and external documentation, and formally initiate and deliver requirements and documentation. • Conduct daily systems analytics to maximize effectiveness and troubleshoot problems. • Develop meaningful and lasting relationships with partners for optimized systems integration and respond to questions and concerns from managers and executives with supporting research and recommendations. Required skills and qualifications: • Bachelor's degree (or equivalent) in information technology or computer science • 3 or more years of experience in analytics and systems development • Ability to think independently and regard business challenges as    "opportunities” rather than    "obstacles”. • Ability to use analytical skills to divide and simplify complex business problems into simple and manageable ones. • Ability to document and present problems and solutions. • Team player with solid communication skills • High proficiency in Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. Above average skills in SQL & PL/SQL Preferred skills and qualifications • Strong working knowledge of relevant Microsoft applications, including Visio. • Proven ability to manage projects and user testing. • Extensive experience with data visualization • Experience with ERP and/or CRM systems preferred. • Experience with formal system development methodologies preferred. • Experience in Oracle ERP (Service Contracts, Field Service, Install Base) highly desirable.
summary: We are seeking an experienced business analyst to drive growth and success. This role focuses on improving efficiency and productivity within our CRM/Service operations. You will identify and analyze system deficiencies, design solutions, and lead technical business processes. You will also be responsible for project management, quality assurance, gathering user requirements, and coordinating system development and implementation.

title: SVP, Business Sr. Lead Analyst (Hybrid)
description: The Business Sr. Lead Analyst is a strategic professional who closely follows latest trends in own field and adapts them for application within own job and the business. Typically a small number of people within the business that provide the same level of expertise. Excellent communication skills required in order to negotiate internally, often at a senior level. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers. Accountable for significant direct business results or authoritative advice regarding the operations of the business. Necessitates a degree of responsibility over technical strategy. Primarily affects a sub-function including resource management and allocation of work within the team/project. Responsibilities: The position requires a candidate with general management skills, leadership abilities and administrative experience, who can manage and lead a variety of activities geared at helping manage a global organization with resources and providing data & analytics solutions to all regions and lines of businesses. This includes building ties with other business teams. The individual will closely with senior Management in Risk Data & technology leadership in their planning, definition and execution of deliverables covering Wholesale Credit Risk. Partner directly with various players across decision management groups, analyze data and evaluate multiple sources to develop recommendations on high-priority strategic initiatives, including the annual strategic plan Formulate and shepherd cross-franchise initiatives and programs from conception to completion Help to manage executable strategies, partnering across the organization. Partnering with 1LOD ,2LOD ,& technology across deliverables. Prioritizing and managing the BOW for impacted tech platform. Ensure consistent controls and standards are enforced across Strategic and BAU book of work. Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Program/Project Management - Help provide oversight of the Business Critical Milestone Reporting process and various other executive / client / management reporting processes. Ensure quality, efficiency and accuracy throughout the reporting process Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Qualifications: 10+ years experience in global and complex settings with multiple stake holders Prior work experience in area related to data, analytics and/or strategy consulting Ability to work in a team of diverse skill and manage cross -project teams. Prior Project/Program management exposure Prior experience managing technology deliveries Education: Bachelor’s/University degree, Master’s degree preferred This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required. ------------------------------------------------------ Job Family Group: Business Strategy, Management & Administration ------------------------------------------------------ Job Family: Business Management ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Primary Location: Getzville New York United States ------------------------------------------------------ Primary Location Full Time Salary Range: $125,200.00 - $187,800.00 In addition to salary, Citi’s offerings may also include, for eligible employees, discretionary and formulaic incentive and retention awards. title: Senior Operations and Strategy Analyst
description: Description We are looking for an Operations & Strategy Analyst to join the RevOps team, a leading team in the company, which supports hundreds of millions of dollars, leads strategic processes and serves as a compass for the revenue group (CRO). The role requires great storytelling skills, an eye for detail, great communication, and a keenness for problem-solving. You will be responsible for all aspects of the Sales and CS data, from building dashboards & writing SQL queries to analyze the strategic elements of the business and ensuring actionable recommendations to key stakeholders. Please note that this is a hybrid position of 3 days/week in our NYC office About The Role Identifying areas for improvement based on data analysis inspired by our vision & strategy for the business. Building dashboards & reports in our BI tools to track/monitor the business and the operational processes. Define business KPIs, proxies, and targets. Work closely with cross-department stakeholders to identify trends and business opportunities, while considering company-level perspectives. Provide support for ongoing business needs. Working closely with the BI to create one source of truth for the client facing data. Requirements At least 5+ years of experience as a Business / Rev / Sales / Management Analyst in a SaaS or high-growth tech company. Strong analytical skills combined with the ability to present the data clearly and efficiently to support business decisions. High proficiency level of SQL - MUST. Experience querying scaled DWH (Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery, Oracle, MemSQL) - MUST. Experience building ETL processes - An advantage Experience in working with Looker / Tableau - An advantage. Curious, proactive, ambitious, loves solving complex problems and excited to help others and share the success, team player. Ability to tell the story and present the results in a clear and interesting way. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Self-motivated with a strong learning capabilities. Strong interpersonal skills including the ability to communicate with senior management, deliver & explain your insights and recommendations in a non-technical language. What Monday.com Can Offer You Opportunity to join a well-funded, proven company with big ambitions, competitive salary and benefit package, bonus potential, and eligibility to take part in the company equity incentive program Amazing company culture that values transparency and collaboration while never forgetting to have fun while we work! Monthly stipends for food, wellness, and commuter work Fully dedicated learning and development team that provides opportunities for our employees to hone and gain new skills Award winning work environment - named a "Best Place to Work" by BuiltIn as well as "Great Place To Work" certified We foster diversity, inclusion, and belonging through our Employee Resource Groups in addition to providing access to resources and education to support our team, facilitate conversations, and encourage understanding A global work environment with employees in Tel Aviv, New York, San Francisco, Miami, Chicago, Denver, London, Kiev, Sydney, São Paulo, and Tokyo For New York City-based hires only: Compensation Range: $105,000-$165,000 base salary, subject to standard withholding and applicable taxes. Compensation finally awarded to the candidate will be commensurate with the candidate’s skills and experience. Compensation ranges for candidates in locations outside of New York City may differ based on the cost of labor and such additional factors for such other locations. Understanding, analyzing and articulating common business processes and decisions to develop easy to use customer solutions Bachelor's degree required, strong preference for candidates with degrees in Finance, Accounting, Computer Science or related fields Qualifications Desired Experience and Qualifications: Exposure and knowledge with Financial ERPs, (i.e. PeopleSoft Financials GL module)

title: Technical Business Analyst/Project Manager - Legal & Compliance Systems
description: Our long-time direct global alternative asset management client is seeking to bring on an experienced Consultant for a long-term assignment (1 year PLUS) to focus on Legal and Compliance systems & report delivery, enhancements and management. This role is a combination of Business Analysis and Project Management and requires 2-3 days a week in client's mid-town NYC office. In this role, the Consultant will support Legal and Compliance initiatives for our client's asset management businesses registered with various European bodies. Key to this position is the ability to understand the Legal and Compliance regulatory & legal requirements, define technology strategies and manage projects, timelines and risks. Responsibilities: Identify and define European Legal and Compliance department’s technology initiatives; build out technology roadmap Collect, review, and document business requirements, process flows; coordinate design reviews, and serve as a liaison between technology and business units Perform complex analysis of projects and clearly articulate and present solutions, rationale, issues, and tradeoffs Collaborate with data source system owners and Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to identify appropriate data resources for Legal and Compliance technology initiatives Partner with finance, accounting, technology, and other business functions to drive the implementation of Legal and Compliance solutions Evaluate technology vendor solutions to meet regulatory and legal obligations Manage multiple external vendors that support the European Legal and Compliance technologies Required Qualifications: B.S. / B.A. with 7+ years technology experience, 5+ years experience specifically with Legal and Compliance technology Experience with AIFMD, MiFID II, EMIR, and/or other regulatory directives and the technologies used to meet those directive’s obligations (this is a firm requirement!) Experience with Legal technology evaluation, delivery, and management 3+ years’ experience in Asset Management industry. Familiarity with Fixed Income, Structured Products and Alternative Investments. Strong business analysis skill set to facilitate requirements sessions and to communicate clearly and effectively with end-users, application developers, senior business managers, and other team members Candidates to this role must be local to NYC. No phone calls please. If you meet the required qualifications and are interested in this role, please apply today. Acting as a strategic partner to our clients and candidates, we focus on providing customized solutions and building long-term relationships based on trust, respect, and the consistent delivery of excellent results. For more information and additional opportunities, visit: solomonpage.com and connect with us on Facebook , and LinkedIn . Opportunity Awaits.

title: Business Analyst
description: Role: Business Analyst Location: Albany, NY (Hybrid) We are seeking a Business Analyst with the following expertise: Proficiency in drafting business process definitions, business rules, and decomposing business processes. Additionally, experience in extracting business rules from existing computer applications and systems is required. Knowledge of Change Management principles and experience in planning and executing change initiatives. This includes analyzing business processes for efficiency and ensuring compliance with New York State and/or Federal regulations. Direct engagement with users in the human services sector, providing training and technical assistance either in a classroom setting or within a work environment. Background in working within Health and Human Services-based systems. Competence in analyzing applications utilizing relational databases like Oracle and utilizing application tools such as COGNOS. title: Business Analyst II - Claims
description: Description Location: This position will work a hybrid model (remote and office). The ideal candidate will live within 50 miles of an Elevance Health PulsePoint location. Hybrid Workplace Strategy: 1-2 days in office per week The Business Analyst II is responsible for translating basic business needs into application software requirements. How you will make an impact: Analyzes business needs to determine optimal means of meeting those needs. Determines specific business application software requirements to address specific business needs. Works with programming staff to ensure requirements will be incorporated into system design and testing. Acts as liaison with users of the software to address questions/issues. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company's sole discretion, consistent with the law. title: Business Analyst, Direct Lending
description: Position Overview Apollo is a high-growth, global alternative asset manager. In our asset management business, we seek to provide our clients excess return at every point along the risk-reward spectrum from investment grade to private equity with a focus on three investing strategies: yield, hybrid, and equity. For more than three decades, our investing expertise across our fully integrated platform has served the financial return needs of our clients and provided businesses with innovative capital solutions for growth. Through Athene, our retirement services business, we specialize in helping clients achieve financial security by providing a suite of retirement savings products and acting as a solutions provider to institutions. Our patient, creative, and knowledgeable approach to investing aligns our clients, businesses we invest in, our employees, and the communities we impact, to expand opportunity and achieve positive outcomes. Come to Apollo and join a community of extraordinary people who are committed to a culture of excellence and collaboration in everything that we do. We invest in our people for the long term and are committed to supporting their development at every stage of their career. The role is to function as the business development analyst for the Apollo Public Funds (APF), which involves understanding/monitoring APF’s financial position while providing forecasting and modeling of current & future activities. The candidate should have a strong financial background and be able to synthesize/compare APF with its competitors. Primary Responsibilities The candidate will provide analytical and project support for APF’s non-investment team activities, including strategic and transaction modeling, business development support, capital market comparisons, portfolio monitoring and analysis, investor relation’s support. The Candidate Will Be Expected To Provide General Business Support To APF’s Functional Areas, Primarily Outside Of The Investment Team Strategic Modeling: candidate will be responsible for maintaining APF’s forecasting model while incorporating strategic options. Business Development: research and develop work product for discrete projects across the platform, analyze new business opportunities, market competitors and provide general support for the business development function as needed. Capital Markets: perform capital structure relative value analysis and tracking, track capital markets activity across APF’s portfolio and support the capital markets function as needed. Portfolio Monitoring: provide support for APF’s weekly/monthly & quarterly portfolio monitoring process and ongoing analytics to track portfolio construction and performance. Support the IR function. Qualifications & Experience Ideal candidates will have a bachelor’s degree from a top undergraduate institution Prior experience in an equity research or credit research role strongly preferred The individual should have experience in the financial markets, investing and a strong background in finance and/or accounting as well as a basic understanding of the capital markets and a familiarity with leveraged finance. Strong analytical and technical aptitude The candidate must demonstrate strong analytical and writing skills The candidate should have approximately 2-4 years of experience in the financial services industry Team player with strong work ethic OUR PURPOSE AND CORE VALUES Our Clients Rely On Our Investment Acumen To Help Secure Their Future. We Must Never Lose Our Focus And Determination To Be The Best Investors And Most Trusted Partners On Their Behalf. We Strive To Be The leading provider of retirement income solutions to institutions, companies, and individuals. The leading provider of capital solutions to companies. Our breadth and scale enable us to deliver capital for even the largest projects – and our small firm mindset ensures we will be a thoughtful and dedicated partner to these organizations. We are committed to helping them build stronger businesses. A leading contributor to addressing some of the biggest issues facing the world today – such as energy transition, accelerating the adoption of new technologies, and social impact – where innovative approaches to investing can make a positive difference. We are building a unique firm of extraordinary colleagues who: Outperform expectations Challenge Convention Champion Opportunity Lead responsibly Drive collaboration As One Apollo team, we believe that doing great work and having fun go hand in hand, and we are proud of what we can achieve together. Our Benefits Apollo relies on its people to keep it a leader in alternative investment management, and the firm’s benefit programs are crafted to offer meaningful coverage for both you and your family. Please reach out to your Human Capital Business Partner for more detailed information on specific benefits. Apollo Global Management Inc. is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. The firm and its affiliates do not discriminate in employment because of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, veteran status, disability, age, citizenship, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression or because of any other criteria prohibited under controlling federal, state or local law. Pay Range 85,000 – 110,000 T he base salary range for this position is listed above. This position is also eligible for a discretionary annual bonus based on personal, team, and Firm performance. Compensation ranges are based on several factors including job function, level, and geographic location. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors including candidate experience and expertise, and may vary from the amounts listed here.
summary: Apollo Public Funds (APF) is seeking a Business Development Analyst with a strong financial background to support the non-investment team in strategic modeling, business development, capital market comparisons, and portfolio monitoring. Responsibilities include maintaining APF's forecasting model, researching new business opportunities, and providing analytical support for portfolio construction and performance. The ideal candidate will have a bachelor's degree from a top institution, prior experience in equity or credit research, and approximately 2-4 years of experience in the financial services industry. Strong analytical, writing, and communication skills are required.

title: Business Development Analyst
description: Responsibilities Work with senior members of the team to drive full cycle recruitment process Provide any helpful/relevant market intelligence derived through conversations with analyst talent to the PM Recruiting Team Develop and maintain a strong candidate pipeline across open hiring requisitions Buildout new competitor mapping and LinkedIn projects, and update/augment existing team infrastructure as directed by senior team members Create and update job descriptions, evaluate talent (alongside Due Diligence specialists), interview and zoom screen candidates, and compile interview feedback on an ad hoc basis as required Drive process improvements, and help integrate new strategies and practices related to recruitment and hiring of analysts Aid EAS, Analyst Due Diligence, and the firm’s Investment Teams in better understanding market dynamics (compensation benchmarking, industry hiring trends, covenant agreement enforcement precedence, etc) Qualifications Ideal candidate will have 2-5 yrs experience in a relevant role with an already built out large network of contacts in the industry Proven track record of being a tenacious cold caller LinkedIn expertise a pre-requisite Must have a four year degree from an accredited university Highly organized Experience working with a CRM and Salesforce preferred but not required The estimated base salary range for this position is $150,000 to $175,000, which is specific to New York and may change in the future. Millennium pays a total compensation package which includes a base salary, discretionary performance bonus, and a comprehensive benefits package. When finalizing an offer, we take into consideration an individual’s experience level and the qualifications they bring to the role to formulate a competitive total compensation package.
summary: This role involves full-cycle recruitment for analyst positions, including sourcing candidates, screening, interviewing, and providing market intelligence. It requires strong networking skills, experience with LinkedIn and CRM tools, and a proven track record of success in cold calling. The ideal candidate will have 2-5 years of experience in a relevant role.

title: SENIOR BUSINESS ANALYST
description: APPLICANTS MUST BE PERMANENT IN THE COMPUTER SPECIALIST SOFTWARE CIVIL SERVICE TITLE, Normal Business Hours The Department of Social Services (DSS) is comprised of the administrative units of the New York City Human Resources Administration (HRA) and the Department of Homeless Services (DHS). HRA is dedicated to fighting poverty and income inequality by providing New Yorkers in need with essential benefits such as Food Assistance and Emergency Rental Assistance. DHS is committed to preventing and addressing homelessness in New York City by employing a variety of innovative strategies to help families and individuals successfully exit shelter and return to self-sufficiency as quickly as possible. Information Technology Services (ITS) is DSS’s technology services organization. Its mission is to support the daily, emergent, and long-term needs of both agencies. ITS creates and enhances the technology infrastructure and computer applications that support HRA and DHS and develops applications, including a variety of client eligibility and recertification systems, case management systems, housing systems, employment/work engagement services, revenue producing computer matches, claiming systems, and personnel systems. Information Technology Services is recruiting for a Computer Specialist (SW) III, to function as Senior Business Analyst, who will: Manage & Coordinate Design & Analytics tasks involved with gathering business & functional requirements. Lead task responsible for requirement gathering, analyzing procedures, rules and State and Local regulations to ensure proposed system business rules adhere to such regulations by serving as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on Business solution Applications portfolio from start to end to ensure a smooth and effective bug free delivery to its end users. Prepare technical design documents with applicable Industry standards. Lead teams responsible for requirement gathering, analyzing procedures, rules and State and Local regulations to ensure proposed system business rules adhere to such regulations by serving as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on Business solution Applications portfolio from start to end to ensure a smooth, speedy, and effective bug free delivery to its end users. Prepare technical/administrative recommendations for executive management to inform and influence decision making and practices in the formulation of decisions having impact on other areas of ITS regarding the upstream and downstream impacts of Benefit Issuance Systems modifications and enhancements, to ensure the integrity and efficiency of all DSS solutions and to help ensure the efficient use of Agency assets and resources. Minimum Qualifications A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college, including or supplemented by twenty-four (24) semester credits in computer science or a related computer field and two (2) years of satisfactory full-time software experience in designing, programming, debugging, maintaining, implementing, and enhancing computer software applications, systems programming, systems analysis and design, data communication software, or database design and programming, including one year in a project leader capacity or as a major contributor on a complex project; or A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent and six (6) years of full-time satisfactory software experience as described in “1" above, including one year in a project leader capacity or as a major contributor on a complex project; or A satisfactory combination of education and experience that is equivalent to (1) or (2) above. College education may be substituted for up to two years of the required experience in (2) above on the basis that sixty (60) semester credits from an accredited college is equated to one year of experience. A masters degree in computer science or a related computer field may be substituted for one year of the required experience in (1) or (2) above. However, all candidates must have a four year high school diploma or its educational equivalent, plus at least one (1) year of satisfactory full-time software experience in a project leader capacity or as a major contributor on a complex project. NOTE: In order to have your experience accepted as Project Leader or Major Contributor experience, you must explain in detail how your experience qualifies you as a project leader or as a major contributor. Experience in computer operations, technical support, quality assurance (QA), hardware installation, help desk, or as an end user will not be accepted for meeting the minimum qualification requirements. Special Note To be eligible for placement in Assignment Level IV, in addition to the Qualification Requirements stated above, individuals must have one year of satisfactory experience in a project leader capacity or as a major contributor on a complex project in data administration, database management systems, operating systems, data communications systems, capacity planning, and/or on-line applications programming. Preferred Skills Have thorough understanding of DSS systems to assure a maximum degree of data integrity and cross-platform development. - Have excellent communication skills and demonstrate leadership in managing a large team of professionals. - Experience in Business & Functional analytics related to large and complex Client Server & Web applications. - Practical experience in Oracle Database Development using advanced PL/SQL techniques and how to leverage them to deliver mission critical systems in an agile setting. - Ability to manage a variety Analysis tasks specific to application design, development, testing and roll-out. - Drive improvement initiatives by monitoring issues reported by production users to troubleshoot functional issues, analyzed patterns in order to diagnose cause and develop solutions, and/or improvements by refining local/window validations techniques and adding business rules to our robust Business Rule Engine to reduce user errors by writing SQL and utilizing PETTS, AZURE Board, Visio, Microsoft Solutions & Business rules Engine tools. - Interface with users and develop functional requirement specifications, programming specifications and other required system documentation and being able to prototype a system and demonstrate it to the users during the process of development. 55a Program This position is also open to qualified persons with a disability who are eligible for the 55-a Program. Please indicate at the top of your resume and cover letter that you would like to be considered for the position through the 55-a Program. Public Service Loan Forgiveness As a prospective employee of the City of New York, you may be eligible for federal loan forgiveness programs and state repayment assistance programs. For more information, please visit the U.S. Department of Education’s website at https://studentaid.gov/pslf/. Residency Requirement New York City Residency is not required for this position Additional Information The City of New York is an inclusive equal opportunity employer committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse workforce and providing a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment based upon any legally protected status or protected characteristic, including but not limited to an individual's sex, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity, or pregnancy.
summary: The Department of Social Services (DSS) is seeking a Computer Specialist (SW) III to work as a Senior Business Analyst. The role involves managing and coordinating design and analytics tasks, gathering business and functional requirements, leading teams in requirement gathering, analyzing procedures, rules, and regulations, preparing technical design documents, and providing technical/administrative recommendations. The ideal candidate will have experience in business and functional analytics, Oracle Database Development, and troubleshooting functional issues.
