title: Functional Business Analyst
description: Job Description This position designs and maintains the program’s primary advising and degree audit and certification database and all database tools and processes that capture and evaluate student-related data. Additionally, this person designs and writes customized queries against MySlice data warehouse data in support of data and communications initiatives, including academic advising. This person develops the Honors Program’s digital, web, and communications architecture and strategy: designs and implements external and internal websites, social media, file sharing portals, and online repositories in support of Honors program operation and student support. This position participates in external communication design initiatives for Honors programs; produces digital and print graphics and other materials. In collaboration with executive team, manages the programs’ visual communications and design presence. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree required. Advanced skills in Excel and Tableau required. Familiarity with PeopleSoft and Hyperion is desired. Job Specific Qualifications Technical Database: Advanced developer-level MS Access, SQL / Oracle DB, Hyperion query interface, Advanced MS Excel Web: WordPress development, theming, PHP, HTML/CSS, Dreamweaver, Social media API interfaces, IFTTT, other emerging technologies Graphics: Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator Professional This position requires advanced, widely varied technical competencies, a deep understanding of business processes, and a high degree of vision and creative problem solving. The incumbent must also possess advanced professional skills to effectively envision, articulate, design and implement such systems in collaboration with staff. The person qualified for this position is a combination of a back-end database developer, a front-end web and graphic designer, and a data analyst. This person also possesses the process improvement and communication skills necessary to effectively collaborate with executives, as well as operational employees. Responsibilities Systems Architecture & Process Management Designs and maintains the Honors program’s advising and degree audit and certification database, all database tools and components that capture student-related data. Audits final degree information of other colleges/registrar to ensure accuracy. Designs and writes queries in support of academic advising, qualification and student support services; shares Honors relevant data with other schools, colleges, programs, and departments regularly and upon request. Develops and maintains all Honors websites that capture data to facilitate processes: migrates the data into database where it is available to academic advisors for student support services. Supervises year end thesis project processing: development and maintenance of thesis project web portals on SharePoint, scheduling presentations for Capstone presentation day, design and maintenance of Capstone repository, and uploading completed Capstone projects to SU¿s Surface web database. Supports the Associate Director in the administration, tracking, and organization of applications to Honors and all other admissions processes. Communications And Graphic Design Designs, implements and grows communications strategy. This includes social media initiatives, digital communications projects and management of media archives; In collaboration with executive team, manage all aspects of the programs’ visual communications and design presence. Works with advisors to produce student and alumni profiles, promotional, recruiting, and informational content; Provides mentoring, training, and support to staff who use social media or web technologies to engage with students; Produces materials for external communications that accurately represent the Syracuse University brand. Design graphics for integration into web and print communications; Designs Honors convocation program in InDesign, and works with Word Processing to print booklet for convocation; Designs Honors infographics, apps, and other unique communications tools that integrate with our website (social media, IFTTT, APIs). Other duties as assigned Physical Requirements Not Applicable Tools/Equipment Not Applicable Application Instructions In addition to completing an online application, please attach a resume and cover letter. About Syracuse University Syracuse University is a private, international research university with distinctive academics, diversely unique offerings, and an undeniable spirit. Located in the geographic heart of New York State, with a global footprint, and over 150 years of history, Syracuse University offers a quintessential college experience. The scope of Syracuse University is a testament to its strengths: a pioneering history dating back to 1870; a choice of more than 200 majors, 100 minors, and 200 advanced degree programs offered across the University’s 13 schools and colleges; over 15,000 undergraduates and over 6,000 graduate students; more than a quarter of a million alumni in 160 countries; and a student population from all 50 U.S. states and 123 countries. For more information, please visit http://www.syracuse.edu. About The Syracuse Area Syracuse is a medium-sized city situated in the geographic center of New York State approximately 250 miles northwest of New York City. The metro-area population totals approximately 500,000. The area offers a low cost of living and provides many social, cultural, and recreational options, including parks, museums, festivals, professional regional theater, and premier shopping venues. Syracuse and Central New York present a wide range of seasonal recreation and attractions ranging from water skiing and snow skiing, hiking in the Adirondacks, touring the historic sites, visiting wineries along the Finger Lakes, and biking on trails along the Erie Canal. EEO Statement Syracuse University is an equal-opportunity, affirmative-action institution. The University prohibits discrimination and harassment based on race, color, creed, religion, sex, gender, national origin, citizenship, ethnicity, marital status, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and gender expression, veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law to the extent prohibited by law. This nondiscrimination policy covers admissions, employment, and access to and treatment in University programs, services, and activities. Commitment to Supporting and Hiring Veterans Syracuse University has a long history of engaging veterans and the military-connected community through its educational programs, community outreach, and employment programs. After World War II, Syracuse University welcomed more than 10,000 returning veterans to our campus, and those veterans literally transformed Syracuse University into the national research institution it is today. The University’s contemporary commitment to veterans builds on this historical legacy, and extends to both class-leading initiatives focused on making an SU degree accessible and affordable to the post-9/11 generation of veterans, and also programs designed to position Syracuse University as the employer of choice for military veterans, members of the Guard and Reserve, and military family members. Commitment to a Diverse and Inclusive Campus Community Syracuse University maintains an inclusive learning environment in which students, faculty, administrators, staff, curriculum, social activities, governance, and all other aspects of campus life reflect a diverse, multi-cultural, and international worldview. The University community recognizes and values the many similarities and differences among individuals and groups. At Syracuse, we are committed to preparing students to understand, live among, appreciate, and work in an inherently diverse country and world made up of people with different ethnic and racial backgrounds, military backgrounds, religious beliefs, socio-economic status, cultural traditions, abilities, sexual orientations and gender identities. To do so, we commit ourselves to promoting a community that celebrates and models the principles of diversity and inclusivity.
summary: This position requires a skilled individual with a strong technical background in database development, web design, and data analysis. The role involves designing and maintaining the Honors program's advising database, developing and managing websites and communication platforms, and using data analytics to support academic advising and student services. Additionally, the candidate must possess excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with executives and staff.

title: Business Process Improvement Analyst
description: Responsibilities Analyzes processes to understand process steps, interdependencies, and applications used to complete business transactions. Develops current and future process flows. Creates documentation and project artifacts to document the New York Automation Community team's activities. Identifies processes for optimization and or automation and works with stakeholders (business and technology) to provide recommendations. Has familiarity with Robotic Process Automation (RPA) Helps with technical requirements including detailed RPA logic for attended and unattended automations. UiPath and/or Power Automate working knowledge/certification. Other: familiarity with agile and or six sigma methodologies, desire to drive change through stakeholder collaboration, quick and eager learner, ability to be strategic and tactical.
summary: This role involves process analysis, documentation, and automation. Responsibilities include understanding business processes, developing process flows, creating documentation, identifying optimization opportunities, collaborating with stakeholders, and implementing RPA solutions using UiPath or Power Automate. Familiarity with agile and Six Sigma methodologies is beneficial. The ideal candidate is a quick learner, strategic, and collaborative.

company: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
title: Business Finance Partner Analyst
description: Company Federal Reserve Bank of New York Working at the Federal Reserve Bank of New York positions you at the center of the financial world with a unique perspective on national and international markets and economies. You will work in an environment with a diverse group of experienced professionals to foster and support the safety, soundness, and vitality of our economic and financial systems. The Bank believes in work flexibility to balance the demands of work and life while also connecting and collaborating with our colleagues in person. Employees can expect to be in the office a couple of days per week as needed for meetings and team collaboration and should live within a commutable distance. What we do: The Corporate Group is dedicated to being a trusted, strategic business partner to clients Bankwide. The Group delivers a broad range of innovative, impactful solutions that foster the Bank's ability to meet its mission. The Corporate Group is aligned across its functions to provide superior services and value-added resource and financial management that seamlessly support our clients' and the Bank's objectives. Within the Corporate Group, the Business Finance Partners (BFP) Function delivers relevant, value creating and forward-looking financial and business insights through a strategic and tactical lens to our clients and partners in support of the Bank's strategic priorities and the aggregation of those needs to the FR System. The BFP teams support each Group's strategic resource and financial management requirements, inclusive of Budget planning and management. This role will work rotate across several BFP teams, providing support to several Groups within the Bank. Your role as a BFP Analyst: Responsible for conducting the financial and accounting operations of the Bank, including: Preparing budgets, reports, and forecasts. Preparing, collecting and interpreting financial information. Conducting financial analyses of proposals, investments and fund sources. Ensuring compliance with regulatory standards What we are looking for: Demonstrated experience in finance, accounting, and planning. Ability to work under pressure with a high degree of accuracy and strong attention to detail. Possess interpersonal skills and ability to interact and collaborate effectively with team members and peers. Salary Range: $75000 - $95000 / year We believe in transparency at the NY Fed. This salary range reflects a variety of skills and experiences candidates may bring to the job. We pay individuals along this range based on their unique backgrounds. Whether you’re stretching into the job or are a more seasoned candidate, we aim to pay competitively for your contributions . Our Touchstone Behaviors —Communicate Authentically, Collaborate Inclusively, Drive Progress, Develop Others, and Take Ownership—help shape the culture of the Bank. They also provide a shared language for how we work together and achieve success, and they set clear expectations for leading with impact at every stage of your career with us. Learn more. Benefits: Our organization offers benefits that are the best fit for you at every stage of your career: Fully paid Pension plan and 401k with Generous Match Comprehensive Insurance Plans (Medical, Dental and Vision including Flexible Spending Accounts and HSA) Subsidized Public Transportation Program Tuition Assistance Program Onsite Fitness & Wellness Center And more The New York Fed expects its employees to perform their duties with honesty, integrity, and impartiality, and without improper preferential treatment of any person. Learn more about our code of conduct and conflicts of interest rules. The Federal Reserve Bank of New York is committed to a diverse workforce and to providing equal employment opportunity to all persons without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, genetic information, disability, pregnancy, or military service. We value accessibility for all candidates and are happy to provide an accommodation or assistance. Please email us at ny.leaves@ny.frb.org and we’ll be glad to help. Please note, this is a dedicated e-mail box designed exclusively to assist applications with accommodation requests in relation to our recruiting process. All other inquires including the status of applications will not receive a response from this e-mail box. This is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, performance standards or requirements, efforts, skills or working conditions associated with the job. While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the current job, management reserves the right to revise the job or to require that other or different tasks be performed when circumstances change. Full Time / Part Time Full time Regular / Temporary Regular Job Exempt (Yes / No) No Job Category Accounting/Finance Work Shift First (United States of America) The Federal Reserve Banks believe that diversity and inclusion among our employees is critical to our success as an organization, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. The Federal Reserve Banks are committed to equal employment opportunity for employees and job applicants in compliance with applicable law and to an environment where employees are valued for their differences. Privacy Notice
summary: The Federal Reserve Bank of New York is seeking a Business Finance Partners Analyst to support the financial and accounting operations of the Bank, including budget preparation, report generation, financial analysis, and compliance with regulatory standards. The role involves working with various BFP teams and supporting multiple Groups within the Bank.

title: Business Analysis Manager
description: Business Analysis Manager (Commerce Product) Who We Are Choreograph is WPP’s global data products and technology company. We’re on a mission to transform marketing by building the fastest, most connected data platform that bridges marketing strategy to scaled activation. We work with agencies and clients to transform the value of data by bringing together technology, data and analytics capabilities. We deliver this through the Open Media Studio, an AI-enabled media and data platform for the next era of advertising. We’re endlessly curious. Our team of thinkers, builders, creators and problem solvers is over 1,000 strong, across 20 markets around the world. Who We Are Looking For We are seeking a skilled Business Analyst at the Manager level to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for gathering requirements, identifying innovative solutions, and driving product development. This role offers a unique opportunity to be at the forefront of AdTech innovation, shaping the future of our products and platforms. As a key player in our team, you will play a pivotal role in identifying challenges, reviewing existing solutions, and analyzing partner integrations. If you have a background in commerce or performance-based campaign activation and are looking to transition into a product role, we encourage you to apply and be a part of our dynamic team/ You will be a part of a vibrant group, collaborating with specialist and business teams, demonstrating your technical knowledge, growing your soft/interpersonal skills and to help develop and improve the product offerings of Choreograph. What You’ll Do Gather requirements from stakeholders and translate them into actionable user stories for product teams. Conduct market reviews to identify potential partners and solutions. Conduct interviews with stakeholders to capture needs and preferences. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define data requirements and develop strategies for product enhancement. Support the development of prototypes by providing clear and concise requirements. Ensure compliance with data governance and privacy policies. Interface with the business to outline challenges and review existing solutions, both internal and external. Analyze partner integrations to inform product development. Act as the interface between the business and the product team, forming requirements for product development. Support internal candidates transitioning into a product role, particularly those with a background in commerce or performance-based campaign activation. Who You Are Proven experience in business analysis or related field. Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex requirements into actionable insights. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or related field. If you are ready to be at the forefront of the AdTech industry, shaping its future, and driving success for both Choreograph and our clients, we encourage you to apply and join our team. Choreograph is the beating heart of data inside WPP’s media investment group, GroupM, the world’s leading media investment company responsible for more than $60 billion in annual media investment.. Discover more about Choreograph at www.choreograph.com GroupM and all its affiliates embrace and celebrate diversity, inclusivity, and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We are a worldwide media agency network that represents global clients. The more inclusive we are, the more great work we can create together. The base salary for this position at the time of this posting may range from $60,000 to $140,000. Individual compensation varies based on job-related factors, including business needs, experience, level of responsibility and qualifications. We offer a competitive benefits package, please visit https://www.wpp.com/people/wellbeing/benefits-at-wpp-in-the-us for more details. Reference ID: oqY3sfwD
summary: Choreograph, WPP's global data products and technology company, seeks a Business Analysis Manager to join their team. This role involves gathering requirements, analyzing partner integrations, and driving product development for their AI-enabled media and data platform, Open Media Studio. Ideal candidate has a background in commerce or performance-based campaign activation and strong analytical skills.

title: Business Development Analyst
description: Who We Are Rain’s mission is to create the fastest and easiest pathways to access capital in the real world. We’re a small and mighty team of passionate builders and veteran founders building at the intersection of cryptocurrency and fintech. We are looking for a business development analyst to join us to accelerate the organization and guide the early structure of our partnerships at the earliest stage. You will have the opportunity to deliver massive impact at a quickly growing company that is funded by some of the top investors in fintech and crypto. Our Ethos We believe in an open structure, and you will be able to grow into the roles that most align with your goals. Our team members at all levels have the freedom to explore ideas and impact the roadmap and vision of our company. Who We Are Looking For Rain is seeking an experienced analytical and high integrity Business Development Analyst who is capable of developing, owning and managing large partner relationships and strategic ecosystem initiatives. The right candidate will possess a detailed understanding of the web3 and financial landscape. We are looking for high performers that can help us grow and strengthen our partnerships and further develop our sales cycle. The role will allow the successful candidate to develop their expertise as well as opportunities to explore other elements of working within a fast growing company. What you will work on: You will be one of the core members of our operations team with the opportunity to contribute to various pieces of our organizational growth. Landing and growing strategic partnerships The trusted expert advisor and thought leader to 3rd party partners about all things related to Rain Collaborate with key internal and external stakeholders to design and deliver events, content, and offers Create robust activation and growth programming Delivering on a set of ambitious company-level business objectives Ensuring clear and articulate communication in both written and oral form including sharing documentation, soliciting feedback and maintaining deal hygiene in sales tools What You Will Bring To Rain BA/BS required; advanced degree is a plus 3+ years of Business Development or related experience Ability to work cross-functionally across teams and within the deal lifecycle Ability to structure, analyze, and solve complex business problems, as well as deliver impact against concrete business goals. Proven track record of complex problem solving and decision-making skills Strong analytical skills and team player Desirable but not mandatory: Exposure to B2B sales Experience with Hubspot, Salesforce or other CRMs Experience working in both U.S and LATAM We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at Rain. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Compensation is commensurate with experience and includes cash and equity compensation. Our perks enable working at Rain to be a fulfilling, healthy and happy experience. Unlimited vacation can be daunting, so at Rain we require our teammates to take 10 days minimum for themselves. We support a flexible workplace, if you feel comfortable at home please work from home. If you’d like to work with others in an office feel free to come in. We want everyone to be able to work in the environment in which they are their most confident and productive selves. Easy-to-access benefits, for all employees based in the US, Rain pays a percentage of your benefits for the employee and for your dependents. We offer comprehensive health, dental and vision plans as well as a 100% company-subsidized life insurance plan.
summary: Rain, a fintech company focused on cryptocurrency and capital access, is seeking a Business Development Analyst to manage partner relationships, develop strategic initiatives, and contribute to organizational growth. The role requires 3+ years of experience, strong analytical skills, and exposure to the web3 and financial landscape. The ideal candidate will be able to work cross-functionally, solve complex problems, and deliver impactful results. Rain offers competitive compensation, equity, unlimited vacation, a flexible workplace, and comprehensive benefits.

title: PeopleSoft Business Analyst
description: Job Description Title: PeopleSoft Business Analyst Duration: 12 months (Extendable) Work location: Albany, NY (2 days onsite and 3 days off site-hybrid position). Work Auth: USC/ GC About Project: PeopleSoft Business Analyst will support the New York State Retirement Redesign Project. Mandatory Requirements Four or more years of business analysis experience in a PeopleSoft environment in each of at least three of the following knowledge areas: Business analysis planning and monitoring Elicitation and collaboration Requirements life cycle management Strategy analysis Requirements analysis and design definition Solution evaluation Four or more years of experience in reading and creating SQLs. Four or more years of experience utilizing an understanding of PeopleSoft architecture and table structures. Desired Qualifications Experience performing business analysis in one or more of the following PeopleSoft modules CRM, HCM, FIN & IB. Experience developing solutions emphasizing use of delivered functionality either to removing existing customizations or to provide solutions to meet business needs. Experience performing business analysis in a government setting. Four or more years of experience utilizing PeopleSoft Application Designer as a reference tool for functional design, support, and troubleshooting.
summary: PeopleSoft Business Analyst needed for New York State Retirement Redesign Project.  Four+ years of PeopleSoft business analysis experience required, along with SQL proficiency and understanding of PeopleSoft architecture.

title: Senior Salesforce Business Analyst
description: Location : Remote within the United States (EST Time Zone) About Madison Ave Consulting At Madison Ave Consulting, our vision is to be the leading Salesforce consulting firm known for empowering our employees and delivering exceptional value and service to our clients. We are dedicated to fostering a fulfilling and inclusive work environment that prioritizes the health, well-being, and growth of our team members. By promoting a culture of support and development, we enable our consultants to excel and consistently deliver outstanding service. We pride ourselves on cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace, underpinned by our commitment to sustainability and family-friendly values. As a remote-first organization, we offer flexibility that empowers our employees to work from locations that suit their needs, reducing our carbon footprint and promoting work-life balance. We understand the importance of family and personal life and strive to create a supportive workplace through flexible schedules and robust job security. Compensation And Benefits Salary Range: $75,000 - $120,000 (inclusive of bonus/commission and benefits) Benefits: Medical & Dental Insurance Health & Dependent Care FSAs 401(k) 11 Federal Holidays 20 Days PTO Fully Remote + Travel Laptop + Equipment Stipend Role Summary As a Senior Salesforce Business Analyst at Madison Ave Consulting, you will play a crucial role in the success of our Salesforce projects. You will work closely with internal teams and clients to gather requirements, provide insights, and ensure timely, within-scope project delivery. Your deep understanding of Salesforce and ability to translate business needs into actionable technical solutions will be essential. While this role is primarily remote, you must be prepared to travel regularly to various client sites across the U.S. as project needs arise. Requirements Key Responsibilities acilitate workshops or meetings to elicit business and technical requirements, building consensus among stakeholders Collaborate with stakeholders to gather, document, and validate business requirements, ensuring alignment with overall business strategy Translate business requirements into functional specifications for implementation by the technical team Work alongside project managers to keep projects on track and within budget Analyze and interpret data to provide insights and recommendations for business process improvements Conduct user acceptance testing (UAT) and assist in training end-users on new features or changes Stay updated with the latest Salesforce features to deliver optimal solutions to clients Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of Salesforce with other systems Maintain clear and comprehensive documentation throughout the project lifecycle Mentor junior business analysts, sharing knowledge and best practices Qualifications Requirements: 3+ years of experience as a Business Analyst Experience working with enterprise-level clients and projects Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Proficient in data analysis tools and techniques Excellent verbal and written communication skills Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects Availability to travel to multiple sites across the U.S. regularly Salesforce certification or equivalent experience is a plus Familiarity with Agile or Scrum methodologies Benefits Compensation and Benefits Salary Range: $75,000 - $120,000 (inclusive of bonus/commission and benefits) Benefits: Medical & Dental Insurance Health & Dependent Care FSAs 401(k) 11 Federal Holidays 20 Days PTO Fully Remote + Travel Laptop + Equipment Stipend
summary: Madison Ave Consulting is seeking a Senior Salesforce Business Analyst to work remotely with travel to various client sites across the US. The role involves gathering requirements, translating them into technical solutions, and ensuring project delivery within scope and budget.  Key responsibilities include facilitating workshops, gathering and documenting requirements, conducting user acceptance testing, and mentoring junior analysts.  The ideal candidate has 3+ years of experience as a Business Analyst, strong analytical skills, excellent communication, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

title: Business Development, Senior Analyst
description: Join one of the largest renewable owners, operators and developers in the U.S., delivering innovative, renewable power solutions that accelerate the world towards a sustainable, low-carbon future. With current assets under management in the U.S. valued at $20 billion and over 190 utility-scale renewable energy generating facilities located across 34 states, Brookfield Renewable U.S. offers a multitude of career opportunities. Our dynamic organization is focused on our mission to optimize and drive value across our renewable energy portfolio, advancing the transition to a sustainable, clean energy future. Our value also extends well beyond the clean energy we produce. From our extensive renewable power fleet we make positive economic, social and environmental impacts in the communities where we live and work. Brookfield Renewable U.S. attracts high-performing individuals who are driven to make an impact in a fast-paced and collaborative environment. We offer unparalleled opportunity to lead and manage one of the largest renewable energy businesses with decades of history, while contributing to the global need for sustainable energy Reporting to the Senior Vice President, Business Development, the Senior Analyst will join a team of high performing and collaborative professionals, working closely together on the development and execution of Brookfield Renewable’s growth strategies in the U.S.. The Business Development Senior Analyst will also support key initiatives related to capital deployment through both greenfield project development and external investment opportunities. The Business Development Senior Analyst will focus on supporting senior members of the team to identify, originate and execute renewable power investment opportunities; develop and execute on new growth initiatives; and facilitate capital recycling initiatives. Our strategy is to leverage Brookfield's competitive advantages, including geographical scale, local presence, access to large-scale capital and our operations-oriented approach, to acquire high-quality assets on a value basis. The Business Development Senior Analyst will participate in executing broader investment strategies through other Brookfield sponsored investment vehicles with a focus on U.S opportunities. This position would be suitable for candidates who thrive in a performance-driven environment that emphasizes employee leadership and accountability for delivering results. Responsibilities Participate in transaction execution, which includes due diligence of potential investments, identifying key investment merits and risks, meeting with management, reviewing transaction documentation, and working in conjunction with third-party consultants as required Monitor existing portfolio assets and assist with various value enhancing business plan initiatives Conduct valuations of assets and companies in the renewable power space using various methods such as comparable company analysis, precedent transactions and Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) valuations; Build detailed financial models used in the evaluation of potential transactions and to support transaction execution; Coordinate with cross functional teams to contribute to the due diligence process and liaise with external stakeholders in evaluation of investment opportunities; Develop detailed business plans to support Brookfield Renewable U.S. senior management team in decision-making related to strategic initiatives and new business opportunities Assist in developing ideas for potential transaction and deal structures, perform industry research and evaluate new market segments and potential opportunities; Create presentation materials and present to senior management team and investment committees in a concise and comprehensive manner; Conduct special projects as required. Requirements University degree in a quantitative field such as finance, business, economics, or accounting with high academic standing 2+ years analyst level] years of relevant work experience, preferably in renewable power, infrastructure, private equity, investment banking, project finance, transaction services, or a valuations function Experience conducting research and due diligence, evaluating transaction opportunities, performing financial and valuation analysis, and producing investment materials for senior management Proven experience in detailed financial modeling in Excel including valuation and financing of investment opportunities Proficiency with Excel, PowerPoint and other Microsoft Office tools. Professional with a positive attitude and capable of contributing to a dynamic and team-oriented culture. Salary: $130,000 - $150,000
summary: Brookfield Renewable U.S. is seeking a Senior Analyst to join their Business Development team. This role will involve supporting the development and execution of growth strategies, including identifying and executing renewable power investment opportunities, developing new initiatives, and facilitating capital recycling. Responsibilities include due diligence, valuation analysis, financial modeling, and creating presentation materials for senior management.  This position requires a quantitative degree, 2+ years of relevant experience, and proficiency in financial modeling and Microsoft Office tools.

title: Business Change Analyst
description: Role This position is a technical role within the Corporate Strategy team, working directly with business teams, with a focus on driving business process improvement through the application of technology. This role includes hands on delivery of technical solutions, initially focused on workflow automation using Mendix workflows, and working on Workday integrations but also needing to deliver reporting using tools such as SQL, DBT and PowerBI. Experience with building systems for HR or recruiting would be advantageous. This is a high visibility and high impact opportunity given the diverse mandate with responsibilities spanning across both business analysis and hands-on technical delivery. As such, the ideal candidate will be highly adaptable and willing to learn new technical skills as well as become a business domain expert as we automate key processes to reduce the risk of human error and increase efficiency of business teams. This role is hands on, including directly developing Mendix automation, customizing Workday, and building PowerBI reports. Responsibilities Lead requirements gathering and solution design directly with end users Translate business requirements into technical specifications and process flow maps. Create and implement technical solutions to solve current and future business problems as part of an overall roadmap Automate workflows to improve internal processes by implementing cross-team and cross-functional workflows and solutions within tools such as Mendix and Workday, as well as other systems. The ideal candidate will be technology agnostic and focused on business value. Build reporting and analytics for Human Resources, Compliance, Legal, Accounting, Operations and other teams Customize Mendix, Workday and other tools to improve the user experience, including writing code Create automated tests for workflows Keep up to date with Mendix and Workday feature releases, evaluate and integrate features as well as train users while driving adoption of new features and tools Create training documentation that will be used by other teams Qualifications Experience with Mendix, SQL, REST API calls. Python or React experience would be a bonus. Experience working with Workday integrations Experience working with workflow automation using Mendix, Appian, Outsystems, ServiceNow, Microsoft Powerflows, Salesforce Flows, or other automation tooling Experience in at least one primary BI tool such as PowerBI, Tableau or Looker Experience in adapting already gathered requirements to the evolving needs of the business Exceptional attention to detail and a focus on correct data Demonstrated project management experience Ability to work without close supervision in a fast-paced and dynamic environment Demonstrated examples of resilience to deal with ambiguity and change Ability to provide clarity and insight through data visualizations and reporting commentary Experience working in asset management (Private Equity, Long-only, Hedge Funds, Family Office) is advantageous but not required Technologies that will be encountered during the job Mendix Workday Salesforce STAR Compliance PowerBI SQL Snowflake DBT VSCode/DrawIO/Excalidraw With respect to NY- and CA-based applicants, the starting base pay range for this role is between $125000 and $175000 annually. The actual base pay is dependent upon several factors, including, but not limited to, relevant experience, business needs and market demands. This role may also be eligible for bonus compensation and employee benefits.
summary: This is a technical role within the Corporate Strategy team, focusing on driving business process improvement through technology, specifically workflow automation, Workday integrations, and reporting. The role involves hands-on development, requirements gathering, solution design, and training. Prior experience with HR or recruiting systems is a plus. The ideal candidate is highly adaptable, eager to learn, and comfortable working with diverse technologies.

title: Business Analyst
description: About The Company Our client is a private equity firm with over $85 billion in AUM investing in companies globally at all stages of development across industries and helping them scale. The firm is hiring an Accounting and Technology Business Analyst who will be responsible for supporting their accounting and reporting technology platforms. Responsibilities Documenting business processes and data requirements Reviewing design documentation to ensure it meets the needs of the business process Defining, recommending, and implementing business process improvements Documenting business constraints and assumptions Developing detailed documentation around how IT systems facilitate business process Developing detailed training documentation Creation of user testing strategies, plans, scripts, and participating in test execution Identifying project issues/risks and recommending solutions Troubleshooting business issues as it relates to all supporting technology Requirements Bachelor’s degree required 7-10 years of experience as a BA in developing and implementation improvements to accounting systems Experience/understanding of partnership accounting and PE reporting Ability to drive multiple projects forward simultaneously and understand and manage priorities Experience with developing reports Analytical skills to analyze the requirements and define scope and deliverables Salary Range $150,000 – $200,000
summary: A private equity firm with over $85 billion in AUM is seeking an Accounting and Technology Business Analyst to support their accounting and reporting technology platforms. This role involves documenting business processes, reviewing design documentation, defining and implementing improvements, developing training materials, and participating in user testing.  The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor's degree, 7-10 years of experience as a BA in accounting systems, experience with partnership accounting and PE reporting, strong project management and analytical skills, and the ability to develop reports.

title: Business Analyst
description: The Position This position is a member of the finance department. The Business Analyst will report directly to the Senior Accounting Manager. This position will be responsible for analyzing financial and operational data by collecting data, developing actionable information, and creating appropriate models for decision support. Improve financial status by analyzing results; monitoring variances; identifying trends by utilizing Microsoft Dynamics 365 System and Microsoft Power Stack; recommending actions to leadership and management. Assist with annual and quarterly forecasting. title: Financial Business Analyst with SQL & Snowflake

Extensive use of SQL tables, views, and stored procedures for analysis and development. Learn and use third party software to provide business solutions. Work alongside Cloud team on long term technology initiatives for migration to AWS cloud. Front line support answering any queries from business users. Required Qualifications: 5-8 years of related experience in financial services (Capital Markets a plus). Experience with Snowflake is required. Relational database programming skills required, strong SQL knowledge. Solid teamwork skills and work ethic; a collaborative work style is essential. Resourceful, well organized, highly dependable, and efficient. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. The success of Solomon Page reflects an organic growth strategy supported by a highly entrepreneurial culture. Acting as a strategic partner to our clients and candidates, we focus on providing customized solutions and building long-term relationships based on trust, respect, and the consistent delivery of excellent results. title: Team Services Strategy, Analyst  -- Remote | WFH
description: We're a trailblazing all-remote company with over 2,000 team members thriving in our virtual office environment. Our cutting-edge approach redefines the traditional workplace, offering 24/7 access to collaborative tools and training in a 3-D, fully immersive cloud office. We reward creative minds who propose bold solutions, value opinions, and aim for revolutionary outcomes. If you're excited about doing big things, we want you on our team! What You'll Do As a Remote Services Strategy Analyst, you'll play a crucial role in onboarding and integrating new brokerages and teams into our system. Your responsibilities will include: Leading Discovery Calls with Team Leaders to discuss team structures, joining processes, and requirements, while gathering essential information. Developing detailed timelines and transition plans, overseeing the brokerage's journey from pre-onboarding to active status, including post-onboarding support. Performing regular follow-up check-ins with leads through calls or emails to establish a preferred contact frequency. Coordinating and participating in planning and logistics meetings with brokers and other departments as needed. Acting as a liaison between sponsors and broker owners, managing expectations throughout the onboarding process. Initiating contact with Team Leaders for organic leads to arrange Discovery Calls. Collecting and processing external documents such as proof of production and team rosters, and evaluating Production Reports for Team Structure qualification and approval. Notifying Brokerage Operations and Transactions Operations about incoming teams and brokerages. Following up on any pending documents from team leaders or admins, with support staff handling document uploads. Tracking metrics and reports using tools like Google Forms, spreadsheets, and HubSpot. Completing necessary details in HubSpot tickets, dispatching welcome emails, and making introductory calls or texts to agents. Developing strategies for retaining team agents in assigned regions. Performing designated job tasks efficiently and within provided time frames. Maintaining regular communication with team members and supervisors through email, instant messaging, video conferences, or other designated communication channels. Attending virtual meetings, providing progress updates, and actively participating in discussions. Adhering to company policies and guidelines, including data security and confidentiality. Completing assigned projects, assignments, or tasks with attention to detail and quality. Managing and prioritizing workload effectively to meet deadlines and deliver results. Continuously updating job knowledge by participating in training opportunities or self-directed learning. Collaborating with colleagues on shared documents or projects using remote collaboration tools. Taking ownership of assigned work and demonstrating initiative in identifying and addressing challenges. Ensuring availability and responsiveness during agreed-upon working hours. What We're Looking For High school diploma or equivalent years of applicable experience required 0-2 years of experience Associate's degree preferred Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal Agile and flexible attitude Strong attention to detail Exceptional customer service abilities Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills Team player - capable of completing individual tasks and collaborating with others to achieve goals Experience In The Real Estate Industry Strongly Preferred Experience in coordinating events and group activities Conflict resolution and active listening skills Proficient knowledge of G Suite; Microsoft Office experience is a bonus Remote Work Experience Required Dedicated home-office/workspace Advanced Trello Experience Preferred Aptitude for using online platforms and software to work remotely What We Offer Fully remote environment Paid Time Off 401(k) with 4% match (immediate vesting) Robust medical, dental, and vision benefits Company-provided equipment Monthly technology stipend FSA & HSA with employer contributions Health & wellness incentives 100% paid parental leave Diversity And Inclusion We strongly value diversity and strive to create a supportive, inclusive environment where everyone can succeed. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate based on race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, military or veteran status, citizenship, or other protected characteristics under federal, state, or local law. If you're passionate about making a difference and think you'd be a great fit for this position, we encourage you to apply—even if you don't meet all the requirements! Employment Type: Full-Time

title: Business Analyst - Hemophilia Services
description: Business Analyst - Hemophilia Services Job Locations US-NY-Westbury Job ID 2024-5666 Category Administrative Minimum Rate USD $80,000.00/Yr. Maximum Rate USD $90,000.00/Yr. Work Location Type Physical Overview At New York Blood Center, one of the most comprehensive blood centers in the world, our focus is on cultivating excellence by merging cutting-edge innovation with diligent customer service, groundbreaking research, and comprehensive program and service development. Join us as we work towards meeting and exceeding the growing needs of our diverse communities, further our lifesaving strategic goals in a rapidly changing environment, and expand our impact on the local, national, and global communities we serve. Responsibilities Conduct thorough analysis of pharmacy and wholesale operations, including drug utilization, inventory management and reporting. Annual and quarterly business audit reporting by customer. Analyze purchasing and distribution data by hospital and patient. Reconcile monthly billing reports. Maintain all historical data and update as needed. Ad Hoc reports as requested. Compliance with the drug supply chain security act (DSCSA). Compliance with the federal 340B discount drug program. Assigned short- and long-term projects. Monitor purchasing contracts compliance and accurate pricing and discounts. Assist with quarterly price changes. Related Experience: Four years' experience in a professional capacity working in health care or ideally pharmacy operations. Direct experience in data analysis and/or health care drug utilization planning background. Any combination of education, training and experience equivalent to the requirements listed above that has supplied the necessary knowledge, skills, and experience to perform the essential functions of the job. For applicants who will perform this position in New York City or Westchester County, the proposed annual salary is $80,000.00 p/yr to $90,000.00 p/yr. For applicants who will perform this position outside of New York City or Westchester County, salary will reflect local market rates and be commensurate with the applicant's skills, job-related knowledge, and experience. Unless otherwise specified, all posted opportunities are located in the New York or Greater Tri-State office locations.

Adherence to the defined standards. Take initiative and drives to bring to logical conclusion; proactive approach. Provide accurate and timely information and escalates when there are issues. Experience: 5-7 years Health IT Industry experience preferred 7-10 years practical experience in providing technical support and maintenance on clinical applications preferred Allscripts Sunrise Clinical Manager experience required Sunrise Acute Care: In-depth knowledge of Sunrise Acute Care functionality and configuration Excellent client facing skills with the ability to thrive in a highly critical environment Strong written and verbal communication skills Travel Requirements: May require local travel May require other travel for business needs Working Arrangements: Work is performed in a standard office environment with minimal exposure to health or safety hazards Our company complies with all local/state regulations in regard to displaying salary ranges. title: Analyst, Strategy & Operations | Banking Client Services
description: Red Ventures is seeking a Strategy & Operations Analyst to join our Banking Services division. As an Associate Consumer Experience Analyst, you’ll work with RV business leaders and drive the operations of one of our brands through iterative experience optimization, deep diving into visitor behavior and performance, and driving the creation of new features and tools that enhance the customer experience and drive additional revenue. This role requires a hybrid schedule and will be based in our Fort Mill, SC Headquarters or our NYC Office (Tuesday through Thursday) and work fully remotely on Mondays and Fridays each week. We believe that diverse, inclusive teams are better teams. Think of the bullets below as guidelines: If you only partially meet the qualifications on this posting, we encourage you to apply anyway! What You'll Do Develop and implement testing initiatives and product features. Develop actionable insights and define KPIs to measure success Analyze their performance against core KPIs that align with the broader business goals. Manage the development of user-centric features & flows to help streamline the customer experience and drive additional value to the business. Operate as an owner of the site, using data and a deep understanding of our users to identify areas to optimize, troubleshoot functionality, and work with others to develop solutions that enhance the experience and performance of the site. Work directly with Engineers and Creative teams to define features and create a site experience roadmap to bring your ideas to life Communicate timelines, goals, and performance to diverse audiences, including engineers, content writers, digital designers, fellow analysts, and senior leaders. What We're Looking For 1+ years of experience as a Digital Operations Analyst, Product Analyst, or Business analyst with hands-on data analysis experience to pull strategic insights. Top consulting firms experience is a plus. Proficient in SQL, BigQuery, or DataGrip (preferred); can weave together data from multiple relational databases. Demonstrated ability to synthesize data into actionable insights and communicate recommendations to leadership. Proficient with Google Analytics, Adobe analytics or another segmentation platform; can segment data and analyze performance based on meaningful differences between user groups. Strong level of accountability and ability to communicate across functional teams to drive priorities, anticipate pitfalls, and raise issues before they become project blockers Strong bias towards action by demonstrating initiative to move projects forward independently, asking questions as the need arises and leveraging resources available Excellent organizational and communication skills. Passionate about understanding customer behavior and improving the quality of interactions. Compensation CLT: $80,000 - 100,000* NYC: $80,000 - $125,000* *Note actual salary is based on geographic location, qualifications, and experience. Additionally, the following benefits are provided by Red Ventures, subject to eligibility requirements. Health Insurance Coverage (medical, dental, and vision) Life Insurance Short and Long-Term Disability Insurance Flexible Spending Accounts Paid Time Off Holiday Pay 401(k) with match Employee Assistance Program Paid Parental Bonding Benefit Program Who We Are Founded in 2000, Red Ventures (RV) is home to a diverse portfolio of industry-leading brands and businesses, strategic partnerships and proprietary technology – including Bankrate, Lonely Planet, CNET, The Points Guy, BestColleges and more. Together, RV helps millions of people worldwide make life’s most important decisions, accelerates digital adaptation, and innovates the online consumer experience by improving every step of the consumer journey – from first discovery of information, throughout the decision-making process, to transactions. Headquartered south of Charlotte, NC, Red Ventures employs thousands of people across the US and Puerto Rico, with international offices in the UK and Brazil. For more information, visit https://redventures.com and follow @RedVentures on social platforms. We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits program for full-time employees, including medical, dental and vision coverage, paid time off, life insurance, disability coverage, employee assistance program, 401(k) plan and a paid parental leave program. Red Ventures is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or any other basis protected by law. title: Senior Business Analyst
description: UNIVERSAL Technologies is seeking a Senior Business Systems/QA Analyst for a remote position based in Albany, NY. Applicants must be able to pass a mandatory ITS Security Agreements and Fingerprint-based Background Check and sign an NDA (non-disclosure agreement). Candidates must reside in the EST Time zone in USA. Position: The Senior Business Analyst will participate with the business in the creation/completion of project charters for automation projects. Daily responsibilities will include gaining an understanding of business problems, defining and validating project scope, capturing and documenting requirements, meeting with stakeholders, subject matter experts, process owners, and users, developing business requirements, and ensuring best practices and standard operating procedures are consistently met. WHO WE ARE: UNIVERSAL Technologies, LLC is a Women-Owned (M/WBE) IT solutions and consulting company focused on delivering enterprise systems that significantly improve our clients IT performance. We work across the IT spectrum including Development, Business/Systems/Data Analysis, Project Management, Cyber Security, Network Engineering, and High-Level System Architecture. The pride in the services we provide and the accessibility and flexibility we provide to employees are what make Universal Technologies stand out from the rest! We hope to propel your IT career to the next level and excite our employees with new and challenging projects. WHAT WE OFFER: Our W2 employees can expect the following benefits: Competitive pay Health/Dental Insurance Group Life Insurance 401K HSA/FSA Pre-Tax Transportation Program Generous Paid Time Off/Holiday Policy MANDATORIES: Bachelor’s degree in math, science, computer science, psychology, or a related field. An equivalent combination of advanced education, training, and experience will be considered. A minimum of 7 years’ relevant experience in business analysis. Strong analytic capabilities and exemplary skills in stakeholder relationship development and management. Exceptional written and verbal communications and interpersonal skills. Ability to manage and develop key relationships with colleagues and clients through collaborative thinking and a strong customer focus. Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite. Hands-on experience using Visio, Miro, Balsamiq, UXPIN software tools. Experience with developing requirements for solution and solution component design, leveraging Secure Software Development Life Cycle (SSDLC). Required Skills: 7 years of analyzing an organization or business domain and documenting its business or processes or systems, assessing the business model or its integration with technology. 7 years of performing analysis by eliciting and analyzing stakeholders’ business needs using various analysis techniques. 7 years creating and maintaining software development artifacts for communication of requirements, including context diagrams, textual use cases, swim lane diagrams, report specifications, wireframes, user interface specifications, and non-functional requirements specifications. 7 years of facilitating requirement workshops, JAD sessions, and structured walkthroughs. 7 years of experience creating test plans/cases, managing defects with development teams, and working with users on User Acceptance Testing. 7 years of managing requirements throughout the Requirements Management Lifecycle. 3 years of experience working on various applications within the Business domain/License domain. JOB DUTIES: Work closely with the project manager, ITS manager, technical team members, and other project stakeholders to provide project guidance. Study the business and software application domains to understand the problem space and develop effective software solutions. Work as a liaison to software users and Subject Matter Experts to elicit, analyze, communicate, validate, and verify the requirements for complex changes and new business processes. Convey the requirements of the software users to the development team. Create business requirements documents, context diagrams, business requirements documents (BRD), system “as-is” and “to be” states, system specifications, use cases and workflow diagrams, report and screen mockups, swim lane diagrams, and prototypes. Ensure that artifacts required by ITS governance process and Secure Systems Development Lifecycle (SSDLC) are created and support the project scope. Facilitate the adoption of standard patterns and designs which support the application, data, and security architecture strategy for applications. Actively adapt to changing technology needs and frameworks. Leverage the Secure Software Development Life Cycle (SSDLC) for all activities. Assist with creating accurate time estimates for the completion of technical documentation and execution tasks. Develop requirements for solution and solution component design. Collaborate with developers and business subject matter experts to analyze requirements and design tradeoffs and priorities. Manage requirements through the life of the contract using a requirements management plan and traceability to ensure coverage between the source of each requirement and the test case(s) it will be tested by. Responsible for any other tasks assigned by management. UNIVERSAL Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
summary: UNIVERSAL Technologies seeks a Senior Business Systems/QA Analyst to work remotely in Albany, NY.  The role involves collaborating with the business to create automation project charters, understanding business problems, defining and validating project scope, capturing and documenting requirements, and ensuring adherence to best practices.  Candidates require 7+ years of relevant experience, strong analytical skills, exceptional communication, and proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite. They should also have experience with Visio, Miro, Balsamiq, UXPIN, SSDLC, and various applications within the Business/License domain.

title: Sales Business Analyst | GTM
description: Description About Us HiBob helps modern, mid-size businesses transform the way they manage people, giving HR and managers all they need to connect, engage, develop, and retain top talent. Since 2015, we’ve achieved consecutive triple-digit year-over-year growth, all backed by our amazing team of Bobbers from across the globe, making us the choice HRIS of over 3000 midsize and multinational companies. Our HR platform is intuitive, data-driven, and built for the way people work today: globally, remotely, and collaboratively. Fast-growing companies across the globe such as Monzo, Happy Socks, Gong, Fiverr, and VaynerMedia rely upon Bob to help them create the best work experiences for their people. Come and be you with us Being a Bobber is all about being you. We want you to bring all parts of yourself to work, giving you the freedom and confidence to be the best you and do your best work. If that’s bubbly, shy, precise, funny, bold, kind, honest, brilliant, or anything in between, we’re waiting with open arms. Come join us. Note: We will only consider candidates located in the New York Metro Area who are willing to work in our NYC office at least two days a week. We love collaborating and connecting with our team members in-person, and we hope you will too!** ﻿ As a Revenue Operations Business Analyst, you will serve as a bridge between business stakeholders and technology teams, helping to translate business needs into technical solutions. You will analyze sales processes, gather requirements, and contribute to the development of strategies and solutions that improve operational efficiency and drive business growth. What will you do? Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their objectives and requirements. Document and prioritize business and functional requirements. Create detailed documentation of business requirements, processes, and workflows. Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform decision-making. Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to monitor Sales KPIs and performance. Prepare reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations. Communicate insights effectively to stakeholders using data visualization tools. Assist in revenue forecasting, pipeline analysis and performance tracking. Provide regular updates on project status and issue resolution. Maintain effective communication with business stakeholders and project teams. Develop and maintain data models, reports, and dashboards. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement process improvements. Base salaries for this role range from $100,000 - $150,000 per year. ﻿ As an HR company, HiBob seeks to create a best-in-class employee experience for all Bobbers. We take immense pride in the diversity of our team and in creating an environment that is fair and equitable for all. Ensuring pay equity across race, gender, and all other forms of diversity is pivotal to this mission. When determining salary ranges for our roles, we look at external market data and the salaries of Bobbers holding the same or similar roles. Our pay bands are wide because great candidates come to us with a broad range of experience and skill sets. When making individual pay rate decisions, we take into account the candidates’ depth of experience, their qualifications relative to incumbent employees, and their location-among other factors. Requirements Requirements are often considered a measure of how equipped you are to do the job, but sometimes, they aren’t the only factor. If you don’t have nearly enough experience, or not all the skills, we’d still like to hear from you. This could be the perfect fit for you and us. Proven experience as a Business Analyst or similar role, preferable in a sales setting. Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques including Tableau, Excel, SQL, etc Strong knowledge of the sales tech stack including Salesforce, Outreach, Chilipiper, enrichment tools, etc. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and critical thinking skills. Familiarity with forecasting models, tools and processes. Familiarity with business analysis methodologies and tools, project management strategies, and stakeholder management. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to distill complex ideas simply and effectively. Knowledge of Python, Javascript, or similar programming languages. Ability to document data models, business processes and visual workflows. Join our village Benefits HiBob is a village filled with amazing people and we’re especially proud of that. It’s a place where Bobbers can be themselves. We’re about fun, dreams, hopes and ambition, just as much as we are about precision, growth, and top performance. Becoming a Bobber means you’ll receive competitive compensation, benefits, and pre-IPO equity alongside all of this: Stock options at a high-growth unicorn startup 100% subsidized medical, dental, and vision coverage for employees 401(k) with a 3% company match starting from Day 1 Work from home allowance to get your home office set up! Temporary remote work-from-anywhere in the world for up to 2 months after 6 months of employment Annual Headspace subscription and wellness benefits Two social impact days per year for volunteering Bob balance days - 4 additional days within a calendar year - Enjoy a company-wide long weekend at the beginning of each quarter Employee referral program - $2,500 bonus for each successful referral with an additional ambassador bonus Fun and frequent social events (in-person and virtual) We love birthdays - take the day off and receive a special gift If this sounds like something you’ve been looking for, we’d love to have you. Come on, join our village!

title: Functional Business Analyst
description: Job Description Syracuse University’s Office of the Registrar seeks a detail-oriented Functional Business Analyst II to enhance its student information systems, specifically leveraging expertise in PeopleSoft Student Records. Key responsibilities include complex report development, using tools like Tableau and Oracle SQL, supporting internal teams that manage PeopleSoft Student Records and Graduation Processing by creating and maintaining audits and also by analyzing and understanding student career progression and the configuration of student academic load. This position will also assist with system process management through documentation, system testing and by leading system enhancements in order to improve system processes. Essential skills include system and data analysis expertise, effective collaboration and communication, and meticulous attention to detail. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in information technology, business, or related discipline. Five (5+) plus years of relevant work experience. Information systems acumen indicated by experience in functional administration of enterprise systems and database applications. Knowledge of university reporting requirements and FERPA. Job Specific Qualifications Strong technical skills and experience with PeopleSoft, various enterprise systems, databases, reporting tools. Experience managing data accuracy and security. Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills are required. Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and ability to work collaboratively with university colleagues with a forward thinking, student centered and service-oriented approach. Responsibilities Provide technical support and subject matter expertise for PeopleSoft, Security/FAST, and third-party systems including, but not limited to Parchment, Diplomatic, 25Live, Acalog/Curriculog and other enterprise application systems. Administer student records security, manage, and maintain access to data appropriately. Work with functional and technical users in the Registrar’s Office to determine the appropriate access to data based on PeopleSoft permissions lists or access to information in data in enterprise systems and reports. Research new functionality and improvements as it relates to the various enterprise application systems. Provide technical project support for new functionality, upgrades, and other assigned projects. Develop and maintain required process documentation. Create, update, and maintain various reports, production queries and dashboards to support the processes of the Registrar’s office, schools and colleges and external agencies such as NSC. Approve, test and support queries in the data warehouse and University repositories. Continually review structure both of queries and of the data warehouse to facilitate better ways to collect and use information from the production systems; work with ITS to make data warehouse structural changes. Audit and analyze data and trends for decision making as it relates to improving and supporting various processes. Analyze business requirements and translate them into functional specifications as required. Develop, document, and maintain various test plans for new functionality and system enhancements during regression and upgrade test cycles. Other duties as assigned. Physical Requirements Tools/Equipment Application Instructions In addition to completing an online application, please attach a resume and cover letter. About Syracuse University Syracuse University is a private, international research university with distinctive academics, diversely unique offerings, and an undeniable spirit. Located in the geographic heart of New York State, with a global footprint, and over 150 years of history, Syracuse University offers a quintessential college experience. The scope of Syracuse University is a testament to its strengths: a pioneering history dating back to 1870; a choice of more than 200 majors, 100 minors, and 200 advanced degree programs offered across the University’s 13 schools and colleges; over 15,000 undergraduates and over 6,000 graduate students; more than a quarter of a million alumni in 160 countries; and a student population from all 50 U.S. states and 123 countries. For more information, please visit http://www.syracuse.edu. About The Syracuse Area Syracuse is a medium-sized city situated in the geographic center of New York State approximately 250 miles northwest of New York City. The metro-area population totals approximately 500,000. The area offers a low cost of living and provides many social, cultural, and recreational options, including parks, museums, festivals, professional regional theater, and premier shopping venues. Syracuse and Central New York present a wide range of seasonal recreation and attractions ranging from water skiing and snow skiing, hiking in the Adirondacks, touring the historic sites, visiting wineries along the Finger Lakes, and biking on trails along the Erie Canal. EEO Statement Syracuse University is an equal-opportunity, affirmative-action institution. The University prohibits discrimination and harassment based on race, color, creed, religion, sex, gender, national origin, citizenship, ethnicity, marital status, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and gender expression, veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law to the extent prohibited by law. This nondiscrimination policy covers admissions, employment, and access to and treatment in University programs, services, and activities. Commitment to Supporting and Hiring Veterans Syracuse University has a long history of engaging veterans and the military-connected community through its educational programs, community outreach, and employment programs. After World War II, Syracuse University welcomed more than 10,000 returning veterans to our campus, and those veterans literally transformed Syracuse University into the national research institution it is today. The University’s contemporary commitment to veterans builds on this historical legacy, and extends to both class-leading initiatives focused on making an SU degree accessible and affordable to the post-9/11 generation of veterans, and also programs designed to position Syracuse University as the employer of choice for military veterans, members of the Guard and Reserve, and military family members. Commitment to a Diverse and Inclusive Campus Community Syracuse University maintains an inclusive learning environment in which students, faculty, administrators, staff, curriculum, social activities, governance, and all other aspects of campus life reflect a diverse, multi-cultural, and international worldview. The University community recognizes and values the many similarities and differences among individuals and groups. At Syracuse, we are committed to preparing students to understand, live among, appreciate, and work in an inherently diverse country and world made up of people with different ethnic and racial backgrounds, military backgrounds, religious beliefs, socio-economic status, cultural traditions, abilities, sexual orientations and gender identities. To do so, we commit ourselves to promoting a community that celebrates and models the principles of diversity and inclusivity.
