title: Software / Business Analyst
description: The Software Analyst will analyze and document OMH applications, workflow processes, and other strategy, standards and best practices for the NYS Office of Mental Health and other agency needs. The Optimize OMH Applications project is an initiative to update the Office of Mental Health's (OMH) ITS supported Business Applications to align with ITS' overall strategy for applications to be on the current (N) or current - 1 (N-1) version and utilizing shared platforms where possible, thus providing the best support possible for OMH. Responsibilities Daily tasks will include but not limited to the following: Work closely with the project manager, ITS manager, technical team members and other project stakeholders to provide project guidance. Study the business and software application domains to understand the problem space and work with the project team to develop effective software solutions. Work as a liaison to software users and Subject Matter Experts to elicit, analyze, communicate, validate and verify the requirements for complex changes to current business processes, policies and information systems and for the development of new business processes, policies and information systems and to translate requirements into system designs which meet business objectives, adapting more efficient processes where possible. Convey the requirements of the software users to the development team Create business requirements documents, context diagrams, business requirements document (BRD), system “as-is” and “to be” states, system specifications, use cases and workflow diagrams, report and screen mockups, swim lane diagrams, and prototypes. Provide development team with clearly articulated artifacts. Ensure that artifacts required by ITS governance process and Secure Systems Development Lifecycle (SSDLC) are created and support the project scope. Facilitate the adoption of standard patterns and designs which support the application, data and security architecture strategy for applications. Actively adapt to changing technology needs and frameworks to best serve the technical and business needs of the organization. Leverage the Secure Software Development Life Cycle (SSDLC) for all activities. Leverage best practices, patterns and standards for development of new and existing systems. Assist with creating accurate time estimates for the completion of technical documentation and execution tasks. Manage requirements through the life of the contract using a requirements management plan and traceability to ensure coverage between the source of each requirement and the test case(s) it will be tested by. Responsible for any other tasks assigned by management. Job Qualification 7 years of experience performing analysis by eliciting then analyzing the stakeholder’s business needs using a variety of analysis techniques and converting those into verified and validated functional and non-functional requirements for development. 7 years of experience creating and maintaining software development artifacts for communication of requirements, including context diagrams, textual use cases, swim lane diagrams, report specifications, wireframes, user interface specifications, and non-functional requirements specifications. 7 years of experience facilitating requirement workshops, JAD sessions, and structured walkthroughs, practicing effective communication to ensure requirements are understood, conveyed, and met. 6 years of experience creating test plans/cases, managing defects with development teams, and working with users on User Acceptance Testing. 6 years of experience managing requirements throughout the Requirements Management Lifecycle, including creation and execution of a Requirements Management Plan, requirements traceability, establishing requirements baselines, and managing requirements change control. 3 years of experience working with healthcare and billing applications. CBAP (Certified Business Analysis Professional) certification by the International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA). Employment Type: Full Time Years Experience: 10 - 15 years Salary: $53 - $55 Hourly Bonus/Commission: No

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets. title: BUSINESS ANALYST (PMS/PPMS)
description: The Financial Information Services Agency and the Office of Payroll Administration (FISA-OPA) has two vacancies for the position of Business Analyst to support the Citywide Payroll (PMS), and Pension Payroll (PPMS) applications for the Business Support group. The analysts will be accountable for activities related to requirements gathering, analysis, monitoring, and implementation of projects related to PMS, PPMS and CHRMS (Citywide Human Resources Management) Systems. Under general direction, the primary responsibilities of the positions are to: Work in a techno-functional capacity with a strong understanding of business processes and relational databases. Collaborate with the release team to provide analysis, design, development and testing guidance. Analyze and document business requirements, review functional specifications, and business owners for approval, as well as review functional specifications with technical staff during transition to technical design. Under the general direction of the manager, primary responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Conduct requirements gathering sessions with representatives from applicable pension agencies, NYC uniformed and civilian agencies, oversight Agencies, the Department of Education, the NYC Housing Authority, the Office of Payroll Administration, Bureau of Payroll Operations and any other applicable users Prepare design documents, specifications, flowcharts, business and functional requirements Interview and interpret user input to determine scope, timeline and priority request Investigate and propose recommendations for resolution of business and software issues Conduct or assist others in applications testing, planning, coordination and execution activities Plan, manage and provide regular status updates for new work and projects that may involve other agency activities to meet delivery deadlines Provide direct expertise to city agencies related to business processing and functionality, such as pay cycle, payroll deductions, agency/user payroll setup and management, reporting, etc. Prepare timelines, resource plans, initiatives and accomplishments Perform data analysis and interpret results Respond to agencies or third party correspondence and inquiries Preferred Skills Technical as well as business knowledge and experience with the PMS, PPMS, CHRMS, and NYCAPS systems; their interfaces, and associated transaction processing Minimum 5 years of experience creating business/functional requirements and system design documents that provide logical and creative solutions to complex problems. Hands-on activities must include: Decomposing business requirements into detail designs that may cover items such as: functional and framework features, configurations, business rules, and interface file layouts. Minimum 3 years of experience in a project manager or lead analyst position with responsibilities for planning and organizing work, develop short and long-range plans to meet business objectives, and bring subject matter expertise to business interactions and improvement recommendations. Minimum 3 years of experience with timekeeping and payroll methodologies. Demonstrated experience for meeting deadlines by mitigating risks, managing multiple projects simultaneously, recommending process improvements and making decisions. Ability to translate functional and technical requirements into common business terms. Proven experience in designing or configuring systems to meet business processes and relational databases and table structure. Ability to work independently, as well as work in a multi-team environment. Knowledge of payroll, timekeeping and personnel systems and practices Knowledge of processes for VSF, COLA, SADB, 1099 and 1042 Proven management and problem solving skills and related experience is required Ability to plan, manage time according to schedules, and provide management status updates. Application Development experience is a plus Strong understanding of standard SDLC methodologies Experience using MS Office 2010 and later. Proficiency in Microsoft tools including advanced knowledge in Excel, Access, Visio and Project Proficiency in SQL Familiar with New York City agency operations Knowledge of IBM Rational Clear Case and Clear Quest Excellent communication (oral and written), interpersonal, and organizational skills To Apply Applicants may visit the Jobs NYC website: www.nyc.gov/jobs and apply to Job ID: 629470. While all complete applications will be given consideration, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Hours/Shift 35 hours Weekly/Day Work Location 5 Manhattan West Additional Information P-347 / P-554 The City of New York offers a comprehensive set of benefits and programs to employees, including health insurance, pension plan, Deferred Compensation Plan (with 457, 401K and Roth IRA options), pre-tax Commuter Benefit program, pre-tax Flexible Spending Accounts programs and more. Additional benefits such as prescription drug coverage, dental benefits, vision care benefits and more are also available through District Council 37 – Local 2627, the union that represents employees in this title. Minimum Qualifications A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college in computer science, engineering or a related field and four years of satisfactory full-time experience related to information technology service management, process management, operations; A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and eight years of satisfactory full-time experience related to information technology service management, process management, operations; Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. Preferred Skills Technical as well as business knowledge and experience with the PMS, PPMS, CHRMS, and NYCAPS systems their interfaces, and associated transaction processing - Minimum 5 years of experience creating business/functional requirements and system design documents that provide logical and creative solutions to complex problems. Hands-on activities must include: Decomposing business requirements into detail designs that may cover items such as: functional and framework features, configurations, business rules, and interface file layouts. - Minimum 3 years of experience in a project manager or lead analyst position with responsibilities for planning and organizing work, develop short and long-range plans to meet business objectives, and bring subject matter expertise to business interactions and improvement recommendations. - Minimum 3 years of experience with timekeeping and payroll methodologies. - Demonstrated experience for meeting deadlines by mitigating risks, managing multiple projects simultaneously, recommending process improvements and making decisions. - Ability to translate functional and technical requirements into common business terms. - Proven experience in designing or configuring systems to meet business processes and relational databases and table structure. - Ability to work independently, as well as work in a multi-team environment. - Knowledge of payroll, timekeeping and personnel systems and practices - Knowledge of processes for VSF, COLA, SADB, 1099 and 1042 - Proven management and problem solving skills and related experience is required - Ability to plan, manage time according to schedules, and provide management status updates. - Application Development experience is a plus - Strong understanding of standard SDLC methodologies - Experience using MS Office 2010 and later. - Proficiency in Microsoft tools including advanced knowledge in Excel, Access, Visio and Project - Proficiency in SQL - Familiar with New York City agency operations - Knowledge of IBM Rational Clear Case and Clear Quest - Excellent communication (oral and written), interpersonal, and organizational skills Public Service Loan Forgiveness As a prospective employee of the City of New York, you may be eligible for federal loan forgiveness programs and state repayment assistance programs. For more information, please visit the U.S. Department of Education’s website at https://studentaid.gov/pslf/. Residency Requirement New York City Residency is not required for this position. Additional Information The City of New York is an inclusive equal opportunity employer committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse workforce and providing a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment based upon any legally protected status or protected characteristic, including but not limited to an individual's sex, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity, or pregnancy. , $75,000.00 – $130,000.00

title: Analyst - Strategic Analysis Team
description: About Ropes & Gray Ropes & Gray is a preeminent, global law firm. The firm has been ranked in the top-three on The American Lawyer's prestigious "A-List" for seven years and is ranked #1 on Law.com International's "A-List" in the U.K.—rankings that honor the "Best of the Best" firms. The firm has approximately 2,500 lawyers and professionals serving clients in major centers of business, finance, technology, and government in Boston, Chicago, Dublin, Hong Kong, London, Los Angeles, New York, San Francisco, Seoul, Shanghai, Silicon Valley, Singapore, Tokyo and Washington, D.C. The firm has consistently been recognized for its leading practices in many areas, including asset management, private equity, M&A, finance, real estate, tax, antitrust, life sciences, health care, intellectual property, litigation & enforcement, privacy & cybersecurity, and business restructuring. Ropes & Gray is an equal opportunity employer. Overview The Strategic Analysis team combines analytical and data storytelling skills to provide data-driven insights for leaders across the firm. Leveraging our expertise in the firm’s data, business model, strategy, and industry, our team leads collaborative projects to address open-ended business questions and develops novel analytical frameworks to meet evolving business needs. The Analyst plays a crucial role in providing insightful analyses to address high-priority and strategic business questions for firm leadership. This involves conducting in-depth data analysis to support decision-making across multiple departments, including Finance, HR, Client Development, Attorney Talent, and others. To excel in this role, the Analyst must apply their knowledge of the firm’s business model and strategy, as well as their data visualization skills, to effectively connect data and analysis to the business context. The responsibilities of the role are both ad-hoc and project-based and require collecting relevant data, analyzing it in a structured manner, identifying trends and insights, and communicating findings via thoughtful deliverables. Responsibilities Lead open-ended, analytical projects that address key business questions from firm leadership; includes framing the business question, scoping and gathering relevant data, conducting quantitative analysis, and communicating insights using the principles of data storytelling Approach projects with a logical and analytical mindset, independently employing a systematic and structured approach to problem-solving Collect, analyze, structure, and synthesize qualitative and quantitative data from various internal and external sources; use data to identify trends and begin to draw implications Collaborate closely with internal clients and stakeholders to understand their objectives and challenges and tailor analyses accordingly Evaluate results of complex analyses and interpret into actionable recommendations and meaningful insights for firm leadership and other stakeholders Acquire subject matter expertise in the data, systems, and processes across the firm and how they interconnect Develop advanced knowledge of firm structure, clients, and key business drivers to inform analyses for firm leadership Partner with various stakeholders (e.g., financial systems, information technology groups) to identify improvement opportunities in data quality and governance Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in finance, business, management, analytics, or other related field required 2+ years of relevant experience, demonstrating strong analytical skills, project management, and team collaboration Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner Experience with data visualization and storytelling to create compelling and effective presentations Ability to distill complex data into key findings and actionable intelligence Strong organizational and time-management skills, with ability to manage multiple, high-priority projects Comfort with ambiguity and high autonomy on projects High level of initiative and self-motivation Acute attention to detail Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills Adept at querying and analyzing data using business intelligence tools (Tableau, MicroStrategy, or Alteryx is a big plus) Compensation And Total Rewards Package Ropes & Gray is proud to offer a comprehensive Total Rewards package to our business support team members. The firm also offers comprehensive health and well-being benefits, personal and professional development, career growth opportunities and a collegial and supportive culture. The anticipated pay range for this role is $72,500 - $108,000 in NY, which represents our good faith and reasonable estimate of the starting salary range at the time of posting. In addition, this role is eligible for a discretionary bonus based on performance. The actual offered rate for this position will be determined based on job-related, non-discriminatory factors, including qualifications and experience, geographic location, education, external market data and consideration of internal equity. Working Conditions This position requires hybrid on-site presence as an essential function of the role. Consistent and predictable on-site presence is required for ongoing business continuity, professional development and effective collaboration with colleagues and management.
summary: Ropes & Gray, a global law firm, seeks an Analyst for its Strategic Analysis team. The role involves conducting data-driven analysis to support decision-making across departments, including Finance, HR, and Client Development. Responsibilities include leading open-ended projects, collecting and analyzing data, identifying trends, and presenting insights using data storytelling techniques.  The ideal candidate possesses strong analytical and communication skills, experience with data visualization tools, and a keen understanding of the firm's business model.

title: Senior Business Planning Analyst
description: Altice USA is a cutting-edge communications, media, and tech company. We connect people to what matters most to them; texting with friends, advertising that resonates, or binge watching their favorite show. Our differentiated approach centers around technologies that push the envelope and deliver the ultimate customer experience. We’re building a workforce that attracts and retains the best talent, not only to meet the needs of our customers, but that also reflects the diverse communities we serve. Job Summary The Senior Business Planning Analyst will focus on high impact projects and initiatives within the Planning & Control function - including the preparation and development of operating and capital budgets, forecasts, short and long-term business plans, variance and trend analysis. This role is also responsible for overseeing and coordinating the consolidations and distribution of daily, weekly and monthly statistical and financial reports and analysis. The ideal candidate will have previous experience with the preparation and analysis of budgets and forecasts, as well as aspirations to further develop a career in Finance. Responsibilities Direct responsibility for preparing the annual budget and quarterly forecasts for assigned business areas Work closely with business leaders to develop budget/forecast that reflects operational and financial goals of the company and act as a resource to help achieve these goals Assist in the consolidation and reporting of the budgets and forecasts for the department Consolidation and reporting for all operating and capital expenditures Assist in the monthly review and analysis of operating and capital expenditures Assist in the preparation and consolidation of variance analysis Conduct financial and statistical analysis, reporting and tracking for all assigned business areas, supported by commentary and analysis Develop, report, and maintain routine and ad-hoc financial analysis Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field Ability to analyze large amounts of data and develop models for ad-hoc analysis 4+ years' experience in Accounting or Finance, including previous experience in preparation and analysis of budgets and forecasts Excellent oral and written communications skills, with the ability to interact with employees and leaders at all levels Detail oriented with the ability to analyze problems, probe facts and question assumptions Strong Excel skills including advanced formulas, pivot tables, graphs and charts High degree of integrity Ability to analyze and solve problems using fact-based decision-making Altice USA is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to recruiting, hiring and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds regardless of gender, race, color, creed, national origin, religion, age, marital status, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law. Altice USA, Inc. collects personal information about its applicants for employment that may include personal identifiers, professional or employment related information, photos, education information and/or protected classifications under federal and state law. This information is collected for employment purposes, including identification, work authorization, FCRA-compliant background screening, human resource administration and compliance with federal, state and local law. Applicants for employment with Altice will never be asked to provide money (even if reimbursable) as part of the job application or hiring process. Please review our Fraud FAQ for further details This position is identified as being performed in/or reporting to company operations in New York State. Salary ranges are supplied in compliance with New York State law. Pay is competitive and based on a number of job-related factors, including skills and experience. The starting pay rate/range at time of hire for this position in the posted location is $77,112.00 - $126,684.00 / year. The rate/range provided herein is the anticipated pay at the time of hire, and does not reflect future job opportunity.
summary: The Senior Business Planning Analyst will be responsible for creating and managing budgets, forecasts, and long-term business plans. This role will also oversee and coordinate financial and statistical reports and analysis.

title: Business Analyst /Buffalo/ Albany NY, 12 Months Contract
description: IT Digital Transformation Business Analyst The ideal candidate for the role of business analyst should possess a minimum of 10 years of demonstrated expertise in their ability to bridge the gap between business objectives and IT solutions One year with an option for a one-year extension. Scope of Services The Business Analyst focus will be on the IT digital transformation initiatives with the scope of services that encompass key activities crucial for driving organizational efficiency, productivity, and profitability in the digital era. They will thoroughly assess the existing IT landscape, identifying opportunities for improvement and formulate actionable strategies to propel growth and success that are aligned with the IT digital Transformation goals. They will engage inextensive research, meticulously gather, and analyze data, and collaborate closely withstakeholders to gain a deep understanding of their needs, goals, and challenges within thedigital realm. They will provide comprehensive business/program requirements, develop robust business models and create detailed project plans that facilitate effective decision- making throughout the transformation journey. With a pivotal role in implementing and monitoring cutting-edge digital business processes, they will leverage theirs and SUNY's expertise to work with the transformation team to recommend appropriate technology solutions and conduct training sessions to ensure seamless adoption and integration by all affected stakeholders. Another responsibility will be to combine data analysis, process optimization, and project management acumen, to empower the committee's and executive staff to make well-informed decisions, boost operational effectiveness, and gain sustainable competitive advantages in the dynamic digital landscape. The Business Analyst Will Support the Senior Project Director and Implementation Leads with project plans, deliverables, and project artifacts Maintain project library of project plans, deliverables, and project artifacts Develop and maintain an integrated project schedule to track and measure progress across all three initiatives and corresponding subprojects Identify areas for project improvements and efficiencies Manage RACI chart and stakeholder communication Gather budget data as requested and work with budget analyst Conduct cost benefit analysis for software acquisitions and other procurements Draft and deliver stakeholder communications on initiative progress Manage risk/issue and facilitate risk/issue meetings Prepare artifacts and presentations for governing bodies as defined in the Governance Management Plan Collect, analyze, measure, and report on initiative and corresponding subprojects Forecast estimated cost savings Identify budget issues and escalate per the Governance Management Plan Forecast budget allocations and estimated spend Track actual project spend and work with the PMO to prepare monthly budget reports required for timely project reports to the IT Governance Committee The ideal candidate for the role of business analyst should possess a minimum of 10 years of demonstrated expertise in their ability to bridge the gap between business objectives and IT solutions , effectively analyze business process, and propose solutions to enhance operation efficiency, productivity, and profitability specifically tailored for Higher Education or Government projects. With a proven track record in delivering successful enterprise architecture initiatives, this individual will bring valuable insights and strategic guidance to optimize processes, enhance collaboration, and drive digital transformation within Higher Education or Government sectors.
summary: This role involves a Business Analyst with a minimum of 10 years experience bridging business objectives and IT solutions. The focus is on IT digital transformation initiatives in a Higher Education or Government setting. Responsibilities include assessing the IT landscape, gathering and analyzing data, developing business requirements, creating project plans, implementing digital processes, and recommending tech solutions. The analyst will support the Senior Project Director and Implementation Leads with project management tasks, budget analysis, risk management, and communication.

title: Yardi Business Analyst
description: Position: Yardi Business Analyst Location: New York, NY Reports to: SVP, Business Solutions and Technology SUMMARY In this role, the individual will work closely with business areas in ensuring that firm’s ERP system, Yardi, meets company’s needs. They will interface and communicate with the business in managing projects, developing reports, resolving data/process issues. Yardi is a key system for the firm and this individual will be the “go-to” Yardi person. This role is in office 4 days a week. RESPONSIBILITIES Perform administrative/support functions in Yardi and help business departments in using Yardi effectively Work with user groups in gathering, interpreting, analyzing and documenting business requirements Develop project plans/timelines and work-break-down structures and communicate with the business in managing their needs/expectations Design, develop and test reports in Yardi and data visualization dashboards using BI tools Develop design/functional specification documents for business requirements Work with the data engineering team in developing business solutions Communicate and coordinate with business users in gathering requirements and testing/supporting applications Help address audit requests from firm’s internal and external auditors Make recommendation for improving existing processes and suggest better tools where appropriate Be client driven and stay up to date on technological developments in the industry QUALIFICATIONS Experience Level: 7-10 years Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Engineering Hands-on experience in Yardi and familiarity with Investment Management and Debt Manager modules Familiarity with GAAP accounting Excellent data analysis skills with expertise in handling large datasets and time series data Excellent critical reasoning skills with ability to interpret and evaluate business requirements and user needs Excellent Project Management skills and preferably Project Management Professional (PMP) certified Appreciation for and experience with documentation of systems flows and architecture Experience in writing SQLs to be able to extract and analyze business data independently Experience in interfacing with finance/accounting/tax teams Experience with data visualization using Power BI or Tableau Experience is developing project plans with critical success factors, KPIs, work-break-down structures, delivery schedules Excellent communication and presentation skills with experience is developing project proposals, business requirement documents and technical/functional specification documents Highly organized, good eye for detail and process and timeline orientated Experience working on large scale systems and enterprise scale products Strong knowledge of application testing Strong ability to interact effectively with peers, work on own initiative and to adapt to a changing, fast paced, and dynamic work environment across multiple regions and time zones Results oriented, high energy, self-motivated and proven experience supporting high pressure environment preferably in Investment/Trading Total Compensation Range: $170k - $240k (base salary + participation in performance incentive program) The total compensation salary range for this role is posted. Specific compensation is determined through interviews and a review of relevant education, experience, training, skills, geographic location, and alignment with market data. Additionally, company employees may be eligible to receive a discretionary bonus as determined by bonus program guidelines, position eligibility, and Company approval. The Company offers PTO, Paid Sick Time Off, and Paid Holidays, the terms of which are set forth in company policies. Full-time employees are also eligible to participate in various benefit plans, including medical, dental, vision, life, disability insurance, and 401K; in each case in accordance with the terms of the applicable plans. Our company is steadfast in its commitment to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, welcoming applicants from all backgrounds, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. Safehold’s outstanding company culture is built on respect, collaboration, and a shared passion for excellence, creating an environment where every team member feels valued, heard, and empowered to contribute their unique perspectives and ideas. Safehold offers a comprehensive suite of benefits designed to support the health and well-being of our employees and their families. Our company is committed to the ongoing growth and development of our talent, offering opportunities for professional development through training programs and challenging projects. Interested in becoming a key part of our dynamic team? If you meet the qualifications and are eager to embark on this exciting journey, please submit your application by selecting the apply option. We look forward to reviewing your application. COMPANY OVERVIEW Safehold Inc. (NYSE: SAFE) is revolutionizing real estate ownership by providing a new and better way for owners to unlock the value of the land beneath their buildings. Having created the modern ground lease industry in 2017, Safehold continues to help owners of high quality multifamily, office, industrial, hospitality, student housing, life science and mixed-use properties generate higher returns with less risk. The Company, which is taxed as a real estate investment trust (REIT), seeks to deliver safe, growing income and long-term capital appreciation to its shareholders. Additional information on Safehold is available on its website at www.safeholdinc.com . Safehold Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Business Analyst, Performance Internal Controls
description: Brief Description ABOUT GQG PARTNERS GQG Partners is an investment boutique which is a wholly owned subsidiary of a majority employee-owned company listed on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX: GQG). The firm manages global and emerging market equities for institutions, advisors, and individuals worldwide. The company is headquartered in Ft. Lauderdale FL, with offices in New York, Seattle, London, Sydney, and Abu Dhabi. GQG Partners manages more than US $150 billion in client assets as of May 31, 2024 and employs approximately 200 associates worldwide. GQG is passionate about investing and strives for the highest levels of excellence in a competitive industry. It is our responsibility to help investors secure their financial future and we are honored that our clients entrust us with their financial capital. We endeavor to create a business that is closely aligned with our clients’ financial interests. And we strive for success at all levels of our organization through a commitment to independent thinking, continual growth, cultural integrity, and a deep knowledge of the markets. About The Position Job Title: Business Analyst, Performance Internal Controls Manager: Director Employment: Full Time Location: New York, NY Key Responsibilities Assist with the documentation of policies and procedures for the performance and analytics vertical. Strong technical documentation skills are a must as the ideal candidate will interact with various business areas and vendors. Respond to internal and external ad-hoc questions related to data requirements gathering. Advise internal teams to develop process improvements and remediation plans which resolve identified deficiencies. Create and improve data flow diagrams related to describing data workstreams and dependencies. Work independently, with minimal guidance and act as a resource for colleagues for internal audit questions. Work with vendors to resolve pending issues. Assist with ad-hoc project requests. Skillset Expected Previous experience working with in a controls or internal audit function at a buyside asset manager. Familiarity with Sarbanes-Oxley requirements. Ability to create business requirement documents with very technical detail. Ability to query data using SQL or Python. Previous experience creating workflow diagrams and business requirement documents. An understanding of performance calculations Ability to use 3rd party software like Capital IQ, Bloomberg, Northern Trust Excel Add In Qualifications B.S in Business, Finance, Economics, or Statistics 4-6 years working at a buy-side asset manager. (risk or performance business analyst) Collaborate with cross-functional teams to assess internal controls, identify risks, and ensure compliance with SOX regulations. Ability to create business requirement documents. A general understanding of the SOX framework. (Sarbanes–Oxley Section 404) Solid understanding of technology, including software development methodologies, databases, and programming languages. Conduct risk assessments, control testing, and documentation of processes. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. title: Business Administration Analyst (AVP)
description: Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries. As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture. Morgan Stanley (“MS”) is a global financial services firm that conducts its business through three principal business segments—Institutional Securities, Wealth Management, and Asset Management. Wealth Management provides comprehensive financial advice and services to its clients including brokerage, investment advisory, financial and wealth planning, credit & lending, deposits & cash management, annuities, insurance, retirement and trust services. Field Business Management is part of Wealth Management Field Home Office at Morgan Stanley Wealth Management. The Business Administration Analysts’ primary responsibility is strategy, development and execution of Retention Efforts, Automated Flexible Grid (AFG), Advisor Legacy Program (ALP) and Joint Production Agreements (JPA). Position Responsibilities Field interface with Financial Advisors, staff and Field Management in development and execution in business AFG, ALP and JPA. Educate and train enterprise partners and field personal on departmental platforms and processes Point person for cross departmental policy integration, analysis and execution Lead owner of Call Center partnership for field execution and direction Field/Client Communication creation and execution as needed Maintain cross departmental relationships to advance Firm wide strategies Point person with various corporate partners to develop and implement policies, specifically with Human Resources, Finance and FA Comp Daily/monthly/Quarterly reporting and trend analysis on metrics Develop, implement and present key data and metrics to senior management Perform other duties and special projects as assigned Minimum of 5 year of Wealth Management or Industry experience Bachelor’s degree required Strong organizational, project management and analytical skills Strong written and verbal communication skills Direct knowledge of MS Office with emphasis on PowerPoint, Word and Excel Understanding of web technologies and departmental platforms Knowledge of SQL and Dataiku a plus Self-motivated and able to work in a strong team and high activity environment Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects, manage expectations and complete deliverables in a timely manner with exceptional attention to detail Morgan Stanley's goal is to build and maintain a workforce that is diverse in experience and background but uniform in reflecting our standards of integrity and excellence. Consequently, our recruiting efforts reflect our desire to attract and retain the best and brightest from all talent pools. We want to be the first choice for prospective employees. It is the policy of the Firm to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, sex stereotype, gender, gender identity or expression, transgender, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, pregnancy, veteran or military service status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce (M/F/Disability/Vet). Expected base pay rates for the role will be between 85000 and 135000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base pay if hired will be determined on an individualized basis and is only part of the total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, incentive compensation, discretionary bonuses, other short and long-term incentive packages, and other Morgan Stanley sponsored benefit programs. Posting Date May 28, 2024 Primary Location Americas-United States of America-New York-Purchase Education Level Bachelor's Degree Job Wealth Management Employment Type Full Time Job Level Assistant Vice President
summary: Morgan Stanley is seeking a Business Administration Analyst for their Wealth Management Field Home Office in Purchase, NY. title: Healthcare Business Analyst (HIE)
description: CTG is seeking an experienced Business Analyst (BA) focusing on Health Information Exchange (HIE) for a remote role. Location: Remote Duration: 6 months Duties: Requirements Gathering and Analysis: Work with healthcare providers, HIE organizations, and other stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements for health information exchange. Document and validate workflows, ensuring they meet ONC standards and support seamless data exchange. Regulatory Compliance and Standards: Ensure that HIE solutions comply with ONC regulations and standards, including those related to interoperability, data privacy, and security. Stay informed about updates to ONC guidelines and policies, and implement necessary changes in the HIE systems. Interoperability and Data Standards: Promote the use of standardized protocols such as HL7, FHIR, and CDA for data exchange. Work on integrating disparate health IT systems to facilitate the smooth flow of information across platforms. Data Management and Quality Assurance: Monitor and analyze data exchanges to ensure accuracy, completeness, and consistency. Implement data validation and quality assurance processes to maintain high data integrity within the HIE. Stakeholder Engagement and Communication: Serve as a bridge between healthcare providers, IT teams, and regulatory bodies to ensure alignment on HIE initiatives. Communicate technical requirements and solutions in an understandable manner to non-technical stakeholders. Project Management: Lead or contribute to HIE projects, from planning and design through to implementation and evaluation. Develop project plans, manage timelines, and ensure adherence to budgets. Process Improvement: Identify and recommend improvements to HIE processes and workflows. Implement best practices to enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and improve data exchange reliability. Training and Support: Provide training to healthcare staff and other users on HIE systems and processes. Offer ongoing support and troubleshooting for HIE-related issues. Skills: Proficiency in HIE platforms and technologies. Familiarity with interoperability standards (HL7, FHIR, CDA, XDS). Knowledge of data analytics and database management. Deep understanding of ONC regulations and standards for health information exchange. Awareness of healthcare privacy and security requirements (e.g., HIPAA). Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Capability to interpret complex data and generate actionable insights. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to translate technical jargon into layman's terms for diverse stakeholders. Experience managing HIE or healthcare IT projects. Proficiency in project management tools and methodologies. Education: Bachelor's Degree Excellent verbal and written English communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group are required. CTG does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee based recruitment services for this role. To Apply: To be considered, please apply directly to this requisition using the link provided . For additional information, please contact Anisha Muralidhar at Anisha.Muralidhar@ctg.com . Kindly forward this to any other interested parties. Thank you! The expected base salary for this position ranges from $115,000 to $140,000.  Salary offers are based on a wide range of factors including relevant skills, training, experience, education, market factors, and where applicable, licensure or certifications obtained.  In addition to salary, a competitive benefit package is also offered.
summary: CTG seeks a remote Business Analyst with experience in Health Information Exchange (HIE) for a 6-month contract. title: Business Analyst II 2383 070324
description: Position Summary The Business Analyst II is responsible for providing direct support to ConServe’s Operations and development teams by working collaboratively with IT developers in each phase of the enhancement lifecycle for CCMS application improvement initiatives. Under the direction of the Director of Application Management, the Business Analyst II actively supports operations with a particular emphasis on requirements gathering, quality testing, analysis, and detailed understanding of the functionality of CCMS user facing application functionality. Essential Duties & Responsibilities Understanding how the CCMS solutions are developed from the requirements and functional specifications and the ability to assess that the proposed solutions are valid prior to the development of such solutions. Understanding the business process workflows and how they interact within the CCMS to ensure they are providing the proper solutions. Power user knowledge of the CCMS software to assist end users in understanding how the system operates and ability to assist IT by identifying and troubleshooting issues. Collaborate with Subject Matter Experts (SME’s) to elicit and document end user expectations combined with ability to collaborate with IT to understand and interpret functional specifications to ensure there is a minimal gap between user expectations and delivered CCMS solutions. Create system test plans from functional specifications and identify proper business case test scenarios that should be included in these plans. Understanding what parts of the CCMS solution are involved in the execution of the test plans and ability to expertly analyze results for proper pass/fail classification, follow up and acceptance. Understanding of the SDLC and ability to identify gaps within ConServe’s enhancement process. Analyze and understand requirements for updates to business processes, identifying areas of focus for changes and making recommendations on how the CCMS needs to be modified to enable these changes. Knowledge of all documentation relating to CCMS and the ability to maintain such documentation, so it properly reflects the current environment. Provide guidance and support the end users in their efforts to become more proficient in the use of the applications. Troubleshoots production issues, identifying root cause and assisting end users in submitting issues and examples for IT to resolve. Support business processes for data exchanges with Clients, vendors, and other outside entities. Act as point of contact on an as-needed basis for projects and vendor/client implementations. Assist IT Management with IT Prioritization processes, including analysis of new work orders/requests from the business and organizing priorities across departments. Monitor and support IT job processing environment; verifying job execution, handling job and ETL failures. Perform analysis if an issue arises with a scheduled process and assist developers and end-users with recovery steps. Generate Ad-hoc reports as needed. Maintains applicable documentation with regard to change management. Adherence to ConServe’s Blueprint Quality Management System, Code of Conduct, and Compliance Program. Non-Essential Duties & Responsibilities Other duties as assigned Education High School Diploma or GED Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, Finance or equivalent combinationof education and related experience. Skills/ Requirements Three (3) years of Business Analysis/Process or related experience. Solid experience with Microsoft Office suite of products. Intermediate SQL and database skills with the ability to read and write complex SQL statements that may include multiple levels of joins and/or subqueries. Ability to multitask. Ability to act independently to resolve problems. Excellent analytical and communication skills. Excellent organizational skills Must show a sense of urgency, being able to perform and multitask under pressure. Must be able to provide on-call support on a rotating basis. U.S. Citizenship or lawful Permanent Resident alien with three or more years as a permanent resident in the United States. Ability to obtain and maintain Government Security Clearance. No conflicts of interest with ConServe or our Clients. summary: The Business Analyst II supports ConServe's Operations and development teams by working with IT developers on CCMS (Customer Care Management System) application improvement initiatives.
